.	O

Uninitialized	O
(	O
non-static	O
)	O
local	O
variables	O
have	O
an	O
indeterminate	O
value	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
will	O
seem	O
to	O

random	O
.	O

As	O
the	O

is	O
indeterminate	O
(	O
and	O
seemingly	O
random	O
)	O
the	O
scanf	O
call	O
will	O
write	O
to	O
some	O
unknown	O

in	O
memory	O
,	O
overwriting	O
whatever	O
was	O
there	O
.	O

You	O
could	O

by	O

input	O
an	O
array	B-Skill
.	O

I	O

a	O
C#	B-Skill
/.NET	B-Skill
application	O
that	O

to	O

following	O
update	O
:	O

This	O
is	O

of	O
code	O
is	O
run	O
in	O
the	O

.	O

records	O
.	O

Deadlock	O
graph	B-Skill

Yes	O
,	O

this	O

example	O

is	O

"	O

"	O
query	O
which	O
does	O
some	O
[	O
Options	O
]	O
calculation	O
in	O
C#	B-Skill
,	O
bulk	O
inserts	O
back	O
into	O
SQL	B-Skill
and	O
updates	O
later	O
in	O
a	O
concurrent	O
mode	O
speeds	O
up	O
the	O
thing	O
significantly	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
just	O
like	O
to	O
stick	O
to	O
this	O
concurrent	O
approach	O
regardless	O
of	O
the	O
task	O
(	O

reset	O
vs	O
CPU	O
intensive	O
work	O
)	O
if	O
possible	O
.	O

Any	O
suggestion	O
how	O
to	O
work	O
around	O
the	O
deadlock	O
is	O
appreciated	O
.	O

suggested	O
by	O
@KamranFarzami	O

the	O
answer	O
by	O
@Grantly	O

my	O

.	O

point	O
for	O
answering	O
this	O
question	O
goes	O
to	O
them	O
.	O

Transaction	O
Isolation	O
Level	O
of	O
SNAPSHOT	O
prevents	O
deadlocks	O
from	O
ocurring	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
accomplish	O

following	O
and	O
I	O
do	O

know	O
why	O
I	O
am	O
struggling	O
.	O

Create	O
a	O
new	O
fiddle	O
that	O
contains	O
a	O
button	O
with	O
the	O
text	O
"	O
x2	O

the	O
number	O
1	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

1	O
x2	O

Use	O
Javascript	B-Skill
to	O
make	O
it	O
so	O
that	O
each	O
time	O
the	O
button	O
is	O
clicked	O
,	O
the	O
number	O
above	O
the	O
x2	O
button	O
will	O
double	O
.	O

Send	O
me	O
the	O
link	O
to	O
the	O
fiddle	B-Skill
.	O

Here	O
is	O
what	O
I	O
have	O
thus	O
far	O
.	O

I	O
know	O
I	O
am	O
targeting	O
the	O
button	O
via	O
JS	B-Skill
but	O
I	O
cannot	O
figure	O
out	O
how	O
to	O
return	O
the	O
updated	O
value	O
when	O
the	O
x2	O
button	O
is	O
clicked	O
.	O

Try	O
this	O
:	O

Look	O
at	O
what	O
this	O
code	O
is	O
doing	O
:	O

You	O
are	O
multiplying	O
an	O
element	O
by	O
two	O
,	O
you	O
are	O
NOT	O
reading	O
the	O
text	O
.	O

You	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
innerHTML	O
or	O
textContent	O
.	O

That	O
returns	O
a	O
string	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
parseInt()	O
or	O
parseFloat()	O
.	O

If	O
we	O
override	O
parent	O
class	O
's	O
method	O
,	O
we	O
can	O
use	O
super()	O
to	O
avoid	O
mention	O
of	O
parent	O
class	O
's	O
name	O
that	O
's	O
clear	O
.	O

But	O
what	O
about	O
case	O
,	O
when	O
we	O
just	O
use	O
in	O
subclass	O
some	O
function	O
defined	O
in	O
parent	O
class	O
?	O

What	O
is	O
preferable	O
way	O
:	O
to	O
use	O
super().parent_method()	O
or	O
self.parent_method()	O
?	O

Or	O
there	O
's	O
no	O
difference	O
?	O

actually	O
super()	O
is	O
not	O
syntactic	O
sugar	O
,	O
its	O
purpose	O
is	O
to	O
invoke	O
parent	O
implementation	O
of	O
a	O
certain	O
method	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
super()	O
when	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
override	O
a	O
parent	O
method	O
,	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
super()	O
when	O
instead	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
overwrite	O
a	O
method	O
.	O

The	O
difference	O
is	O
that	O
in	O
the	O
first	O
case	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
add	O
extra	O
behavior	O
(	O
aka	O
code	O
execution	O
)	O
before	O
or	O
after	O
the	O
original	O
implementation	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
second	O
you	O
want	O
a	O
completely	O
different	O
implementation	O
.	O

You	O
ca	O
n't	O
use	O
self.method_name()	O
in	O
an	O
override	O
,	O
the	O
result	O
will	O
be	O
a	O
recursion	O
error	O
!	O

(	O
RuntimeError	O
:	O
maximum	O
recursion	O
depth	O
exceeded	O
)	O

Example	O
:	O

Given	O
a	O
base	O
class	O
A	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
method	O
m	O
,	O
B	O
extends	O
A	O
by	O
overriding	O
m	O
,	O
C	O
extends	O
A	O
by	O
overwriting	O
m	O
,	O
and	O
D	O
generates	O
an	O
error	O
!	O

EDIT	O
:	O

I	O
just	O
realized	O
that	O
you	O
actually	O
have	O
2	O
different	O
methods	O
(	O
test_a	O
and	O
test_b	O
)	O
.	O

My	O
answer	O
is	O
still	O
valid	O
,	O
but	O
regarding	O
your	O
specific	O
scenario	O
:	O

you	O
should	O
use	O
self.test_a()	O
unless	O
you	O
override/overwrite	O
that	O
method	O
in	O
your	O
class	O
B	O
and	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
execute	O
the	O
original	O
implementation.	O
.	O
so	O
we	O
can	O
say	O
that	O
calling	O
super().test_a()	O
or	O
self.test_a()	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
same	O
given	O
that	O
you	O
'll	O
never	O
override/overwrite	O
the	O
original	O
test_a()	O
in	O
your	O
subclasses.	O
.	O
however	O
is	O
a	O
nonsense	O
to	O
use	O
super()	O
if	O
not	O
for	O
an	O
override/overwrite	O

Usually	O
you	O
will	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
self.test_a()	O
to	O
call	O
an	O
inherited	O
method	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
in	O
some	O
rare	O
situations	O
you	O
might	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
super().test_a()	O
even	O
though	O
it	O
seems	O
to	O
do	O
the	O
same	O
thing	O
.	O

They	O
're	O
not	O
equivalent	O
,	O
even	O
though	O
they	O
have	O
the	O
same	O
behavior	O
in	O
your	O
example	O
.	O

To	O
explore	O
the	O
differences	O
,	O
lets	O
make	O
two	O
versions	O
of	O
your	O
B	O
class	O
,	O
one	O
with	O
each	O
kind	O
of	O
call	O
,	O
then	O
make	O
two	O
C	O
classes	O
that	O
further	O
extend	O
the	O
B	O
classes	O
and	O
override	O
test_a	O
:	O

When	O
you	O
call	O
the	O
test_b()	O
method	O
on	O
C1	O
and	O
C2	O
instances	O
you	O
'll	O
get	O
different	O
results	O
,	O
even	O
though	O
B1	O
and	O
B2	O
behave	O
the	O
same	O
:	O

This	O
is	O
because	O
the	O
super()	O
call	O
in	O
B2.test_b	O
tells	O
Python	B-Skill
that	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
skip	O
the	O
version	O
of	O
test_a	O
in	O
any	O
more	O
derived	O
class	O
and	O
always	O
call	O
an	O
implementation	O
from	O
a	O
parent	O
class	O
.	O

(	O
Actually	O
,	O
I	O
suppose	O
it	O
could	O
be	O
a	O
sibling	O
class	O
in	O
a	O
multiple	O
inheritance	O
situation	O
,	O
but	O
that	O
's	O
getting	O
even	O
more	O
obscure	O
.	O
)	O

Like	O
I	O
said	O
at	O
the	O
top	O
,	O
you	O
usually	O
want	O
to	O
allow	O
a	O
more-derived	O
class	O
like	O
the	O
Cs	O
to	O
override	O
the	O
behavior	O
of	O
the	O
inherited	O
methods	O
you	O
're	O
calling	O
in	O
your	O
less-derived	O
class	O
.	O

That	O
means	O
that	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
using	O
self.whatever	O
is	O
the	O
way	O
to	O
go	O
.	O

You	O
only	O
need	O
to	O
use	O
super	O
when	O
you	O
're	O
doing	O
something	O
fancy	O
.	O

I	O
'd	O
like	O
to	O
change	O
an	O
object	O
's	O
parameter	O
,	O
but	O

to	O

later	O

.	O

,	O

.	O

Here	O
's	O
a	O

:	O

How	O
to	O
make	O
a	O

that	O
returns	O
what	O

parameter	O

?	O

Alternatively	O

parameter	O
to	O

?	O

(	O
I	O
..	O
thought	O
about	O
switch	O
statement	O
.	O

Is	O
a	O
good	O
direction	O
?	O
)	O

I	O
'm	O
pretty	O
sure	O
that	O
's	O
something	O
that	O
has	O
already	O
been	O

.	O

I	O
've	O

everything	O
about	O
functions	O
and	O
could	O

find	O
the	O
solution	O
,	O
so	O
I	O
guess	O
I	O
'm	O
searching	O
using	O
wrong	O
keywords	O
.	O

If	O
Carinherits	O
from	O
NSObject	O
you	O
get	O
key-value-coding	O
for	O
free	O
and	O
can	O
change	O
the	O
value	O
with	O
setValue:forKey	O

You	O
do	O

need	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
function	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
KVC	O
like	O
this	O
after	O
you	O
inherit	O
from	O
NSObject	O
,	O

you	O
can	O

a	O

func	O
that	O
guards	O
again	O
bad	O
property	O
names	O
.	O

Keep	O
in	O

that	O
this	O
code	O
will	O
crash	O
if	O
you	O
enter	O
bad	O
property	O
names	O
.	O

Hope	O
this	O
answers	O
your	O
question	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
been	O
using	O
haskell	B-Skill
for	O
a	O
while	O
now	O
.	O

I	O
understand	O
most/some	O
of	O
the	O
concepts	O
but	O
I	O
still	O
do	O
not	O
understand	O
,	O
what	O
exactly	O
does	O
haskells	B-Skill
type	O
system	O
allow	O
me	O
to	O
do	O
that	O
I	O
cannot	O
do	O
in	O
another	O
statically	O
typed	O
language	O
.	O

I	O
just	O
intuitively	O
know	O
that	O
haskells	B-Skill
type	O
system	O
is	O
better	O
in	O
every	O
imaginable	O
way	O
compared	O
to	O
the	O
type	O
system	O
in	O
C	B-Skill
,	O
C++	B-Skill
or	O
java	B-Skill
,	O
but	O
I	O
ca	O
n't	O
explain	O
it	O
logically	O
,	O
primarily	O
because	O
of	O
a	O
lack	O
of	O
in	O
depth	O
knowledge	O
about	O
the	O
differences	O
in	O
type	O
systems	O
between	O
haskell	B-Skill
and	O
other	O
statically	O
typed	O
languages	O
.	O

Could	O
someone	O
give	O
me	O
examples	O
of	O
how	O
haskells	B-Skill
type	O
system	O
is	O
more	O
helpful	O
compared	O
to	O
a	O
language	O
with	O
a	O
static	O
type	O
system	O
.	O

Examples	O
,	O
that	O
are	O
terse	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
succinctly	O
expressed	O
would	O
be	O
nice	O
.	O

The	O
Haskell	B-Skill
type	O
system	O
has	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
features	O
which	O
all	O
exist	O
in	O
other	O
languages	O
,	O
but	O
are	O
rarely	O
combined	O
within	O
a	O
single	O
,	O
consistent	O
language	O
:	O

it	O
is	O
a	O
sound	O
,	O
static	O
type	O
system	O
,	O
meaning	O
that	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
errors	O
are	O
guaranteed	O
not	O
to	O
happen	O
at	O
runtime	O
without	O
needing	O
runtime	O
type	O
checks	O
(	O
this	O
is	O
also	O
the	O
case	O
in	O
Caml	B-Skill
,	O
SML	B-Skill
and	O
almost	O
the	O
case	O
in	O
Java	B-Skill
,	O
but	O
not	O
in	O
,	O
say	O
,	O
Lisp	B-Skill
,	O
Python	B-Skill
,	O
C	B-Skill
,	O
or	O
C++	B-Skill
)	O
;	O

it	O
peforms	O
static	O
type	O
reconstruction	O
,	O
meaning	O
that	O
the	O
programmer	O
does	O
n't	O
need	O
to	O
write	O
types	O
unless	O
he	O
wants	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
compiler	B-Skill
will	O
reconstruct	O
them	O
on	O
its	O
own	O
(	O
this	O
is	O
also	O
the	O
case	O
in	O
Caml	B-Skill
and	O
SML	B-Skill
,	O
but	O
not	O
in	O
Java	B-Skill
or	O
C	B-Skill
)	O
;	O

it	O
supports	O
impredicative	O
polymorphism	O
(	O
type	O
variables	O
)	O
,	O
even	O
at	O
higher	O
kinds	O
(	O
unlike	O
Caml	B-Skill
and	O
SML	B-Skill
,	O
or	O
any	O
other	O
production-ready	O
language	O
known	O
to	O
me	O
)	O
;	O

it	O
has	O
good	O
support	O
for	O
overloading	O
(	O
type	O
classes	O
)	O
(	O
unlike	O
Caml	B-Skill
and	O
SML	B-Skill
)	O
.	O

Whether	O
any	O
of	O
those	O
make	O
Haskell	B-Skill
a	O
better	O
language	O
is	O
open	O
to	O
discussion	O
—	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
while	O
I	O
happen	O
to	O
like	O
type	O
classes	O
a	O
lot	O
,	O
I	O
know	O
quite	O
a	O
few	O
Caml	B-Skill
programmers	O
who	O
strongly	O
dislike	O
overloading	O
and	O
prefer	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
module	O
system	O
.	O

On	O
the	O
other	O
hand	O
,	O
the	O
Haskell	B-Skill
type	O
system	O
lacks	O
a	O
few	O
features	O
that	O
other	O
languages	O
support	O
elegantly	O
:	O

it	O
has	O
no	O
support	O
for	O
runtime	O
dispatch	O
(	O
unlike	O
Java	B-Skill
,	O
Lisp	B-Skill
,	O
and	O
Julia	B-Skill
)	O
;	O

it	O
has	O
no	O
support	O
for	O
existential	O
types	O
and	O
GADTs	O
(	O
these	O
are	O
both	O
GHC	O
extensions	O
)	O
;	O

it	O
has	O
no	O
support	O
for	O
dependent	O
types	O
(	O
unlike	O
Coq	B-Skill
,	O
Agda	B-Skill
and	O
Idris	B-Skill
)	O
.	O

Again	O
,	O
whether	O
any	O
of	O
these	O
are	O
desirable	O
features	O
in	O
a	O
general-purpose	O
programming	O
language	O
is	O
open	O
to	O
discussion	O
.	O

One	O
major	O
difference	O
between	O
Haskell	B-Skill
's	O
type	O
system	O
and	O
that	O
of	O
most	O
OO	O
languages	O
is	O
that	O
the	O
ability	O
for	O
a	O
function	O
to	O
have	O
side	O
effects	O
is	O
represented	O
by	O
a	O
data	O
type	O
(	O
a	O
monad	O
such	O
as	O
IO	O
)	O
.	O

This	O
allows	O
you	O
to	O
write	O
pure	O
functions	O
that	O
the	O
compiler	B-Skill
can	O
verify	O
are	O
side-effect-free	O
and	O
referentially	O
transparent	O
,	O
which	O
generally	O
means	O
that	O
they	O
're	O
easier	O
to	O
understand	O
and	O
less	O
prone	O
to	O
bugs	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
possible	O
to	O
write	O
side-effect-free	O
code	O
in	O
other	O
languages	O
,	O
but	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
the	O
compiler	B-Skill
's	O
help	O
in	O
doing	O
so	O
.	O

Haskell	B-Skill
makes	O
you	O
think	O
more	O
carefully	O
about	O
which	O
parts	O
of	O
your	O
program	O
need	O
to	O
have	O
side	O
effects	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
I/O	O
or	O
mutable	O
variables	O
)	O
and	O
which	O
parts	O
should	O
be	O
pure	O
.	O

Also	O
,	O
although	O
it	O
's	O
not	O
quite	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
type	O
system	O
itself	O
,	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
function	O
definitions	O
in	O
Haskell	B-Skill
are	O
expressions	O
(	O
rather	O
than	O
lists	O
of	O
statements	O
)	O
means	O
that	O
more	O
of	O
the	O
code	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
type-checking	O
.	O

In	O
languages	O
like	O
C++	B-Skill
and	O
Java	B-Skill
,	O
it	O
's	O
often	O
possible	O
to	O
introduce	O
logic	O
errors	O
by	O
writing	O
statements	O
in	O
the	O
wrong	O
order	O
,	O
since	O
the	O
compiler	B-Skill
does	O
n't	O
have	O
a	O
way	O
to	O
determine	O
that	O
one	O
statement	O
must	O
precede	O
another	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
you	O
might	O
have	O
one	O
line	O
that	O
modifies	O
an	O
object	O
's	O
state	O
,	O
and	O
another	O
line	O
that	O
does	O
something	O
important	O
based	O
on	O
that	O
state	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
's	O
up	O
to	O
you	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
these	O
things	O
happen	O
in	O
the	O
correct	O
order	O
.	O

In	O
Haskell	B-Skill
,	O
this	O
kind	O
of	O
ordering	O
dependency	O
tends	O
to	O
be	O
expressed	O
through	O
function	O
composition	O
—	O
e.g	O
.	O
f	O
(	O
g	O
x	O
)	O
means	O
that	O
g	O
must	O
run	O
first	O
—	O
and	O
the	O
compiler	B-Skill
can	O
check	O
the	O
return	O
type	O
of	O
g	O
against	O
the	O
argument	O
type	O
of	O
f	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
you	O
have	O
n't	O
composed	O
them	O
the	O
wrong	O
way	O
.	O

Hashtable	O
is	O

very	O

no	O

for	O
use	O
.	O

It	O
is	O

or	O

.	O

It	O

did	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

've	O

.	O

I	O

"	O

My	O

:	O

between	O
ActionWebService	B-Skill
and	O

or	O
am	O
I	O

something	O
wrong	O
?	O

Is	O
my	O
URL	O
correct	O
for	O
a	O
rails	B-Skill
web-service	O
?	O

This	O
has	O
probably	O
been	O
answered	O
elsewhere	O
,	O
but	O
since	O
this	O
question	O
pops	O
up	O
when	O
searching	O
google	O
for	O
actionwebservice	B-Skill
and	O

requests	O
,	O
I	O
thought	O

would	O
answer	O
it	O
here	O
.	O

By	O
default	O
AWS	B-Skill
refuses	O
non-POST	O
requests	O
.	O

Specifically	O
it	O
has	O
code	O
in	O
action_controller_dispatcher.rb	O
that	O
reads	O
:	O

Basically	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
either	O
set	O
up	O
the	O
request	O
to	O
POST	O
the	O
request	O
instead	O
of	O
GETting	O
it	O
.	O

Or	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
override	O
AWS	B-Skill
's	O
handling	O
of	O
GET	O
requests	O
.	O

(	O
You	O
might	O
try	O
editing	O
the	O
code	O
inside	O
the	O
gem	O
,	O
but	O
(	O
1)	O
that	O
will	O
get	O
overwritten	O
when	O
you	O
update	O
the	O
gem	O
and	O
(	O
2)	O
I	O
'm	O
not	O
sure	O
how	O
good	O
an	O
idea	O
that	O
is	O
in	O
general	O
and	O
(	O
3)	O
I	O
've	O
never	O
tried	O
it	O
.	O

The	O
former	O
is	O
likely	O
more	O
appropriate	O
if	O
you	O
have	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
code	O
generating	O
the	O
request	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
,	O
Zack	O
Chandler	O
had	O
a	O

Yes	O

with	O

shards	O
does	O

limit	O
the	O

of	O

.	O

you	O

will	O
just	O

.	O

This	O
means	O
that	O
for	O
each	O
consumers	O

you	O
can	O
only	O
have	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
shards	O
of	O
concurrent	O
executions	O
.	O

doc	O
for	O

a	O

:	O

:	O

:	O

:	O

'	O
foo	O
'	O
:	O
This	O
element	O
is	O
not	O
expected	O
.	O

Expected	O
is	O
one	O
of	O
(	O
{url}foo	O
,	O
{url}bar	O
)	O
.	O

What	O
is	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
'	O
foo	O
'	O
and	O
'{url}foo'	O
and	O
how	O
to	O
fix	O
this	O

?	O

The	O
notation	O
{url}foo	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
refer	O
to	O
an	O
expanded	O
name	O
whose	O
namespace	O
part	O
is	O
url	O
and	O
whose	O
local	O
name	O
part	O
is	O
foo	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
sometimes	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
'	O
Clark	O
notation	O
'	O
for	O
James	O
Clark	O
,	O
who	O
promoted	O
it	O
.	O

When	O
this	O
notation	O
is	O
in	O
use	O
,	O
unqualified	O
names	O
are	O
sometimes	O
referred	O
to	O
using	O
the	O
notation	O
{}foo	O
and	O
sometimes	O
(	O
as	O
in	O
your	O
error	O
message	O
)	O
using	O
the	O
notation	O
foo	O
.	O

The	O
error	O
message	O
is	O
telling	O
you	O
that	O
it	O
has	O
found	O
an	O
element	O
with	O
the	O
unqualified	O
name	O
foo	O
,	O
at	O
a	O

where	O
it	O
was	O

namespace-qualfied	O
element	O

either	O
foo	O
or	O
bar	O
in	O
the	O
namespace	O
url	O
.	O

:	O

XML	B-Skill
instance	O
lacks	O
a	O
required	O
namespace	O
declaration	O
.	O

,	O

to	O

of	O
nearest	O

(	O
i.e	O
.	O

Aj)	O
>	O
1	O
,	O

the	O

,	O

!=	O
j	O
)	O
Example	O
,	O
let	O
the	O
array	B-Skill
be	O

The	O
answer	O
will	O
be	O

I	O
've	O
written	O
this	O
brute	O
force	O
code	O
(	O
which	O
is	O
O(n^2))	O
using	O
Binary	B-Skill
GCD	I-Skill
method	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
not	O
very	O
efficient	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
wondering	O
if	O
there	O
's	O
a	O
faster	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
.	O

Particularly	O
in	O
O(NlogN)	O

If	O
you	O
know	O
your	O
max	O
value	O
for	O
your	O
numbers	O
and	O
can	O
afford	O
to	O
keep	O
a	O
list	B-Skill
of	O
primes	O
,	O
then	O
factoring	O
them	O
may	O
be	O
a	O
better	O
solution	O
for	O
the	O
average/random	O
case	O
.	O

Otherwise	O
,	O
worst	O
case	O
complexity	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
still	O
O(N*N)	O
think	O
"	O
all	O
of	O
them	O
are	O
primes	O
"	O
for	O
the	O
worst	O
case	O
.	O

Approach	O
:	O

factor	O
them	O
and	O
store	O
a	O
Map[N]	O
+	O
int	O
closestNeigh[]	O

take	O
a	O
factor	O
and	O
O(N)	O
determine	O
for	O
each	O
of	O
them	O
the	O
closest	O
that	O
contain	O
that	O
factor	O
(	O
prefix/sufix	O
sums	O
will	O
be	O
involved	O
)	O

eliminate	O
that	O
factor	O
from	O
all	O
the	O
factor	O
maps	O

take	O
the	O
next	O
factor	O
.	O

Adjust	O
the	O
closest	O
neighbor	O
index	O
only	O
if	O
new	O
one	O
is	O
closest	O
.	O

This	O
may	O
bring	O
some	O
"	O
relief	O
"	O
on	O
the	O
line	O
of	O
O	O
(	O
N*	O
<num_distict_factors>	O
)	O
,	O
but	O
again	O
if	O
<num_distict_factors>	O
==	O
N	O
(	O
all	O
primes	O
)	O
,	O
then	O
it	O
is	O
still	O
O(N*N)	O

If	O
you	O
are	O
willing	O
to	O
get	O
into	O
factorization	O
,	O
one	O
could	O
traverse	O
the	O
list	B-Skill
,	O
once	O
from	O
the	O
left	O
,	O
factoring	O

number	O
,	O

index	O
of	O
each	O
new	O
prime	O
(	O
with	O
the	O
prime	O
as	O
the	O
key	O
)	O
,	O
updating	O
the	O
index	O
of	O
each	O
prime	O
already	O
seen	O
,	O
and	O
,	O
of	O
course	O
,	O
noting	O
the	O
nearest	O
seen	O
prime	O
.	O

Since	O
this	O
traversal	O
would	O
miss	O
the	O
nearest	O
on	O
the	O
right	O
,	O
conduct	O
another	O
traversal	O
from	O
the	O
right	O
to	O
update	O
any	O
nearer	O
shared	O
prime	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
factor	O
lists	B-Skill
already	O
saved	O
.	O

I	O
just	O

,	O

/	O

of	O

,	O

Here	O

.	O

I	O

and	O

like	O
this	O
but	O

not	O

:	O

I	O

like	O
to	O

an	O

this	O
when	O

a	O

Seems	O
like	O
a	O
simple	O
transformation	O
to	O
me	O
:	O

You	O
can	O
try	O
this	O
:	O

If	O

does	O

work	O
,	O

do	O

"	O

"	O
on	O
"	O
$responses	O
"	O

"	O

"	O
because	O
we	O
did	O

view	O
how	O
this	O
variable	O
is	O
exactly	O
defined	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
created	O
a	O
custom	O
iterator	O
,	O
inheriting	O
from	O
there	O
iter	O
class	O
in	O
the	O
iterators	B-Skill
package	O
.	O

The	O
iterator	O
and	O
its	O
methods	O
are	O
not	O
exported	O
from	O
the	O
package	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
the	O
iterator	O
and	O
a	O
test	O
function	O
in	O
a	O
script	O
that	O
is	O
reproducible	O
and	O
runnable	O
,	O
the	O
iterator	O
is	O
called	O
pairsRef	O
:	O

code	O

my	O
mac(Python3.4.1,OS10.9)	O

When	O
you	O
save	O
the	O
file	O
in	O
Notepad	B-Skill
,	O
the	O
file	O
is	O
reencoded	O
to	O
be	O
saved	O
as	O
your	O
default	O
file	O
encoding	O
for	O
your	O
Windows	B-Skill
installation	O
.	O

Notepad	B-Skill
auto-detected	O
the	O
encoding	O
when	O
it	O
opened	O
the	O
file	O
,	O
however	O
.	O

Python	B-Skill
opens	O
file	O
using	O
that	O
same	O
system	O
encoding	O
,	O
by	O
default	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
why	O
you	O
can	O
now	O
open	O
the	O
file	O
.	O

Quoting	O
the	O
open()	O
function	O
documentation	O
:	O

You	O
'll	O
have	O
to	O
explicitly	O
specify	O
the	O
correct	O
encoding	O
for	O
the	O
file	O
if	O
you	O
wanted	O
to	O
open	O
it	O
directly	O
in	O
Python	B-Skill
:	O

I	O
used	O
'	O
utf-8-sig	O
'	O
as	O
an	O
example	O
here	O
,	O
as	O
that	O
is	O
a	O
file	O
encoding	O
that	O
Notepad	B-Skill
can	O
auto-detect	O
.	O

It	O
could	O
well	O
be	O
that	O
the	O
encoding	O
is	O
UTF-16	O
or	O
plain	O
UTF-8	O
or	O
any	O
number	O
of	O
other	O
encodings	O
,	O
however	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
think	O
that	O
the	O
page	O
is	O
encoded	O
with	O
a	O
specific	O
ANSI	O
codepage	O
you	O
still	O
have	O
to	O
name	O
the	O
exact	O
codepage	O
.	O

Your	O
system	O
is	O
configured	O
to	O
use	O
code	O
page	O
936	O
(	O
GBK	O
)	O
but	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
the	O
correct	O
encoding	O
for	O
this	O
file	O
.	O

See	O
the	O
codecs	B-Skill
module	O
for	O
a	O
list	O
of	O
supported	O
encodings	O
.	O

Compile	O
the	O
following	O
class	O

using	O
gcc	O
-fdump-class-hierarchy	O
.	O

gcc	O
emits	O

What	O
is	O
the	O
significance	O
of	O
"	O
nearly-empty	O
"	O
?	O

What	O
does	O
it	O
mean	O
?	O

I	O
suppose	O
it	O
's	O
to	O
differentiate	O
it	O
from	O
"	O
empty	O
"	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
what	O
you	O
get	O
if	O
compile	O
a	O
class	O
with	O
no	O
members	O
at	O
all	O
.	O

"	O
nearly-empty	O
"	O
seems	O
to	O
mean	O
it	O
hasa	O
vtable	B-Skill
and	O
nothing	O
else	O
.	O

The	O
C++	B-Skill
ABI	O
provides	O
a	O
definition	O
of	O
"	O
nearly	O
empty	O
"	O

overhead	O
.	O

.	O

obj	O
,	O

NOT	O

login	O
success	O
or	O
not	O
)	O
,	O
timeout	O
is	O
number	O
(	O
NOT	O

)	O
.	O

.	O

I	O
am	O
working	O
on	O
an	O
MVC5	B-Skill
application	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
having	O
a	O
problem	O
getting	O
the	O
server-side	B-Skill
validation	O
of	O
number	O
fields	O
to	O
work	O
for	O
the	O
specific	O
culture	O
(	O
de-CH	O
)	O
.	O

It	O
really	O
feels	O
like	O

is	O
defaulting	O
to	O
the	O
standard	O
German	O
format	O
.	O

I	O
have	O

the	O
web.config	O
globalization	O
:	O

I	O
am	O
not	O
using	O
any	O

,	O
so	O
from	O
what	O
I	O
understand	O
the	O
uiCulture	O
does	O
not	O
come	O
into	O
play	O
.	O

The	O
client	B-Skill
is	O
using	O
jquery.globalize	O
and	O
correctly	O
loading	O
and	O
using	O
the	O
de-CH	O
culture	O
.	O

reports	O
the	O
proper	O
culture	O
of	O
'	O
de-CH	O
'	O
on	O
both	O
machines	O
.	O

Locally	O

validates	O
100.00	O
as	O
correct	O
,	O
but	O
on	O
the	O
server	B-Skill
it	O

that	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
number	O
.	O

All	O
of	O
this	O
works	O
properly	O
on	O
my	O
local	O
Win7	B-Skill
IIS7	O
instance	O
.	O

Though	O
when	O
we	O
install	O
it	O
on	O
the	O
client	B-Skill
Win8	B-Skill
server	B-Skill
it	O
does	O
not	O
work	O
anymore	O
.	O

The	O
client-side	B-Skill
is	O
validating	O
numbers	O
properly	O
for	O
the	O
de-CH	O
culture	O
'	O
0.00	O
'	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
server	B-Skill
rejects	O
them	O
as	O
invalid	O
.	O

The	O
Date	O
formats	O
ARE	O
however	O
working	O
,	O
which	O
just	O
adds	O
to	O
the	O
confusion	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
where	O
I	O
wonder	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
somehow	O
falling	O
back	O
to	O
de-DE	O
where	O
the	O
date	O
formats	O
are	O
the	O
same	O
but	O
the	O
number	O
format	O
is	O
'	O
0	O
,	O
00	O
'	O
.	O

Does	O
a	O
server	B-Skill
have	O
to	O
have	O
a	O
specific	O
culture	O
enabled/installed	O
?	O

Or	O
any	O
other	O
ideas	O
to	O
check	O
?	O

Finally	O
we	O
figured	O
out	O
the	O
problem	O
.	O

Apparently	O
there	O
are	O
registry	O
settings	O
for	O
the	O
culture	O
on	O
the	O
server	B-Skill
that	O
were	O
set	O
to	O
de-AT	O
.	O

These	O
somehow	O
were	O
being	O
honored	O
above	O
the	O
Web.Config	O
settings	O
.	O

I	O
need	O
to	O
somehow	O
extract	O
plain	O
HTTP	O
request	O
message	O
from	O
a	O
Request	O
object	O
in	O
Scrapy	B-Skill
(	O
so	O
that	O
I	O
could	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
copy/paste	O
this	O
request	O
and	O
run	O
from	O
Burp	B-Skill
)	O
.	O

So	O
given	O
a	O
scrapy.http.Request	O
object	O
,	O
I	O
would	O
like	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
corresponding	O
request	O
message	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
e.g	O
.	O

Clearly	O
I	O
have	O
all	O
the	O
information	O
I	O
need	O
in	O
the	O
Request	O
object	O
,	O
however	O
trying	O
to	O
reconstruct	O
the	O
message	O
manually	O
is	O
error-prone	O
as	O
I	O
could	O
miss	O
some	O
edge	O
cases	O
.	O

My	O
understanding	O
is	O
that	O
Scrapy	B-Skill
first	O
converts	O
this	O
Request	O
into	O
Twisted	B-Skill
object	O
,	O
which	O
then	O
writes	O
headers	O
and	O
body	O
into	O
a	O
TCP	O
transport	O
.	O

So	O
maybe	O
there	O
's	O
away	O
to	O
do	O
something	O
similar	O
,	O
but	O
write	O
to	O
a	O
string	O
instead	O
?	O

UPDATE	O

I	O
could	O
use	O
the	O
following	O
code	O
to	O
get	O
HTTP	O
1.0	O
request	O
message	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
http.py	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
a	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
something	O
similar	O
with	O
HTTP	O
1.1	O
requests	O
/	O
http11.py	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
what	O
's	O
actually	O
being	O
sent	O
?	O

I	O
would	O
obviously	O
like	O
to	O
avoid	O
duplicating	O
code	O
from	O
Scrapy/Twisted	B-Skill
frameworks	O
as	O
much	O
as	O
possible	O
.	O

As	O
scrapy	B-Skill
is	O
open	O
source	O
and	O
also	O
has	O
plenty	O
of	O
extension	O
points	O
,	O
this	O
should	O
be	O
doable	O
.	O

The	O
requests	O
are	O
finally	O
assembled	O
and	O
sent	O
out	O
in	O
scrapy/core/downloader/handlers/http11.py	O
in	O
ScrapyAgent.download_request	O
(	O
https://github.com/scrapy/scrapy/blob/master/scrapy/core/downloader/handlers/http11.py#L270	O
)	O

If	O
you	O
place	O
your	O
hook	O
there	O
you	O
can	O
dump	O
the	O
request	O
type	O
,	O
request	O
headers	O
,	O
and	O
request	O
body	O
.	O

To	O
place	O
your	O
code	O
there	O
you	O
can	O
either	O
try	O
monkey	O
patching	O
ScrapyAgent.download_request	O
or	O
to	O
subclass	O
ScrapyAgent	O
to	O
do	O
the	O
request	O
logging	O
,	O
then	O
subclass	O
HTTP11DownloadHandler	O
to	O
use	O
your	O
Scrapy	B-Skill
Agent	O
and	O
then	O
set	O
HTTP11DownloadHandler	O
as	O
new	O
DOWNLOAD_HANDLER	O
for	O
http	O
/	O
https	O
requests	O
in	O
your	O
project	O
's	O
settings.py	O
(	O
for	O
details	O
see	O
:	O
https://doc.scrapy.org/en/latest/topics/settings.html#download-handlers	O
)	O

In	O
my	O
opinion	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
closest	O
you	O
can	O
get	O
to	O
logging	O
the	O
requests	O
going	O
out	O
without	O
using	O
a	O
packet	O
sniffer	O
or	O
a	O
logging	O
proxy	O
(	O
which	O
might	O
be	O
a	O
bit	O
overkill	O
for	O
your	O
scenario	O
)	O
.	O

From	O
the	O
documentation	O
:	O

"	O
Assigning	O
to	O
size	O
,	O
width	O
or	O
height	O
changes	O
the	O
dimensions	O
of	O
the	O
rectangle	O
"	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
the	O
following	O
circle	O
,	O
assign	O
a	O
new	O
attribute	O
but	O
no	O
changes	O
can	O
be	O
seen	O
in	O
circle	O
.	O

What	O
am	O
i	O
doing	O
wrong	O
?	O

You	O
draw	O
the	O
circle	O
on	O
the	O
screen	O
surface	O
.	O

Every	O
drawing	O
function	O
then	O
returns	O
a	O
Rect	O
,	O
but	O
:	O

To	O
actually	O
change	O
the	O
circle	O
on	O
the	O
screen	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
erase	O
it	O
first	O
(	O
draw	O
something	O
above	O
it	O
)	O
,	O
then	O
draw	O
a	O
new	O
circle	O
in	O
the	O
size	O
you	O
want	O
.	O

Here	O
's	O
a	O
simple	O
example	O
:	O

I	O
am	O
attempting	O
to	O
up-sample	O
an	O
icosahedron	O
in	O
MATLAB	B-Skill
by	O
adding	O
new	O
vertices	O
at	O
the	O
mid-points	O
of	O
each	O
edge	O
and	O
recomputing	O
the	O
faces	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
managed	O
to	O
place	O
the	O
new	O
vertices	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
ca	O
n't	O
figure	O
out	O
how	O
to	O
recompute	O
the	O
new	O
faces	O
.	O

I	O
want	O
each	O
vertex	O
to	O
connect	O
to	O
its	O
closest	O
neighbours	O
to	O
form	O
a	O
new	O
,	O
up-sampled	O
icosahedron	O
.	O

Sample	O
data	O
:	O

Code	O
:	O

For	O
a	O
triangle	O
{	O
1	O
,	O
2	O
,	O
3}	O
,	O
subdividing	O
will	O
create	O
3	O
new	O
vertices	O
{	O
a	O
,	O
b	O
,	O
c}	O
:	O

It	O
will	O
also	O
create	O
4	O
new	O
faces	O
:	O

Your	O
code	O
creates	O
the	O
coordinates	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
vertices	O
in	O
V	O
such	O
that	O
the	O
a	O
vertices	O
for	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
triangles	O
come	O
first	O
,	O
followed	O
by	O
the	O
c	O
vertices	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
the	O
b	O
vertices	O
.	O

First	O
let	O
's	O
generate	O
the	O
indices	O
of	O
these	O
vertices	O
.	O

The	O
new	O
indices	O
start	O
from	O
size(S.vertices)+1	O
and	O
there	O
are	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
3*size(S.faces)	O
of	O
them	O
.	O

Let	O
's	O
also	O
group	O
the	O
new	O
vertices	O
for	O
a	O
each	O
existing	O
face	O
together	O
.	O

This	O
gives	O
us	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
[	O
a	O
b	O
c	O
]	O
faces	O
(	O
actually	O
,	O
in	O
[	O
a	O
c	O
b	O
]	O
order	O
)	O
in	O
Vx(f,:)	O
with	O
the	O
a	O
vertices	O
in	O
Vx(:,1)	O
,	O
the	O
b	O
vertices	O
in	O
Vx(:,3)<-	O
not	O
2	O
!	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
c	O
vertices	O
in	O
Vx(:,2)	O
.	O

Now	O
we	O
need	O
to	O
create	O
the	O
other	O
3	O
new	O
faces	O
for	O
each	O
existing	O
face	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
do	O
this	O
using	O
cat	O
,	O
permute	O
and	O
reshape	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
gets	O
really	O
ugly	O
and	O
incomprehensible	O
.	O

Since	O
we	O
've	O
only	O
got	O
9	O
vertices	O
that	O
go	O
into	O
these	O
faces	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
easier	O
to	O
just	O
plug	O
them	O
in	O
manually	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
m	O
x	O
9	O
matrix	B-Skill
and	O
then	O
reshape	O
into	O
m*3	O
x	O
3	O
:	O

Now	O
all	O
that	O
's	O
left	O
is	O
updating	O
S	O
:	O

So	O
at	O
this	O
point	O
I	O
am	O
running	O
the	O
app	O
by	O
the	O
command	O
:	O
nodemon	O
server.js	O
,	O
I	O
did	O
not	O
deploy	O
.	O

I	O
created	O
a	O
Bitnami	B-Skill
powered	O
compute	O
engine	O
machine	O
that	O
has	O
MongoDB	B-Skill
installed	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
works	O
when	O
I	O
log	O
in	O
to	O
it	O
.	O

From	O
my	O
nodejs	B-Skill
App	O
engine	O
I	O
connect	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

The	O
error	O
I	O
get	O
is	O
:	O

I	O
tried	O
ssh-ing	O
into	O
the	O
compute	O
engine	O
and	O
I	O
did	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

adding	O
perimision	O
for	O
port	O
27017	O
:	O

gcloud	O
compute	O
firewall-rules	O
create	O
allow-mongodb	O
--allow	O
tcp:27017	O

It	O
said	O
it	O
already	O
exist	O
.	O

I	O
changed	O
in	O
mongodb.config	O
in	O
bind_ip	O
to	O
0.0.0.0	O
.	O

Still	O
nothing	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
very	O
frustating	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
have	O
any	O
idea	O
I	O
would	O
very	O
much	O
apreciate	O
it	O
.	O

As	O
a	O
mention	O
,	O
I	O
do	O
not	O
have	O
a	O
lot	O
of	O
experience	O
with	O
this	O
,	O
so	O
please	O
be	O
explicit	O
.	O

I	O
usually	O
do	O
this	O
:	O

I	O
hope	O
helped	O
.	O

I	O
need	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
virtual	B-Skill
printer	I-Skill
that	O
'	O
shreds	O
'	O

Basically	O
here	O
is	O
my	O
problem	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
software	O
program	O
that	O
needs	O
to	O
'	O
print	O
'	O
a	O
file	O
before	O
it	O
will	O
save	O
it	O
.	O

I	O
want	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
print	O
to	O
my	O
shredder	O
so	O
that	O

the	O
document	O
,	O
but	O
I	O

n't	O
actually	O
want	O
the	O
document	O
printed	O
.	O

So	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
print	O
to	O
a	O
program	O
that	O
securely	O
deletes	O
the	O
document	O
and	O
shows	O
as	O
a	O
driver	B-Skill
in	O
Windows	B-Skill
.	O

How	O
would	O
I	O
go	O
about	O
doing	O
this	O
in	O
C#	B-Skill
of	O
VB.Net	B-Skill
?	O

No	O
need	O
to	O
write	O
code	O
for	O
this	O
just	O
print	O
to	O
nul	O
.	O

This	O
has	O
worked	O
since	O
DOS	B-Skill
.	O

Just	O
create	O
a	O
new	O
printer	O
,	O
printing	O
to	O
a	O
local	O
port	O
,	O
and	O
put	O
nul	O
in	O
there	O
for	O
the	O
port	O
name	O
.	O

http://www.markmmanning.com/blog/2009/01/creating-fake-printer-devnull-for.html	O

I	O
'm	O
generating	O
PDF	O
files	O
using	O
an	O
old	O
library	O
of	O
iText	B-Skill
on	O
Unix	B-Skill
.	O

Everything	O
is	O
going	O
fine	O
,	O
but	O
my	O
exploitation	O
team	O
has	O
just	O
contacted	O
me	O
telling	O
they	O
are	O

troubles	O

.	O

After	O
a	O

they	O
indicate	O

a	O

of	O
"	O
Acroaxxxxx	O
"	O

are	O
created	O
under	O
/tmp	O
folder	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
checking	O
it	O
and	O
the	O
files	O
are	O
the	O
same	O
I	O
generate	O
with	O
my	O
application	O
,	O
but	O
my	O
code	O
is	O
not	O
handling	O
this	O
.	O

My	O
question	O
is	O
quite	O
simple	O
:	O
can	O
I	O
modify	O
or	O
add	O
something	O
to	O
my	O
code	O
to	O
indicate	O
to	O
iText	B-Skill
to	O
delete	O
the	O

file	O
created	O
during	O
the	O
process	O
?	O

Thnks	O
!	O

This	O
works	O

(	O
'sessionID'	O
,	O
session_id()	O
,	O
TRUE	O
)	O

BUT	O

it	O
only	O

on	O

of	O
PHP	O
files	O
which	O
set	O
the	O
variable	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
like	O

sessionID	O
to	O
appear	O
on	O
all	O

including	O
js	O
,	O
jpg	O
,	O
gif	O
etc	O
referred	O
from	O
the	O
PHP	O
file	O
.	O

i.e	O
.	O
all	O
the	O
files	O
in	O
the	O
PHP	O
file	O
.	O

I	O
thought	O
that	O
by	O
setting	O
an	O
apache	B-Skill
environment	O
variable	O
the	O
variable	O
scope	O
would	O

it	O
available	O
for	O
every	O

from	O
the	O

file	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
any	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
?	O

p.s	O
.	O
I	O
tried	O
setting	O
apache	O
note	O
first	O
and	O
that	O
returns	O
exactly	O
the	O

.	O

Getting	O
"	O

error	O
:	O

to	O

or	O
response	O
is	O
empty	O
"	O
when	O
I	O

to	O

to	O
authorize.net	B-Skill
.	O

Authorize.net	B-Skill
cannot	O

anything	O
coming	O
through	O
,	O
host	O
provider	O
says	O
no	O

.	O

I	O
am	O
using	O
the	O

payment	O
type	O

I	O

cURL	B-Skill
SSL	I-Skill

have	O

are	O

.	O

I	O
am	O
not	O

debugging	O
is	O
on	O

and	O

are	O
below	O
.	O

i	O

Turns	O

I	O

.	O

Tools	B-Skill
(	O
top	O

)	O
>	O
Fraud	O

AIM	O
ip	O
addresses	O
(	O
body	O
,	O
second	O

item	O
)	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
doing	O
a	O
database	O
project	O
for	O
university	O
and	O
I	O
'm	O
having	O
a	O
problem	O
in	O
here	O
.	O

I	O
receive	O
from	O
a	O
previous	O
page	O

.	O

.	O

I	O

and	O

just	O
ca	O
n't	O
find	O
what	O
is	O

in	O
here	O
.	O

change	O
inside	O
your	O
form	O
this	O
input	O
hidden	O
you	O
created	O
:	O

to	O

If	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
echoing	O
this	O
value	O
,	O
$_POST['ids']	O
wo	O
n't	O
be	O
get	O
any	O
value	O
passed	O
from	O
form	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
query	O
the	O
latest	O
insert	O
made	O
to	O
the	O
table	B-Skill
,	O
Azure	B-Skill
Mobile	I-Skill
Service	I-Skill
adds	O
by	O
default	O
the	O

column	B-Skill
.	O

So	O
,	O
I	O
am	O
planning	O
to	O

the	O

according	O
to	O
that	O
specific	O
column	B-Skill
,	O
since	O
__createdAt	O
is	O
a	O

.	O

I	O
thought	O
of	O
adding	O
it	O
to	O
my	O
table	B-Skill
model	O
.	O

Now	O
my	O
question	O
is	O
:	O
how	O
to	O
query	O
this	O
in	O

server-side	B-Skill
.	O

The	O

.	O

So	O

of	O
something	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

You	O
move	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
processing	O
before	O
you	O
start	O
to	O
output	O
anything	O
to	O

browser	B-Skill

.	O

Which	O

a	O

something	O

this	O
:	O

It	O

your	O
PHP	B-Skill
code	O
much	O

the	O

.	O

,	O

.	O

The	O
not	O

I	O
have	O
this	O
code	O
in	O
a	O
.html.erb	O
file	O
:	O

This	O
is	O
working	O

,	O
and	O

@consumer	O

.	O

:	O

Where	O
facebook_consumer.js	O
looks	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

It	O
will	O

this	O
:	O

You	O
liked	O
<%=	O
@consumer.name	O
%>	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
tried	O
saving	O
the	O
file	O
as	O
js.erb	O
,	O
but	O
then	O
it	O
seems	O
it	O
does	O
n't	O
know	O
what	O
@consumer	O
is	O
.	O

Any	O
thoughts	O
on	O
what	O
is	O
the	O
best	O
approach	O
?	O

You	O
ca	O
n't	O
inline	O
Ruby	B-Skill
code	O
into	O
.js	O
files	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
Ruby	B-Skill
code	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
.js.erb	O
file	O
and	O
then	O
render	O
a	O
partial	O
inside	O
of	O
that	O
.	O

Your	O
best	O
bet	O
is	O
probably	O
to	O
create	O
an	O
app-wide	O
JS	B-Skill
object	O
to	O
store	O
values	O
you	O
need	O
.	O

At	O
the	O
top	O
of	O
the	O
page	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
add	O
elements	O
to	O
this	O
object	O
,	O
and	O
they	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
to	O
your	O
linked	O
scripts	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
a	O
multi	O
threaded	O
scenario	O
.	O

The	O
main	O
thread	O
handles	O
the	O
application	O
and	O
UI	O
events	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
starts	O
up	O
a	O
new	O
thread	O
to	O
do	O
some	O
background	O
operations	O
.	O

The	O
"	O
background	O
"	O
thread	O
loads	O
the	O
data	O
from	O
files	O
into	O
a	O
data-table	O
of	O
a	O
strongly-typed	O
dataset	O
.	O

The	O
DataGridView	O
is	O
bound	O
to	O
that	O
DataTable	O
.	O

Once	O
the	O
data	O
is	O
ready	O
,	O
the	O
"	O
background	O
"	O
thread	O
invokes	O
the	O
refresh()	O
function	O
of	O
the	O
DataGridView	O
on	O
the	O
form	O
.	O

If	O
there	O
are	O
more	O
lines	O
then	O
what	O
fits	O
on	O
one	O
screen	O
and	O
the	O
vertical	O
scrollbar	O
is	O
to	O
appear	O
:	O
the	O
grid	O
crashes	O
.	O

The	O
new	O
datalines	O
are	O
always	O
displayed	O
.	O

Error	O
only	O
occurs	O
if	O
there	O
are	O
enough	O
lines	O
to	O
display	O
the	O
scrollbar	O
(	O
see	O
image	O
below	O
)	O
.	O

I	O
use	O
.NET	B-Skill
3.5	O
.	O

In	O
Windows	B-Skill
XP	O
it	O
crashes	O
the	O
whole	O
application	O
.	O

On	O
Win	B-Skill
7	O
(	O
64	O
bit	O
)	O
only	O
the	O
grid	O
becomes	O
unresponsive	O
,	O
but	O
once	O
I	O
resize	O
the	O
window	O
the	O
scrollbar	O
appears	O
and	O
all	O
is	O
fine	O
.	O

The	O
relevant	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
code	O
are	O
attached	O
below	O
.	O

Grid	O
refresh	O
operation	O
in	O
the	O
form	O
's	O
.cs	O
file	O
:	O

The	O
update	O
part	O
in	O
the	O
"	O
background	O
"	O
thread	O
:	O

The	O
objects	O
related	O
to	O
the	O
"	O
background	O
"	O
thread	O
have	O
a	O
direct	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
DataSet	O
(	O
UiDataSource	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
DataTable	O
(	O
CurrentSamples	O
)	O
is	O
updated	O
in	O
the	O
following	O
manner	O
:	O

DataGridView	O
options	O
:	O

If	O
I	O
made	O
a	O
mistake	O
somewhere	O
please	O
point	O
it	O
out	O
to	O
me	O
.	O

@ChrisF	O
:	O

I	O
tried	O
removing	O
the	O
refresh()	O
statement	O
,	O
as	O
I	O
am	O
doing	O
pretty	O
much	O
the	O
same	O
what	O
u	O
suggested	O
.	O

The	O
only	O
difference	O
is	O
the	O
databinding	O
,	O
it	O
looks	O
like	O
:	O

And	O
I	O
update	O
the	O
dataTable	O
in	O
a	O
similar	O
way	O
,	O
but	O
from	O
another	O
thread	O
.	O

But	O
the	O
new	O
data	O
lines	O
do	O
not	O
appear	O
until	O
I	O
,	O
say	O
,	O
resize	O
the	O
window	O
.	O

Which	O
raises	O
the	O
question	O
how	O
I	O
can	O
properly	O
update	O
the	O
dataTable	O
from	O
another	O
thread	O
?	O

I	O
'm	O
guessing	O
the	O
problem	O
has	O
to	O
do	O
with	O
how	O
WinForms	B-Skill
works	O
inside	O
the	O
STA	O
model	O
for	O
threading	O
.	O

Basically	O
,	O
the	O
DataTable	O
you	O
're	O
accessing	O
is	O
located	O
somewhere	O
,	O
and	O
that	O
is	O
probably	O
inside	O
the	O
form	O
we	O
see	O
above	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
when	O
you	O
update	O
the	O
DataTable	O
from	O
another	O
thread	O
,	O
which	O
thread	O
gets	O
the	O
events	O
needed	O
for	O
binding	O
?	O

Likely	O
the	O
thread	O
you	O
update	O
it	O
from	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
form	O
's	O
thread	O
is	O
not	O
aware	O
of	O
the	O
changes	O
being	O
made	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
you	O
simply	O
need	O
to	O
invoke	O
any	O
calls	O
to	O
DataTable	O
onto	O
the	O
form	O
itself	O
,	O
so	O
it	O
receives	O
the	O
events	O
properly	O
:	O

It	O
seems	O
backwards	O
,	O
but	O
keep	O
in	O
mind	O
in	O
an	O
"	O
enterprise	O
"	O
situation	O
,	O
you	O
'd	O
probably	O
be	O
accessing	O
that	O
dataset	O
by	O
multiple	O
adapters	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
your	O
update	O
thread	O
would	O
have	O
an	O
adapter	O
to	O
itself	O
,	O
and	O
your	O
GUI	O
would	O
have	O
its	O
own	O
also	O
.	O

The	O
other	O
solution	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
BindingList	O
,	O
which	O
I	O
believe	O
has	O
thread	O
compatibility	O
for	O
this	O
type	O
of	O
situation	O
,	O
but	O
do	O
n't	O
quote	O
me	O
on	O
that	O
.	O

For	O
extra	O
credit	O
,	O
this	O
could	O
also	O
explain	O
your	O
problem	O
before	O
with	O
crashing	O
.	O

By	O
accessing	O
the	O
DataGridView	O
from	O
the	O
background	O
thread	O
,	O
you	O
had	O
cross-thread	O
operations	O
going	O
on	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
n't	O
call	O
:	O

These	O
will	O
take	O
progressively	O
longer	O
and	O
longer	O
as	O
the	O
data	O
set	O
gets	O
larger	O
and	O
larger	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
written	O
an	O
application	O
that	O
uses	O
a	O
DataGridView	O
to	O
display	O
mp3	O
file	O
information	O
.	O

I	O
set	O
the	O
DataSource	O
of	O

I	O
understand	O
that	O
a	O
service	O
can	O
run	O
in	O
two	O

started	O
and	O
bound	O
.	O

What	O
I	O
do	O

quite	O
understand	O
from	O
the	O
developer	O
docs	O
or	O
other	O
questions	O
on	O
this	O
site	O
,	O
is	O
whether	O
a	O
service	O
running	O
as	O
both	O
started	O
and	O
bound	O
will	O
exit	O
when	O
the	O
last	O
component	O
unbinds	O
from	O
it	O
?	O

If	O
something	O
called	O
startService()	O
on	O
the	O
Service	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
remain	O
running	O
,	O
regardless	O
of	O
what	O
bindService()	O
and	O
unbindService()	O
calls	O
may	O
have	O
gone	O
on	O
.	O

Eventually	O
,	O
Android	B-Skill
will	O
stop	O
the	O
service	O
,	O
or	O
the	O
user	O
will	O
kill	O
the	O
service	O
,	O
but	O
neither	O
will	O
happen	O
immediately	O
upon	O
the	O
last	O
unbindService()	O
.	O

.	O

for	O
being	O
so	O
lost	O
.	O

In	O
a	O
shared	O
spreadsheet	O
to	O
prevents	O
any	O
other	O
user	O
but	O
myself	O
from	O
adding	O
,	O
deleting	O
or	O
updating	O
a	O
column	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
need	O
a	O
script	O
.	O

When	O
you	O
say	O
prevent	O
them	O
updating	O
a	O
column	O
that	O
implies	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
want	O
them	O
to	O
have	O
write	O
access	O
.	O

Either	O
this	O
is	O
to	O
a	O
particular	O
column	O
or	O
to	O
any	O
column	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
set	O
protection	O
to	O
one	O
of	O
view	O
only	O
,	O
comment	O
only	O
to	O
;	O

the	O
entire	O
spreadsheet	O

individual	O
sheets	O
or	O

areas	O
within	O
a	O
sheet	O

If	O
you	O
do	O
any	O
of	O
these	O
they	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
delete	O
the	O
column	O
either	O
.	O

Reading	O
your	O
code	O
,	O
the	O
line	O
;	O

Implies	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
check	O
if	O
they	O
have	O
modified	O
your	O
sheet	O
on	O
a	O
row	O
basis	O
.	O

To	O
prevent	O
them	O
inserting	O
or	O
deleting	O
a	O
row	O
,	O

create	O
a	O
blank	O
column	O

protect	O
the	O
column	O
from	O
editing	O

hide	O
the	O
column	O

If	O
anyone	O
tries	O
to	O
add	O
or	O
delete	O
a	O
row	O
,	O
this	O
will	O
span	O
the	O
hidden	O
protected	O
column	O
and	O
they	O
will	O
get	O
an	O
error	O
message	O
telling	O
them	O
this	O
.	O

Now	O
the	O
only	O
onEdit(e)	O
you	O
will	O
detect	O
with	O
be	O
the	O
editing	O
of	O
a	O
cell	O
or	O
group	O
of	O
cells	O
.	O

Note	O
that	O
adding/deleting	O
rows	O
will	O
not	O
trigger	O
onEdit()	O
,	O
they	O
will	O
trigger	O
onChange()	O
.	O

Within	O
this	O
there	O
is	O
specific	O
way	O
to	O
tell	O
whether	O
a	O
row	O
has	O
been	O
deleted	O
or	O
inserted	O
.	O

will	O

look	O
at	O
the	O
range	O
that	O
has	O
been	O
affected	O

:	O

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.controls.datagrid%28v=vs.110%29.aspx	O

:	O

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.data.multibinding%28v=vs.110%29.aspx	O

The	O
general	O
way	O
to	O
achieve	O
your	O
requirement	O
is	O
to	O
implement	O
an	O
ICommand	O
type	O
Attached	O
Property	O
for	O
each	O
event	O
that	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
replace	O
.	O

The	O
basic	O
idea	O
is	O
this.	O
.	O
add	O
an	O
ICommand	O
Attached	O
Property	O
with	O
a	O
PropertyChangedCallback	O
handler	O
.	O

In	O
this	O
handler	O
(	O
which	O
will	O
be	O
called	O
when	O
an	O
ICommand	O
is	O
data	O
bound	O
to	O
this	O
property	O
)	O
,	O
attach	O
a	O
handler	O
to	O
the	O
event	O
that	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
handle	O
.	O

Then	O
,	O
when	O
that	O
event	O
is	O
called	O
,	O
just	O
execute	O
the	O
ICommand	O
instance	O
.	O

So	O
you	O
can	O
handle	O
the	O
event	O
in	O
your	O
view	O
model	O
via	O
the	O
ICommand	O
instance	O
.	O

is	O
an	O
example	O

the	O

event	O
:	O

has	O

when	O
used	O
in	O

.	O

(	O

)	O

using	O
php	B-Skill
.	O

You	O
can	O

function	O

@Barmar	O

can	O

a	O
function	O
.	O

called	O

this	O
will	O
be	O
the	O
element	O
that	O
's	O
being	O
replaced	O
.	O

return	O
value	O
will	O
be	O
used	O
as	O
the	O
replacement	O
.	O

is	O
after	O
successful	O

when	O

I	O
am	O
using	O
CCavenue	B-Skill
Payment	I-Skill
Gateway	I-Skill
developed	O
by	O
bluezeal.in	O
.	O

as	O

=	O

http://'.htmlspecialchars($_SERVER['HTTP_HOST'	O

,	O
'	O

'	O

.	O

'	O

,	O

key	O
in	O

settings.	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
empty	O
a	O
directory	O
using	O
the	O
rm	O
program	O
.	O

I	O
capture	O
a	O
path	O
into	O
a	O
variable	O
and	O
go	O
to	O
use	O
this	O
like	O
so	O
:	O

There	O
certainly	O
is	O
such	O
a	O
directory	O
at	O
the	O
path	O
.	O

When	O
I	O
try	O
this	O
manually	O
,	O
without	O
a	O
variable	O
,	O
it	O
works	O
as	O
expected	O
.	O

You	O
're	O
using	O
fancy	O
quotes	O
in	O
your	O
assignment	O
of	O
export_folder_path	O
.	O

These	O
slanted	O
Unicode	O
quotes	O
are	O
not	O
recognized	O
as	O
quotes	O
by	O
bash	B-Skill
,	O
and	O
are	O
therefore	O
treated	O
as	O
literals	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
usually	O
due	O
to	O
copypasting	O
from	O
blogs	O
,	O
or	O
using	O
an	O
editor	B-Skill
or	O
OS	O
not	O
intended	O
for	O
programmers	O
such	O
as	O
Word	B-Skill
or	O
macOS	B-Skill
.	O

Replace	O
them	O
with	O
regular	O
ASCII	O
double	O
quotes	O
in	O
your	O
script	O
,	O
and	O
disable	O
"	O
smart	O
quotes	O
"	O
in	O
your	O
editor	B-Skill
or	O
OS	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
are	O
sure	O
about	O
removing	O
the	O
directory	O
along	O
with	O
its	O
contents	O
,	O
I	O
would	O
advise	O
this	O
:	O

The	O
double	O
quotes	O
will	O
take	O
care	O
of	O
any	O
spaces	O
in	O
the	O
name	O
of	O
the	O
directory	O
.	O

Had	O
a	O
bit	O
of	O
a	O
"	O
is	O
this	O
real	O
life	O
moment	O
"	O
.	O

Why	O
are	O
we	O
naming	O
mutators	O
with	O
get	O
and	O
set	O
prefixes	O
:	O

It	O
would	O
just	O
as	O
easy	O
and	O
understandable	O
to	O
just	O
do	O

myMember	O
(	O
myMember	O
Member	O
)	O

as	O
setMyMember	O
and	O
getMyMember	O

Is	O
there	O
a	O
historical	O
reason	O
why	O
Java	B-Skill
has	O
this	O
style	O
?	O

The	O
get*	O
and	O
set*	O
style	O
of	O
naming	O
is	O
specified	O
in	O
the	O
JavaBeans	O
specification	O
,	O
and	O
some	O
libraries	O
using	O
reflection	O
expect	O
this	O
style	O
to	O
be	O
used	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
Jackson	O
mapper	O
can	O
serialize	O
a	O
java	B-Skill
object	O
using	O
the	O
get/setters	O
to	O
JSON	O
without	O
any	O
additional	O
annotations	O
;	O
if	O
you	O
use	O
a	O
different	O
naming	O
style	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
tell	O
it	O
where	O
your	O
properties	O
are	O
.	O

Note	O
that	O
some	O
other	O
programming	O
languages	O
use	O
different	O
styles	O
.	O

Perl	B-Skill
libraries	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
often	O
use	O
a	O
->someProperty()	O
getter	O
and	O
->someProperty($newValue)	O
setter	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
following	O
the	O
Basic	O
Single-Row	O
Tile	O
Source	O
Collection	O
example	O
with	O
the	O
same	O
configurations	O
and	O
tile	O
sources	O
as	O
mentioned	O
in	O
the	O
example	O
.	O

Looks	O

https://github.com/openseadragon/openseadragon/issues/1412	O

like	O

)	O

https://codepen.io/iangilman/pen/aqgzJZ	O

Some	O
data	O
I	O
have	O
to	O
plot	O
have	O
coordinates	O
such	O
as	O
(	O
20	O
,	O
0	O
)	O
,	O
(	O
10	O
,	O
0	O
)	O
,	O
etc	O
..	O
.	O
Basically	O
some	O
of	O
the	O
points	O
belong	O
to	O
the	O
x-axis	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
,	O
these	O
points	O
are	O
hidden	O
by	O
the	O
axis	O
;	O
i.e	O
.	O
the	O
markers	O
are	O
behind	O
the	O
line	O
and	O
therefore	O
cannot	O
be	O
seen	O
properly	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
an	O
example	O
of	O
my	O
figure	O
:	O
http://i.stack.imgur.com/FNcob.png	O

Does	O
anybody	O
have	O
an	O

to	O

problem	O
?	O

I	O
am	O
running	O
out	O
of	O
idea	O
..	O
.	O

Thanks	O
.	O

Viktor	O

Matplotlib	B-Skill
"	O
snaps	O
"	O
plot	O
limits	O
to	O
"	O
whole	O
"	O
(	O
factors	O
of	O
2	O
,	O
5	O
,	O
10	O
,	O
100	O
,	O
etc	O
)	O
numbers	O
,	O
by	O
default	O
.	O

This	O
often	O
means	O
that	O
your	O
data	O
may	O
wind	O
up	O
on	O
the	O
boundary	O
of	O
the	O
plot	O
.	O

ax.margins	O
allows	O
you	O
to	O
add	O
a	O
padding	O
factor	O
before	O
this	O
autoscaling	O
for	O
the	O
plot	O
is	O
calculated	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
a	O
quick	O
way	O
to	O
avoid	O
the	O
problem	O
of	O
points	O
on	O
the	O
plot	O
boundary	O
.	O

As	O
a	O
quick	O
example	O
of	O
the	O
problem	O
:	O

And	O
an	O
easy	O
solution	O
:	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
table	B-Skill
of	O
data	O
that	O
goes	O
quite	O
some	O
time	O
back	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
only	O
want	O
to	O
results	O
in	O
my	O
query	O
for	O
the	O
last	O
13	O
weeks	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
date	O
column	B-Skill
in	O
that	O
table	B-Skill
.	O

I	O
can	O
use	O

to	O

to	O

.	O

Is	O
there	O

can	O

?	O

Thanks	O
in	O
advance	O

.	O

I	O

;	O

.	O

Python	B-Skill
2.7	O
and	O

to	O

.	O

6870	O

https://reqres.in/api/users/2	O

Here	O
's	O

but	O
ca	O
n't	O
finish	O
it	O
.	O

Basically	O
,	O
is	O
there	O
any	O
way	O
to	O
have	O
a	O
structure	O
like	O
this	O
,	O

Which	O
then	O
gets	O
resolved	O
to	O
my	O

data	O
?	O

You	O
do	O

need	O
to	O
use	O
switchMap	O
for	O
this	O
and	O
use	O
concatMap	O
or	O

:	O

I	O
would	O
like	O
my	O
page	O
to	O
pop-up	O
a	O

that	O
contains	O
a	O
form	O
.	O

When	O

and	O

of	O
the	O

with	O
new	O

loaded	O
into	O

.	O

Whenever	O
I	O
try	O
this	O
so	O
far	O
,	O
when	O

on	O

if	O

have	O
target	O
=	O
"	O
_self	O
"	O

into	O
a	O

that	O
the	O
browser	B-Skill
opens	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
yet	O
to	O
find	O
a	O
solution	O
that	O
allows	O
the	O
pop-up	O
to	O
stay	O
up	O
when	O
coming	O
from	O
this	O
AJAX	B-Skill
pop-up	O
function	O
(	O
listed	O
below	O
)	O
.	O

I	O
could	O
do	O
a	O
standard	O
non-AJAX	B-Skill
popup	O
,	O
but	O
then	O
if	O
a	O
user	O
clicks	O
on	O
the	O
page	O
the	O
pop-up	O
came	O
from	O
,	O
the	O
pop-up	O
goes	O
underneath	O
the	O
main	O
page	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
n't	O
something	O
I	O
want	O
at	O
all	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
the	O
page	O
where	O
my	O
pop-up	O
comes	O
from	O

So	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
current	O
graph	B-Skill
and	O
form	O
pop-up	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
in	O
the	O
form	O
of	O
a	O
JSP	B-Skill
backed	O
by	O
a	O
servlet	O
.	O

The	O
first	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
header	O
gets	O
all	O
the	O
parameters	O
and	O
then	O
zoomPlot.generatePlot()	O
creates	O
the	O
plot	O
and	O
saves	O
it	O
as	O
a	O
.png	O
.	O

The	O
body	O
displays	O
the	O
.png	O
graph	B-Skill
and	O
then	O
also	O
shows	O
the	O
form	O
.	O

When	O
one	O
submits	O
the	O
form	O
,	O
the	O
same	O
thing	O
happens	O
again	O
.	O

The	O
first	O
time	O
,	O
this	O
pop-up	O
is	O
displayed	O
,	O
the	O
plot	O
uses	O
default	O
values	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
not	O
really	O
sure	O
how	O
to	O
convert	O
this	O
to	O
an	O
AJAX	O
request	O
,	O
so	O
if	O
anyone	O
has	O
any	O
good	O
ideas	O
,	O
please	O
let	O
me	O
know	O
.	O

I	O
'd	O
like	O
to	O
recycle	O
as	O
much	O
as	O
I	O
can	O
.	O

Use	O
AJAX	B-Skill
to	O
submit	O
the	O
form	O
.	O

In	O
your	O
init	O
code	O
:	O

Elsewhere	O
:	O

There	O
are	O
many	O
ways	O
I	O
would	O
do	O
it	O
:	O

1	O
:	O
A	O
form	O
and	O
an	O
Iframe	O

Target	O
the	O
form	O
to	O
the	O
iframe	O
:	O

Visually	O
hide	O
the	O
iframe	O
with	O
CSS	B-Skill
on	O
initial	O
load	O
.	O

You	O
should	O
visibility	O
:	O
hidden	O
;	O
instead	O
of	O
display	O
:	O
none	O
;	O
because	O
the	O
latter	O
destroys	O
an	O
element	O
from	O
the	O
DOM	B-Skill
.	O

Prevent	O
default	O
submission	O
of	O
the	O
form	O
.	O

When	O
the	O
form	O
is	O
submitted	O
(	O
with	O
AJAX	B-Skill
)	O
,	O
hide	O
the	O
form	O
and	O
show	O
the	O
iframe	O
.	O

The	O
dialog	O
would	O
still	O
be	O
open	O
.	O

2	O
:	O
A	O
form	O
with	O
AJAX	B-Skill

Wrap	O
the	O
form	O
in	O
a	O
div	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

Then	O
use	O
AJAX	B-Skill
to	O
submit	O
the	O
form	O
and	O
show	O
results	O
in	O
the	O
#results	O
-container	O

NOTE	O
:	O

I	O
'm	O
trying	O
to	O
explain	O
the	O
process	O
so	O
that	O
you	O
'll	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
implement	O
your	O
own	O
login	O
.	O

DO	O
NOT	O
FORGET	O
to	O
prevent	O

.	O

The	O
assignment	O
is	O
to	O
develop	O
a	O
monitor	O
,	O
by	O
the	O
name	O
of	O
matchmaker	O
.	O

We	O
have	O
a	O
routine	O
:	O
self()	O
;	O
that	O
returns	O
the	O
thread	O
's	O
id	O
.	O

The	O
matchmaker	O
method	O
must	O
do	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

Threads	O
that	O
call	O
this	O
routine	O
"	O
trade	O
"	O
tids	O
.	O

When	O
a	O
thread	O

calls	O
make_match()	O
and	O
a	O
value	O
B	O
is	O
returned	O
,	O
this	O
means	O
that	O
that	O
thread	O
ID	O
B	O
also	O
called	O
the	O
make_match	O
routine	O
.	O

For	O
a	O
pair	O
to	O
be	O
possible	O
make_match()	O
can	O
send	O
the	O
thread	O
to	O
sleep	O
,	O
at	O
will	O
.	O

For	O
the	O
mutex	O
and	O
condition	O
variables	O
pthread.h	O
mustbe	O
used	O
.	O

is	O
the	O
code	O
I	O

up	O

:	O

LinearInterpolator	O
is	O
used	O
by	O
default	O
.	O

Repeat	O
after	O

5	O
sec	O

:	O

Caching	O
System.Drawing	O
objects	O
is	O
a	O
mistake	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
very	O
cheap	O
to	O
create	O

to	O
keep	O
around	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
allocated	O
on	O
a	O
special	O
heap	B-Skill
that	O
all	O
processes	O
on	O
a	O
desktop	O
need	O
to	O
share	O
.	O

The	O
heap	B-Skill
size	O
is	O
limited	O
to	O
65535	O
objects	O
.	O

Creating	O
objects	O
like	O
a	O
brush	O
or	O
a	O
pen	O
takes	O
roughly	O
a	O
microsecond	O
,	O
miniscule	O
compared	O
to	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
operation	O
you	O
perform	O
with	O
them	O
.	O

The	O
only	O
drawing	O
object	O
that	O
is	O
expensive	O
is	O
a	O
Font	O
.	O

Creating	O

of	O
overhead	O

by	O
the	O

.	O

But	O
that	O
's	O
already	O
solved	O
by	O
.NET	B-Skill
,	O
it	O
caches	O
them	O
.	O

Other	O
than	O
hogging	O
the	O
heap	B-Skill
needlessly	O
,	O
the	O
programming	O
style	O
is	O
dangerous	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
far	O
too	O
easy	O
to	O
forget	O
blindly	O
applying	O
the	O
using	O
statement	O
.	O

This	O
certainly	O
can	O
get	O
you	O
into	O
trouble	O
,	O
you	O
are	O
relying	O
on	O
the	O
finalizer	O
thread	O
to	O
release	O
them	O
again	O
.	O

.	O

Description	O
of	O

:	O

When	O
designing	O
my	O
software	O
,	O
I	O
began	O
with	O
interfaces	O
since	O
this	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
the	O
"	O
standard	O
"	O
.	O

Then	O
I	O
switched	O
to	O
abstract	O
classes	O
because	O
they	O
seem	O
better	O
suited	O
to	O
the	O
problem	O
at	O
hand	O
.	O

However	O
I	O
'm	O
not	O
sure	O
if	O
I	O
've	O
missed	O
out	O
on	O
some	O
considerations	O
when	O
making	O
this	O
design	O
choice	O
.	O

Other	O
than	O
domain	O
specific	O
issues	O
which	O
I	O
have	O
thought	O
about	O
what	O
are	O
the	O
more	O
general	O
factors	O
to	O
consider	O
when	O
choosing	O
between	O
interfaces	O
and	O
abstracts	O
classes	O
?	O

If	O
your	O
interface	O
also	O
has	O
reasonable	O
default	O
behavior	O
for	O
at	O
least	O
some	O
of	O
the	O
functionality	O
,	O
you	O
may	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
an	O
abstract	O
class	O
to	O
avoid	O
common	O
boilerplate	O
code	O
in	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
concrete	O
implementations	O
.	O

Otherwise	O
,	O
use	O
an	O
interface	O
.	O

I	O
find	O
the	O
best	O
option	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
is	O
to	O
do	O
both	O
.	O

That	O
is	O
not	O
always	O
possible	O
when	O
you	O
are	O
relying	O
on	O
something	O
happening	O
in	O
the	O
base	O
class	O
.	O

Providing	O
both	O
an	O
abstract	O
base	O
class	O
and	O
an	O
interface	O
allows	O
the	O
greatest	O
latitude	O
by	O
implementers	O
of	O
your	O
abstraction	O
,	O
again	O
,	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
require	O
something	O
happens	O
by	O
an	O
implementer	O
of	O
the	O
interface	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
require	O
that	O
something	O
happens	O
,	O
then	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
want	O
to	O
provide	O
an	O
interface	O
at	O
all--and	O
you	O
would	O
also	O
need	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
that	O
your	O
base	O
class	O
ensures	O
this	O
required	O
action	O
to	O
ALWAYS	O
occur	O
..	O
.	O

Negative	O
to	O
doing	O
both	O
:	O
more	O
goo	O
.	O

example	O
pseudocode	O
:	O

Note	O
that	O
in	O
this	O
example	O
,	O
someone	O
could	O
make	O
their	O
own	O
class	O

to	O

.	O

That	O

would	O
NOT	O

to	O

of	O
the	O
Vehicle	O
abstract	O
class	O
.	O

If	O
,	O

,	O
you	O
were	O
to	O
expect	O
something	O
specific	O
to	O
happen	O
in	O
the	O

quite	O

that	O

new	O
class	O
would	O
NOT	O

that	O

.	O

However	O
,	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
it	O
never	O
matters	O
what	O
implementations	O
of	O
IVehicle	O
do	O
,	O
then	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
most	O
flexible	O
abstraction	O
to	O
have	O
both	O
an	O
abstract	O
base	O
class	O
AND	O
an	O
interface	O
.	O

I	O
trying	O
to	O
convert	O
encryption	O
code	O
using	O
CryptoJS	B-Skill
aes256	I-Skill
from	O
.net	B-Skill
to	O
javascript	B-Skill
(	O
Cordova	B-Skill
)	O
but	O
i	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
the	O
right	O
result	O
.	O

//.Net	B-Skill
Code	O

//	O
Cordova	B-Skill
Code	O
:	O

I	O
can	O
successfully	O
encode	O

resulting	O

string	O
and	O

.	O

is	O

in	O

.	O

Here	O
is	O
what	O
I	O
have	O

far	O

does	O

.Net	B-Skill
.	O

Any	O

?	O

I	O
have	O
my	O
data.frame	O
sample	O
:	O

I	O
want	O
to	O
stay	O

.	O

So	O
I	O
want	O
my	O
table	B-Skill
after	O
sort	O
looks	O
like	O
:	O

This	O
is	O
a	O
base	B-Skill
R	I-Skill
solution	O
using	O
R	B-Skill
's	O
factor	O
coercion	O
.	O

We	O
locate	O
the	O
instances	O
of	O
"	O
deauthorize	O
"	O
by	O
using	O
factors	O
to	O
our	O
advantage	O
.	O

Usually	O
they	O
are	O
a	O
pain	O
but	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
being	O
able	O
to	O
quickly	O
turn	O
the	O
EventName	O
column	B-Skill
into	O
a	O
series	O
of	O
1	O
's	O
and	O
2	O
's	O
helps	O
quicken	O
the	O
search	O
.	O

Check	O
as.numeric(df$EventName)	O
for	O
reference	O
.	O

With	O
this	O
index	O
we	O
then	O
need	O
to	O
find	O
cases	O
of	O
a	O
1	O
followed	O
by	O
a	O
2	O
.	O

An	O
efficient	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
that	O
is	O
to	O
find	O
the	O
difference	O
of	O
each	O
element	O
.	O

diff(as.numeric(df$EventName))	O
does	O
that	O
for	O
us	O
.	O

you	O
can	O
imagine	O
which	O
value	O
of	O
that	O
vector	B-Skill
will	O
target	O
the	O
case	O
we	O
are	O
looking	O
for	O
,	O
-1	O
.	O

Data	O

Please	O
Help	O
me	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
running	O
a	O
face	O
recognition	O
detector	O
python	B-Skill
program	O
that	O
will	O
display	O

from	O
sqllite	B-Skill
studio	I-Skill
database	O
..	O
.	O

that	O
was	O
the	O
program	O

the	O
error	O
was	O

And	O
i	O
'm	O
using	O
python	B-Skill
3.4	O
and	O
opencv	B-Skill
3.4	O

Can	O
anyone	O
help	O
me	O
??	O
?	O

im	O
new	O
in	O
python	B-Skill
.	O

Thank	O
you	O
so	O
much	O
...	O
.	O

Indexing	O
is	O
zero-based	O
in	O
Python	B-Skill
.	O

That	O
means	O
,	O
counting	O
starts	O
from	O
0	O
not	O
1	O
.	O

Try	O
changing	O
lines	O
36	O
and	O
38	O
to	O
:	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
do	O
authorization	O
with	O
my	O
email	O
and	O

Your	O
NSURLConnection	O
's	O
callbacks	O
are	O
happening	O
on	O
the	O
main	O
queue	B-Skill
.	O

This	O
is	O
one	O
reason	O
your	O
application	O
is	O
locking	O
up	O
.	O

Your	O
managed	O
object	O
context	O
,	O
at	O
least	O
in	O
the	O
code	O
you	O
have	O
posted	O
,	O
is	O
not	O
following	O
the	O
Core	B-Skill
Data	I-Skill
concurrency	O
rules	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
a	O
choice	O
between	O
thread	O
confinement	O
(	O
unfortunately	O
,	O
the	O
default	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
obsolete	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
queue	B-Skill
confinement	O
.	O

With	O
thread	O
confinement	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
only	O
use	O
a	O
managed	O
object	O
context	O
from	O
the	O
thread	O
where	O
it	O
was	O
created	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
created	O
your	O
managed	O
object	O
context	O
on	O
the	O
main	O
thread	O
(	O
or	O
queue	B-Skill
)	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
only	O
use	O
it	O
from	O
there	O
so	O
any	O
Core	B-Skill
Data	I-Skill
operation	O
you	O
perform	O
on	O
that	O
context	O
will	O
block	O
the	O
main	O
thread	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
turn	O
the	O
UI	O
.	O

Using	O
queue	B-Skill
confinement	O
(	O
almost	O
)	O
any	O
operation	O
on	O
the	O
managed	O
object	O
context	O
must	O
go	O
through	O
either	O
the	O
performBlock	O
:	O
or	O
performBlockAndWait	O
:	O
methods	O
.	O

The	O
enqueued	O
block	O
is	O
executed	O
on	O
the	O
context	O
's	O
serial	O
queue	B-Skill
.	O

This	O
is	O
far	O
less	O
failure	O
prone	O
than	O
thread	O
confinement	O
and	O
has	O
been	O
the	O
recommended	O
practice	O
for	O
concurrency	O
since	O
iOS	B-Skill
5	O
.	O

Typically	O
this	O
would	O
be	O
done	O
using	O
an	O
NSFetchedResultsController	O
,	O
which	O
observes	O
a	O
managed	O
object	O
context	O
for	O
changes	O
relevant	O
to	O
it	O
's	O
fetch	O
request	O
.	O

Once	O
the	O
initial	O
fetch	O
populates	O
the	O
controller	O
it	O
will	O
listen	O
for	O
changes	O
to	O
the	O
context	O
that	O
affect	O
the	O
objects	O
specified	O
by	O
the	O
fetch	O
request	O
.	O

When	O
relevant	O
changes	O
occur	O
the	O
controller	O
informs	O
it	O
's	O
delegate	O
through	O
callbacks	O
.	O

how	O
to	O

easy	O
(	O
say	O
,	O

's	O

)	O
.	O

I	O
came	O

a	O
bug	O
in	O
code	O
that	O
is	O
only	O
reproduced	O

I	O
've	O

logic	O
for	O
testing	O
(	O
code	O
below	O
)	O
.	O

that	O

My	O

a	O

running	O

Brian	O

Yes	O
,	O
your	O

The	O

(	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

able	O

.	O

I	O

.	O

:	O

:	O
http://localhost/forms-basic/secure/org/data/f0720c16-d4b8-442f-8674-2d7fbdab8afc/F_Form1/8d4dfeed-aa11-45fc-a958-23d62d9328cc	O

I	O
'm	O

to	O
send	O
objects	O
retrieved	O
by	O
NHibernate	B-Skill
over	O
WCF	B-Skill
,	O
but	O
whenever	O
a	O
have	O
a	O
property	O
of	O
ICollection	O
I	O
get	O
an	O
exception	O
.	O

When	O
NHibernate	B-Skill
gets	O
the	O
data	O
from	O
the	O
database	O
this	O
property	O
is	O
intitialized	O
with	O
an	O
instance	O
of	O
PersistentGenericSet	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
a	O
way	O
I	O
can	O
send	O
a	O
PersistentGenericSet	O
over	O
WCF	B-Skill
?	O

-or	O

Is	O
there	O
some	O
way	O
making	O
NHibernate	B-Skill
initialize	O
these	O
properties	O
with	O
another	O
type	O
?	O

The	O
PersistentGenericSet	O
is	O
part	O
of	O
NHibernate	B-Skill
(	O
used	O
to	O
track	O
changes	O
in	O
collections	O
)	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
ISet	O
interface	O
and	O
classes	O
from	O
Iesi.Collections	B-Skill
,	O
which	O
was	O
used	O
to	O
fill	O
a	O
gap	O
in	O
the	O
.Net	B-Skill
framework	O
as	O
there	O
is	O
n't	O
a	O
Set	O
type	O
.	O

I	O
guess	O
that	O
WCF	B-Skill
has	O
a	O
problem	O
serializing	O
this	O
type	O
.	O

A	O
quick	O
fix	O
is	O
to	O
change	O
your	O
NHibernate	B-Skill
mappings	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
Bag	O
instead	O
of	O
a	O
Set	O
.	O

Then	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
a	O
normal	O
IList	O
<T>	O
instead	O
of	O
Set<T>	O
in	O
your	O
classes	O
w	O
.	O

A	O
better	O
solution	O
is	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
remote	O
facade	O
which	O
sends	O
DTOs	O
to	O
your	O
WCF	B-Skill
endpoints	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
allow	O
you	O
to	O
keep	O
the	O
interface	O
of	O
your	O
internal	O
types	O
separate	O
from	O
those	O
exposed	O
as	O
remote	O
services	O
.	O

Jimmy	O
Bogards	O
Automapper	B-Skill
is	O
a	O
great	O
tool	O
which	O
will	O
help	O
with	O
the	O
mapping	O
process	O
.	O

Edit	O

After	O
re-reading	O
the	O
problem	O
I	O
had	O
a	O
look	O
around	O
the	O
and	O
came	O
across	O
this	O
article	O
which	O
describes	O
a	O
workaround	O
for	O
sending	O
NHibernate	B-Skill
collections	O
over	O
WCF	B-Skill
.	O

David	O
Brion	O
has	O
written	O
a	O
good	O
follow	O
up	O
article	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
an	O
installer	O
created	O
using	O
Installshield	B-Skill
2012	O
that	O
depends	O
greatly	O
on	O
the	O
value	O
of	O
a	O
Registry	O
key	O
written	O
by	O
some	O
other	O
application	O
developed	O
in-house	O
.	O

I	O
use	O
RegDBGetKeyValueEx	O
Installscript	B-Skill
API	I-Skill
to	O
fetch	O
the	O
value	O
.	O

This	O
value	O
is	O
a	O
directory	O
path	O
guaranteed	O
to	O
have	O
a	O
trailing	O
backslash	O
.	O

This	O
value	O
serves	O
as	O
the	O
TARGETDIR	O
for	O
my	O
installer	O
.	O

The	O
issue	O
is	O
that	O
I	O
often	O
see	O
a	O
foreign	O
character	O
(	O
Chinese	O
,	O
Japanese	O
or	O
Korean	O
)	O
appended	O
to	O
the	O
backslash.This	O
causes	O
my	O
TARGETDIR	O
to	O
contain	O
the	O
foreign	O
character	O
.	O

This	O
pollutes	O
my	O
installation	O
.	O

I	O
feel	O
this	O
is	O
some	O
bug	O
with	O
Installscript	B-Skill
API	I-Skill
which	O
wrongly	O
translates	O
the	O
Registry	O
value	O
.	O

Please	O
provide	O
some	O
inputs	O
so	O
that	O
I	O
may	O
find	O
the	O
root-cause	O
of	O
the	O
issue	O
.	O

EDIT	O
1	O
:	O

The	O
other	O
application	O
in	O
question	O
is	O
a	O
purely	O
ANSI	O
application	O
with	O
no	O
support	O
for	O
Unicode	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
#define	O
UNICODE	O
specified	O
anywhere	O
.	O

I	O
also	O
checked	O
the	O
compiler	O
parameters	O
and	O
found	O
nothing	O
related	O
to	O
Unicode	O
specified	O
.	O

This	O
application	O
reads	O
one	O
Registry	O
key	O
and	O
appends	O
a	O
backslash	O
and	O
updates	O
other	O
keys	O
.	O

Once	O
this	O
operation	O
is	O
done	O
my	O
installer	O
fetches	O
the	O
values	O
written	O
:	O

The	O
values	O
updated	O
in	O
the	O
above	O
code	O
are	O
then	O
written	O
to	O
registry	O
.	O

The	O
Installscript	B-Skill
code	O
that	O
fetches	O
these	O
values	O
is	O
:	O

EDIT	O
2	O
:	O

The	O
way	O
the	O
registry	O
value	O
is	O
set	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
wrong	O
:	O

I	O
feel	O
the	O
correct	O
code	O
should	O
have	O
been	O
:	O

In	O
some	O
code	O
pages	O
the	O
currency	O
symbol	O
is	O
the	O
same	O
byte	O
value	O
in	O
ASCII	O
as	O
the	O
backslash	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
're	O
using	O
Unicode	O
functions	O
this	O
should	O
n't	O
be	O
an	O
issue	O
though	O
.	O

See	O
http://www.siao2.com/2005/09/17/469941.aspx	O
for	O
more	O
information	O
.	O

When	O
assigning	O
the	O
Registry	O
data	O
to	O
your	O
m_reqPath	O
variable	O
,	O
you	O
are	O
treating	O
it	O
as	O
null-terminated	O
character	O
data	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
string	O
data	O
read	O
by	O
RegQueryValueEx()	O
is	O
not	O
guaranteed	O
to	O
be	O
null-terminated	O
,	O
if	O
the	O
original	O
writer	O
of	O
the	O
data	O
did	O
not	O
include	O
one	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
clearly	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
documentation	O
.	O

Chances	O
are	O
that	O
the	O
string	O
data	O
you	O
are	O
reading	O
from	O
the	O
Registry	O
is	O
not	O
null-terminated	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
end	O
up	O
copying	O
random	O
data	O
from	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
your	O
buffer	O
.	O

To	O
account	O
for	O
that	O
possibility	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
allocate	O
extra	O
space	O
in	O
your	O
buffer	O
and	O
put	O
your	O
own	O
null	O
terminator	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
whatever	O
data	O
you	O
actually	O
read	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
data	O
is	O
properly	O
null	O
terminated	O
,	O
then	O
your	O
terminator	O
will	O
simply	O
be	O
redundant	O
.	O

You	O
are	O
also	O
leaking	O
the	O
opened	O
Registry	O
key	O
handle	O
if	O
RegOpenKeyEx()	O
succeeds	O
but	O
RegQueryValueEx()	O
fails	O
.	O

Try	O
this	O
instead	O
:	O

To	O
avoid	O
this	O
issue	O
altogether	O
,	O
use	O
RegGetValue()	O
instead	O
,	O
which	O
deals	O
with	O
the	O
null	O
terminator	O
for	O
you	O
:	O

Or	O
:	O

I	O

.	O

But	O
data	O
appears	O
before	O
the	O
progressbar	O
goes	O
invisible	O
and	O
notifyDataSetChange()	O
fired	O
,	O
help	O
me	O
please	O
!	O

An	O
AsyncTask	O
that	O
returns	O
nothing	O
from	O
doInBackground()	O
(	O
and	O
does	O
n't	O
communicate	O
with	O
onPostExecute()	O
via	O
private	O
members	O
)	O
is	O
always	O
suspicious	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
a	O
lot	O
of	O
side	O
effects	O
in	O
your	O
AsyncTask	O
and	O
that	O
kind	O
of	O
stuff	O
is	O
hard	O
to	O
debug	O
.	O

You	O
add	O
to	O
cityList	O
and	O
activeOrders	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
without	O
showing	O
what	O
that	O
actually	O
is	O
.	O

Presumably	O
those	O
are	O
lists	B-Skill
attached	O
to	O
some	O
Adapter	O
and	O
adding	O
to	O
those	O
might	O
trigger	O
a	O
View	O
attached	O
to	O
the	O
Adapter	O
to	O
be	O
re-drawn	O
.	O

If	O
that	O
is	O
the	O
case	O
you	O
could	O
try	O
calling	O
setNotifyOnChange(false)	O
on	O
mAdapter	O
(	O
to	O
delay	O
updates	O
until	O
you	O
manually	O
call	O
notifyDataSetChanged()	O
later	O
)	O
.	O

http://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/ArrayAdapter.html#setNotifyOnChange(boolean)	O

In	O
general	O
,	O
if	O
your	O
AsyncTask	O
does	O
n't	O
return	O
anything	O
or	O
otherwise	O
"	O
communicate	O
"	O
with	O
onPostExecute()	O
there	O
is	O
little	O
point	O
in	O
having	O
onPostExecute()	O
in	O
the	O
first	O
place	O
.	O

Even	O
better	O
would	O
be	O
not	O
to	O
have	O
any	O
side	O
effect	O
in	O
doInBackground()	O
and	O
instead	O
return	O
the	O
parsed	O
data	O
and	O
only	O
add	O
it	O
to	O
cityList	O
and	O
activeOrders	O
in	O
onPostExecute()	O
.	O

is	O
tricky	O
and	O

while	O
appearing/attempting	O
to	O
make	O
it	O
easier	O
,	O
have	O
many	O
pitfalls	O
.	O

have	O

to	O

of	O

The	O

that	O

(	O

I	O
want	O
to	O

from	O

array	B-Skill

database	O
.	O

is	O

.	O

In	O
the	O
below	O

example	O
key	O
id	O
-3	O
indicates	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
the	O
root	O
node	O
.	O

Input	O
Data	O
:	O

Output	O
expected	O
data	O
:	O

The	O
trick	O
is	O
to	O
use	O
&$a	O
notation	O
which	O
gives	O
us	O
references	O
instead	O
of	O
variable	O
copies	O
.	O

Basically	O

nodes	O
are	O
attached	O
to	O
the	O
parents	O
,	O
and	O
root	O
nodes	O
go	O
to	O
result	O
array	B-Skill
.	O

I	O
have	O
the	O
following	O
update	O
query	O
that	O
works	O
in	O
design	O
mode	O
of	O
Access	B-Skill
.	O

I	O
have	O
inserted	O
it	O
into	O
a	O

procedure	O
and	O
want	O
to	O
update	O
the	O
recordset	B-Skill
with	O
the	O
windows	O
ID	O
of	O
the	O
user	O
by	O
declaring	O
this	O
as	O
a	O
variable	O

My	O
problem	O
is	O
when	O

click	O
the	O
command	O

to	O

the	O
procedure	O

to	O
'	O

Value	O
'	O
instead	O
of	O
inserting	O

to	O
the	O
table	B-Skill
.	O

I	O
am	O
not	O
sure	O
but	O
it	O
seems	O

SQL	B-Skill
statement	O
is	O
incorrect	O
as	O

is	O
not	O
being	O
picked	O
up	O
as	O

.	O

I	O

"	O

What	O

)	O

on	O

?	O

Thanks	O

the	O
basic	O
events	O
to	O
drag	O
and	O
drop	O
are	O
:	O
events	O
to	O
drag	O
and	O
drop	O

Specially	O
the	O
DragLeave	O
and	O
Drop	O
to	O
do	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
.	O

Then	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
control	O
(	O
delete/add	O
)	O
the	O
GridData	O
property	O
from	O
your	O
VM	B-Skill
to	O
search	O
and	O
move	O
the	O
values	O
.	O

I	O
strongly	O
recommend	O
3rd	O
party	O
like	O
Telerik	B-Skill
to	O
do	O
it	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
your	O
complete	O
answer	O
I	O
believe	O
.	O

Here	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
have	O
the	O
shift	O
key	O
down	O
to	O
signal	O
the	O
drag	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
needed	O
to	O
disambiguate	O
the	O
click	O
and	O
drag	O
that	O
is	O
used	O
in	O
the	O
DataGrid	O
to	O
select	O
cells	O
.	O

You	O
might	O
use	O
some	O
other	O
mechanism	O
such	O
as	O
context	O
menu	O
item	O
.	O

The	O
clipboard	B-Skill
is	O
key	O
to	O
any	O
drag	O
and	O
drop	O
operation	O
.	O

What	O
you	O
are	O
doing	O
is	O
putting	O
data	O
on	O
the	O
clipboard	B-Skill
in	O
various	O
formats	O
that	O
the	O
target	O
of	O
the	O
drop	O
will	O
recognize	O
.	O

In	O
this	O
example	O
only	O
plain	O
text	O
is	O
used	O
.	O

But	O
you	O
might	O
want	O
to	O
create	O
rich	O
text	O
or	O
HTML	O
or	O
any	O
number	O
of	O
other	O
formats	O
.	O

The	O
external	O
application	O
you	O
are	O
dropping	O
on	O
must	O
be	O
registered	O
as	O
a	O
drop	O
target	O
.	O

You	O
cannot	O
force	O
the	O
other	O
app	O
to	O
respond	O
to	O
the	O
drop	O
...	O
it	O
must	O
be	O
listening	O
for	O
it	O
.	O

So	O
this	O
example	O
will	O
work	O
with	O
Word	B-Skill
and	O
Excel	B-Skill
.	O

It	O
will	O
not	O
work	O
with	O
Notepad	B-Skill
.	O

I	O
believe	O
all	O
4	O
items	O

Hi	O
i	O
have	O
created	O
app	O
using	O
altbeacon	B-Skill
reference	O
app	O
.	O

And	O
i	O

to	O
call	O
didEnterRegion	O
using	O

app	O

.	O

But	O
i	O
dont	O
want	O
it	O
to	O
scan	O
background	O
every	O
5	O
minutes	O
,	O
i	O
want	O
my	O
app	O
react	O
to	O
new	O
beacon	O
immediately	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
some	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
?	O

My	O
Code	O
:	O

}	O

You	O
can	O
increase	O
the	O
frequency	O
of	O
background	O
scans	O
with	O
the	O
following	O
code	O
:	O

This	O
will	O
make	O
the	O
background	O
detection	O
times	O
as	O
fast	O
as	O
in	O
the	O
foreground	O
.	O

But	O
be	O
forewarned	O
,	O
this	O
will	O
make	O
your	O
app	O
use	O
lots	O
of	O
battery	O
power	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
tweak	O
the	O
between	O
scan	O
period	O
to	O
your	O
tolerance	O
for	O
battery	O
drain	O
.	O

As	O
you	O
noted	O
,	O
the	O
default	O
is	O
5	O
minutes	O
(	O
5*3600l	O
)	O
.	O

Android	B-Skill
L	O
has	O
new	O
scanning	B-Skill
APIs	I-Skill
which	O
promise	O
to	O
help	O
improve	O
this	O
tradeoff	O
between	O
detection	O
timers	O
and	O
battery	O
usage	O
.	O

But	O
for4.3	O
and	O
4.4	O
apps	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
make	O
a	O
judgment	O
call	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
using	O
Java	B-Skill
6	O
.	O

Do	O
you	O
think	O
there	O
's	O
a	O
reason	O
why	O
there	O
are	O
conditional	O
expressions	O

and	O
not	O
loop	O
expressions	O

which	O
adds	O
elements	O
from	O
schedule	O
into	O
weeklyPlan	O
while	O
hasNext()	O
.	O

Or	O
do	O
some	O
languages	O
have	O
this	O
feature	O
or	O
something	O
similar	O
?	O

These	O
"	O
loop	O
expressions	O
"	O
,	O
in	O
a	O
slightly	O
different	O
form	O
,	O
are	O
called	O
closures	O
.	O

In	O
groovy-code	B-Skill
:	O

That	O
is	O
you	O
can	O
define	O
what	O
happens	O
with	O
each	O
object	O
of	O
the	O
schedule	O
collection	O
.	O

Java	B-Skill
does	O
not	O
yet	O
support	O
closures	O
.	O

There	O
it	O
is	O
implemented	O
with	O
anonymous	O
classes	O
.	O

Of	O
course	O
closures	O
are	O
more	O
than	O
that	O
,	O
and	O
this	O
is	O
only	O

that	O

C#	B-Skill
has	O
features	O
in	O
LINQ	B-Skill
that	O
can	O
perform	O
similar	O
actions	O
to	O
what	O

.	O

It	O
implements	O

and	O
extension	O
methods	O
:	O

But	O
these	O
are	O
much	O

tricky	O
language	O
constructs	O
than	O
Java	B-Skill
started	O
out	O
with	O
and	O

runtime	O
has	O
been	O

to	O
change	O

than	O

platform	O

"	O

.	O
"	O

I	O
always	O
read	O
that	O
,	O
at	O
any	O
given	O
time	O
,	O
the	O
processor	O
can	O
only	O
run	O
one	O
process	O
at	O
a	O
time	O
.	O

So	O
one	O
and	O
only	O
one	O
process	O
is	O
in	O
state	O
running	O
.	O

However	O
,	O

can	O
have	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
runnable	O
processes	O
.	O

These	O
are	O
all	O
of	O
these	O
processes	O
who	O
are	O
waiting	O
for	O
the	O
scheduler	O

.	O

?	O

to	O
RAM	O

disk	O
.	O

does	O

that	O

kernel	B-Skill

?	O

I	O
guess	O
you	O
can	O
tell	O
I	O
am	O
confused	O
.	O

If	O

.	O

for	O

)	O

,	O

.	O

Thanks	O
guys	O
.	O

base	O
method	O
for	O
text	O
replacements	O
:	O

stuff	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
do	O
:	O

you	O
can	O
fire	O
that	O
on	O
ANY	O
site	O
.	O

it	O
will	O
even	O
replace	O
titles	O
etc	O
.	O

so.	O
.	O
to	O
tell	O
you	O
about	O
the	O
benefits	O
of	O
not	O
using	O
jquery	B-Skill
for	O
this	O
:	O

jquery	B-Skill
will	O
process	O
and	O
wrap	O
every	O
single	O
element	O
in	O
a	O
browser	B-Skill
compatible	O
way	O
.	O

using	O
a	O
native	O
javascript	B-Skill
solution	O
would	O
speed	O
up	O
this	O
process	O
alot	O
.	O

using	O
native	O
textnodes	O
also	O
is	O
benefitial	O
since	O
it	O
will	O
not	O
break	O
event	O
handlers	O
for	O
child	O
elements	O
.	O

you	O
should	O
also	O
consider	O
using	O
fastdom	B-Skill
.	O

it	O
does	O
not	O
matter	O
if	O
you	O
are	O
using	O
jquery	B-Skill
or	O
native	O
js	B-Skill
.	O

after	O
writing	O
to	O
elements	O
the	O
dom	O
has	O
to	O
do	O
certain	O
tasks	O
before	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
read	O
again	O
.	O

in	O
the	O
end	O
you	O
will	O
loose	O
some	O
time	O
for	O
each	O
edited	O
element	O
.	O

to	O
give	O

.	O

So	O

.	O

1	O

.	O
)	O

.	O

to	O

.	O

is	O

to	O

'	O

'	O

.	O

Currently	O
(	O
without	O
mutations	O
)	O
it	O
looks	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

I	O
cannot	O
however	O
,	O
return	O
more	O
than	O
once	O
.	O

I	O
also	O
do	O
not	O
want	O
to	O
create	O
an	O
additional	O
item	O
that	O
starts	O
from	O
the	O

pipeline	O
1	O
.	O

Many	O

in	O
advance	O
.	O

at	O
the	O
docs	O

probably	O

scrapy.item.Item	O

that	O
is	O
sort	O
of	O

.	O

touched	O
scrapy	O
much	O

like	O
this	O

.	O

might	O
need	O
some	O
modifications	O
but	O
should	O
be	O

to	O
get	O
you	O
started	O
.	O

Now	O

items	O
can	O

chain	O

.	O

Now	O

item	O
.	O

I	O
have	O

like	O

:	O

array	B-Skill
looks	O
like	O
this	O

now	O
i	O
need	O
to	O
sort	O
every	O
dimension	O
of	O
the	O
array	B-Skill
by	O
the	O
sort	O
value	O
,	O
(	O
my	O
"	O
real	O
array	B-Skill
"	O
has	O
more	O
subarrays	B-Skill
then	O
this	O
one	O
)	O
.	O

i	O
played	O
around	O
with	O
multisort	B-Skill
but	O
i	O
ca	O
n't	O
seem	O
to	O
find	O
the	O
solution	O

any	O
ideas	O
?	O

Sort	O
the	O
array	B-Skill
when	O
it	O
is	O
1	O
dimension	O
before	O
you	O
build	O
the	O
multi-dimensional	O
array	B-Skill
.	O

Even	O
better	O
if	O
you	O
are	O
using	O
a	O
query	O
,	O
sort	O
it	O
there	O
.	O

Sort	O
by	O
parent	O
then	O
sort	O
.	O

When	O
you	O
build	O
your	O
multidimensional	O
array	B-Skill
,	O
each	O
child	O

Explanation	O
of	O
the	O
flags	O
:	O

-F	O
prints	O
the	O

and	O

.	O

.	O

do	O

need	O

.	O

.	O

statement	O

.	O

I	O

code	O
that	O

like	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

The	O
couple	O
of	O
differences	O
.	O

First	O
,	O
you	O
always	O
open	O
the	O
file	O
in	O

mode	O
.	O

This	O
way	O

the	O
file	O
will	O
be	O
flushed	O
every	O
time	O
.	O

Next	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
always	O
update	O
the	O
file	O
with	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
time	O
elapsed	O
.	O

So	O
even	O
if	O
your	O
raspberry	O
pi	O
shuts	O
down	O
,	O
you	O
should	O
be	O

to	O

.	O

the	O
index-variable	O
:	O

In	O
MySQL	B-Skill
,	O
is	O
it	O
possible	O
to	O
store	O
a	O

in	O
a	O

in	O

?	O

reason	O
is	O
to	O
reduce	O
code	O
duplicity	O
and	O
avoid	O
possible	O
problems	O
when	O

to	O
use	O
the	O

type	O
.	O

:	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

:	O

If	O
