is	O
a	O
flag	O
and	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
specify	O
python	B-Skill
that	O
you	O
would	O
be	O
using	O
test	O
methods	O
of	O
unittest	B-Skill
.	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
matrix	B-Skill
represented	O
in	O
PHP	B-Skill
as	O
an	O
array	B-Skill
:	O

and	O
I	O
have	O
a	O
second	O
matrix	B-Skill
represented	O
in	O
a	O
similar	O
way	O
(	O
here	O
without	O
inner	O
arrays	B-Skill
,	O
but	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
mind	O
adding	O
them	O
)	O
:	O

I	O
'd	O
like	O
to	O
have	O
a	O
combination	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

I	O
was	O
trying	O
to	O
find	O
a	O
code	O
snippet	O
that	O
does	O
that	O
for	O
me	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
failed	O
because	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
even	O
know	O
if	O
this	O
kind	O
of	O
operation	O
has	O
a	O
name	O
.	O

Has	O
it	O
?	O

(	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
want	O
anyone	O
to	O
write	O
that	O
code	O
snippet	O
,	O
I	O
can	O
do	O
that	O
myself	O
.	O
)	O

Just	O
in	O
case	O
anyone	O
else	O
does	O
want	O
an	O
implementation	O
,	O
the	O
following	O
would	O
create	O
a	O
cartesian	O
product	O
of	O
two	O
arrays	B-Skill
:	O

And	O
additionally	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
want	O
the	O
values	O
from	O
$array1	O
and	O
$array2	O
in	O
the	O
final	O
array	B-Skill
,	O
you	O
can	O
merge	O
the	O
two	O
arrays	B-Skill
together	O
before	O
the	O
nested	O
foreach	O
loops	O
:	O

What	O
you	O
are	O
looking	O
for	O
is	O
called	O
the	O
cartesian	O
product	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
native	O
PHP	B-Skill
function	O
to	O
calculate	O
that	O
.	O

My	O
angularjs	B-Skill
app	O

:	O

usually	O

,	O

.	O

hard	O

.	O

to	O
update	O

.	O

perform	O
the	O
update	O

to	O
the	O
temp	O
table	O
.	O

That	O
will	O
ensure	O
the	O
lowest	O

level	O

.	O

can	O
also	O

than	O

.	O

along	O

I	O
am	O

to	O

to	O

Blob	I-Skill
Storage	I-Skill
via	O
their	O

api	I-Skill
in	O
Xamarin.iOS	B-Skill
.	O

It	O
's	O
been	O
going	O
alright	O
until	O
now	O
.	O

Every	O

to	O

to	O
the	O
client	O
I	O

This	O

my	O
code	O
for	O
creating	O
the	O
HttpClient	O

tried	O

:	O

does	O

still	O

.	O

Any	O
help	O
would	O
be	O
great	O
.	O

Here	O
's	O
the	O
inner	O
workings	O
of	O
CheckName()	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
throwing	O
the	O
exception	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
find	O
the	O
source	O
here	O
:	O
https://github.com/mono/mono/blob/master/mcs/class/System.Net.Http/System.Net.Http.Headers/HttpHeaders.cs	O

After	O
looking	O
at	O
the	O
full	O
source	O
file	O
:	O

It	O
looks	O
like	O
Content-Length	O
is	O
in	O
the	O
collection	O
of	O
known_headers	O
.	O

Also	O
looks	O
like	O
the	O
internal	O
type	O
of	O
the	O
Content-Length	O
header	O
value	O
is	O
a	O
long	O
.	O

But	O
the	O
Add()	O
method	O
only	O
take	O
a	O
string	O
for	O
the	O
value	O
,	O
which	O
get	O
's	O
parsed	O
to	O
a	O
long	O
.	O

Is	O
the	O
string	O
value	O
that	O
you	O
're	O
passing	O
for	O
the	O
Content-Length	O
value	O
a	O
valid	O
long	O
?	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
problem	O
with	O
content	O
from	O
a	O
div	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
if	O
I	O
put	O
a	O
table	O
inside	O
of	O
a	O
div	O
and	O
set	O
a	O
width	O
(	O
width:200px	O
!	O
important	O
)	O
for	O
that	O
div	O
the	O
table	O
it	O
will	O
overwrite	O
that	O
div	O
.	O

So	O
how	O
is	O
possible	O
to	O
keep	O
all	O
content	O
inside	O
that	O
div	O
?	O

fiddle	B-Skill
example	O
:	O
http://jsfiddle.net/ebG9N/45/	O

You	O
set	O
the	O
header	O
to	O
white-space	O
:	O
nowrap	O
;	O
therefore	O
,	O
the	O
browser	B-Skill
is	O
unable	O
to	O
break	O
the	O
headers	O
,	O
so	O
the	O
width	O
of	O
the	O
table	O
will	O
be	O
bigger	O
than	O
the	O
container	O
div	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
set	O
,	O
overflow	O
:	O
hidden	O
;	O
to	O
cut	O
the	O
overflowing	O
parts	O
,	O
or	O
overflow	O
:	O
auto	O
;	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
scrollbar	O
,	O
but	O
without	O
them	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
correct	O
rendering	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
two	O
solutions	O
.	O

i)	O
IF	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
STRICTLY	O
contain	O
table	O
WITHIN	O
div	O
then	O
overflow:auto	O
;	O
is	O
the	O
way	O
to	O
go	O
.	O

ii)	O
BUT	O
if	O
you	O
change	O
your	O
mind	O
and	O
want	O
to	O
WRAP	O
div	O
to	O
the	O
width	O
of	O
table	O
then	O
.	O

display:table	O
;	O
is	O
the	O
way	O
to	O
go	O
.	O

Generally	O
its	O
bad	O
idea	O
to	O
contain	O
wider	O
element	O
within	O
explicitly	O
known	O
less	O
wider	O
element	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
come	O
across	O
a	O
situation	O
where	O
I	O
am	O
reading	O
a	O
some	O
log	O
file	O
and	O
then	O
counting	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
lines	O
I	O
encountered	O
via	O
the	O
following	O
code	O
snippet	O
.	O

My	O
problem	O
is	O
that	O
when	O
I	O
try	O
to	O
read	O
a	O
file	O
(	O
CSV	O
,	O
Syslog	O
,	O
or	O
any	O
other	O
wild	O
format	O
)	O
,	O
it	O
runs	O
just	O
fine	O
and	O
gives	O
me	O
the	O
right	O
result	O
.	O

But	O
when	O
I	O
try	O
to	O
run	O
a	O
file	O
that	O
was	O
generated	O
via	O
a	O
mac	O
,	O
it	O
goes	O
hay-wire	O
and	O
simply	O
reports	O
back	O
that	O
a	O
single	O
line	O
was	O
read	O
.	O

Now	O
my	O
log	O
file	O
is	O
large	O
,	O
I	O
know	O
that	O
it	O
has	O
quite	O
a	O
few	O
thousand	O
lines	O
of	O
logs	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
just	O
read	O
a	O
single	O
line	O
.	O

I	O
opened	O
this	O
file	O
in	O
Sublime	B-Skill
and	O
I	O
could	O
see	O
all	O
the	O
separate	O
lines	O
,	O
however	O
when	O
I	O
viewed	O
this	O
file	O
via	O
VIM	B-Skill
,	O
It	O
displayed	O
only	O
a	O
single	O
a	O
file	O
with	O
a	O
character	O
'	O
^M	O
'	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
line	O
(	O
My	O
guess	O
it	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
using	O
this	O
as	O
the	O
line	O
terminator	O
)	O
.	O

A	O
sample	O
of	O
two	O
lines	O
is	O
below	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
see	O
that	O
vim	B-Skill
is	O
displaying	O
the	O
^M	O
character	O
where	O
it	O
should	O
have	O
been	O
a	O
new	O
line	O

Any	O
suggestion	O
as	O
to	O
how	O
to	O
tackle	O
this	O
problem	O
?	O

Both	O
line	O
feed	O
(	O
^J	O
,	O
0x0a	O
)	O
and	O
carriage	O
return	O
(	O
^M	O
,	O
0x0d	O
)	O
are	O
used	O
as	O
line	O
separators	O
;	O
Unix	B-Skill
uses	O
the	O
first	O
,	O
(	O
old	O
)	O
Mac	O
the	O
latter	O
,	O
Windows	B-Skill
both	O
in	O
combination	O
(	O
CR-LF	O
)	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
a	O
file	O
input	O
library	O
that	O
abstracts	O
this	O
(	O
and	O
if	O
you	O
absolutely	O
have	O
to	O
support	O
the	O
old	O
Mac	O
format	O
(	O
as	O
the	O
new	O
MacOS	B-Skill
,	O
because	O
the	O
kernel	B-Skill
is	O
Unix-based	B-Skill
,	O
also	O
uses	O
LF	O
)	O
)	O
,	O
treat	O
both	O
LF	O
and	O
CR	O
as	O
a	O
line	O
separator	O
,	O
and	O
do	O
n't	O
count	O
the	O
CR-LF	O
used	O
by	O
Windows	B-Skill
twice	O
.	O

Vim	B-Skill

What	O
Vim	B-Skill
detects	O
is	O
determined	O
by	O
the	O
'	O
fileformats	O
'	O
option	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
make	O
it	O
detect	O
Mac	O
as	O
well	O
via	O

The	O
first	O
problem	O
even	O
before	O
you	O
get	O
to	O
line	O
breaks	O
is	O
that	O
you	O
're	O
reading	O
bytes	O
and	O
then	O
treating	O
those	O
as	O
characters	O
.	O

You	O
're	O
effectively	O
assuming	O
an	O
encoding	O
of	O
ISO-8859-1	O
which	O
may	O
well	O
not	O
be	O
correct	O
.	O

You	O
should	O
be	O
using	O
an	O
InputStreamReader	O
instead	O
.	O

Then	O
there	O
's	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
operating	O
systems	O
having	O
different	O
line	O
breaks.	O
.	O
use	O
BufferedReader.readLine()	O
to	O
read	O
a	O
line	O
in	O
a	O
way	O
that	O
handles	O
line	O
breaks	O
of	O
\n	O
,	O
\r	O
or	O
\r\n	O
.	O

So	O
your	O
code	O
would	O
become	O
:	O

So	O
,	O
I	O
implemented	O
a	O
protected	O
area	O
on	O
my	O
Website	O
(	O
with	O
umbraco	B-Skill
)	O
which	O
has	O
a	O

when	O

access	O
a	O
page	O
that	O
normal	O
users	O
do	O

have	O

to	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
using	O
the	O
Login	B-Skill
Snippet	I-Skill
and	O
the	O
Login	B-Skill
Status	I-Skill
Snippet	I-Skill

that	O

.	O

:	O

I	O

6.5.17	O

So	O

Ok	O
,	O

whole	O

:	O

Assuming	O

level	O
div	O
has	O
and	O
id	O

Else	O

accordingly	O

would	O

(	O

.	O

BTW	O
.	O

:	O
Note	O
this	O
will	O
only	O
work	O
for	O
your	O
own	O
page	O
(	O
cross-domain	O
requests	O
are	O
not	O
supported	O
with	O
ajax	B-Skill

Firstly	O
,	O
loading	O
data	O
with	O
AJAX	O
will	O
only	O

if	O

on	O

domain	O
.	O

"	O
remote	O
site	O
"	O
indicates	O
you	O
're	O
trying	O
to	O
get	O
stuff	O
from	O
a	O
different	O

.	O

What	O
you	O
can	O

to	O

round	O
this	O

have	O
a	O
server-side	O
script	O

and	O

.	O

In	O
PHP	B-Skill
you	O
'd	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
cURL	B-Skill
functions	O
(	O
there	O
are	O
plenty	O
of	O
questions	O
here	O
about	O
that	O

of	O
thing	O
,	O
just	O
do	O
a	O
search	O
with	O
your	O
chosen	O
language	O
)	O
.	O

i	O
seen	O
some	O
tools	O
on	O
github	O
and	O
now	O
vector	O
drawables	O
in	O
Lolipop	O
allow	O
you	O
use	O
svg	O
files	O
.	O

One	O
major	O
advantage	O
i	O
find	O
is	O
that	O
svg	O
files	O
should	O
stretch	O
and	O
keep	O
proper	O
scaling	O
thus	O
looking	O
sharp	O
after	O
stretching	O
.	O

Now	O
with	O
svg	O
files	O
i	O
can	O
keep	O
all	O
my	O
images	O
in	O
the	O
drawable	O
folder	O
instead	O
of	O
filtering	O
them	O
out	O
by	O
density	O
.	O

This	O
makes	O
the	O
apk	O
file	O
smaller	O
which	O
is	O
desirable	O
.	O

Question	O
:	O
Would	O
there	O
be	O
any	O
reason	O
i	O
would	O
not	O
want	O
to	O
take	O
my	O
current	O
PNG	O
images	O
in	O
native	O
android	B-Skill
project	O
and	O
convert	O
them	O
to	O
svg	O
files	O
with	O
for	O
example	O
an	O
online	O
converter	O
tool	O
like	O
vector	B-Skill
magic	I-Skill
?	O

There	O
are	O
several	O
reasons	O
that	O
you	O
would	O
not	O
want	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
.	O

First	O
,	O
vector	O
drawables	O
are	O
only	O
supported	O
on	O
Android	B-Skill
5.0	O
+	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
are	O
only	O
targeting	O
Lollipop	O
and	O
above	O
,	O
this	O
wo	O
n't	O
be	O
an	O
issue	O
,	O
but	O
you	O
will	O
still	O
need	O
PNGs	O
for	O
older	O
versions	O
of	O
Android	B-Skill
.	O

Second	O
,	O
converting	O
raster	O
to	O
vector	O
will	O
in	O
most	O
cases	O
yield	O
poor	O
results	O
.	O

Instead	O
,	O
you	O
should	O
start	O
by	O
creating	O
the	O
original	O
assets	O
as	O
vector	O
images	O
in	O
a	O
program	O
like	O
Illustrator	B-Skill
.	O

Then	O
export	O
to	O
SVG	O
for	O
conversion	O
to	O
VectorDrawable	O
format	O
and	O
export	O
to	O
PNG	O
for	O
the	O
DPI	O
buckets	O
you	O
'd	O
like	O
to	O
support	O
on	O
pre-5.0	O
devices	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
do	O
comparison	O
operators	O
on	O
my	O
postgresql	B-Skill
data	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
range	O
of	O
data	O
like	O
this	O

MockTable	O

Each	O
of	O
the	O
fields	O
on	O
the	O
top	O
are	O
labeled	O
in	O
the	O
SQL	B-Skill
server	B-Skill
as	O
text	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
pull	O
information	O
like	O
this	O
.	O

Thus	O
recieving	O
the	O
1st	O
and	O
3rd	O
column	B-Skill
back	O
.	O

However	O
I	O
am	O
not	O
getting	O
this	O
results	O
.	O

Input	O
?	O

If	O
your	O
column	B-Skill
names	O
are	O
not	O
all-lowercase	O
,	O
you	O
must	O
specify	O
them	O
in	O
double	O
quotes	O
and	O
with	O
the	O
exact	O
same	O
capitalization	O
as	O
they	O
are	O
in	O
the	O
table	B-Skill
:	O

SELECT	O
*	O
FROM	O
"	O
MockTable	O
"	O
WHERE	O
"	O
Hours	O
"	O
>	O
25	O
;	O

Note	O
this	O
says	O
"	O
Hours	O
"	O
instead	O
of	O
"	O
HOURS	O
"	O
.	O

For	O
this	O
reason	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
best	O
to	O
use	O
all-lowercase	O
for	O
your	O
column	B-Skill
and	O
table	B-Skill
names	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
when	O
using	O
lowercase	O
you	O
wo	O
n't	O
need	O
to	O
put	O
the	O
double-quotes	O
around	O
the	O
column	B-Skill
names	O
unless	O
they	O
are	O
a	O
reserved	O
word	O
that	O
might	O
mean	O
something	O
else	O
in	O
that	O
context	O
.	O

When	O
you	O
compare	O
numbers	O
as	O
strings	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
think	O
about	O
alphabetical	O
order	O
.	O

The	O
magnitude	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
is	O
meaningless	O
,	O
at	O
this	O
point	O
is	O
merely	O
a	O
word	O
.	O

So	O
"	O
25	O
"	O
is	O
greater	O
than	O
"	O
100	O
"	O
because	O
the	O
"	O
2	O
"	O
comes	O
after	O
the	O
"	O
1	O
"	O
in	O
an	O
alphabetical	O
sense	O
.	O

What	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
do	O
is	O
either	O
cast	O
your	O
"	O
Hours	O
"	O
field	O
as	O
integer	O
(	O
or	O
fix	O
that	O
damned	O
table	B-Skill
because	O
numbers	O
in	O
string	O
fields	O
is	O
nasty	O
)	O
.	O

Obviously	O
,	O
you	O
are	O
going	O
to	O
run	O
into	O
some	O
difficult	O
problems	O
if	O
there	O
are	O
records	O
where	O
the	O
"	O
Hours	O
"	O
field	O
contains	O
non-numeric	O
characters	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
'll	O
have	O
to	O
deal	O
with	O
that	O
if	O
and	O
when	O
it	O
arises	O
.	O

in	O
my	O
routing.yml	O

page	O
is	O
supposed	O
to	O
have	O
integer	O
value	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
put	O

it	O
works	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
not	O
big	O
problem	O
though	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
put	O

it	O
works	O
and	O
it	O
's	O
not	O
good	O
thing	O
for	O
search	O
crawler	O
.	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
set	O

{	O
page	O
}	O

to	O

?	O

?	O

Do	O

like	O

I	O

.	O

Am	O

something	O
?	O

OK	O
,	O

'll	O

So	O
the	O
Reingold-Tilford	O
layout	O
works	O
:	O
http://igraph.sourceforge.net/doc/python/igraph.Graph-class.html#layout_reingold_tilford	O

I	O
am	O
writing	O
a	O
native	O
module	O
,	O
and	O
i	O

to	O

.	O

<Text	O

'blue'}}></Text>	O

.	O

SomeComponent.js	O

How	O
to	O
get	O
those	O

properties	O
on	O
the	O
native	O
side	O
?	O

How	O
exactly	O
react-native	B-Skill
deals	O
with	O
TextView	O
and	O
StyleSheets	O
?	O

I	O
have	O
made	O
a	O
dmg	O
file	O
for	O
my	O
uploader	O
desktop	O
application	O
.	O

This	O
dmg	O
is	O
ported	O
on	O
my	O
website	O
from	O
where	O
i	O
download	O
the	O
same	O
using	O
the	O
Safari	B-Skill
Browser	I-Skill
.	O

However	O
,	O
when	O
i	O
try	O
to	O
execute	O
it	O
from	O
the	O
downloads	O
folder	O
,	O
the	O
system	O
does	O
not	O
execute	O
it	O
and	O
throws	O
a	O
message	O
stating	O
its	O
from	O
an	O
unidentified	O
developer	O
.	O

Hence	O
,	O
in	O
Security	O
&	O
Privacy	O
settings	O
,	O
i	O
opted	O
to	O
allow	O
download	O
.	O

I	O
cannot	O
expect	O
all	O
the	O
users	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
setting	O
.	O

What	O
modifications	O
do	O
i	O
need	O
to	O
do	O
inorder	O
to	O

dmg	O

am	O
a	O
novice	O
at	O
this	O

for	O

.	O

You	O
can	O
install	O
an	O
unverified	O
app	O
on	O

is	O
an	O
option	O
to	O
continue	O
.	O

this	O
article	O
for	O
screenshots	O
http://osxdaily.com/2012/07/27/app-cant-be-opened-because-it-is-from-an-unidentified-developer/	O

only	O
other	O
option	O
is	O
to	O

to	O

.	O

?	O

Swap	O
@JsonBackReference	O
and	O
@JsonManagedReference	O
.	O

Basically	O
:	O

I	O
want	O
to	O
create	O
256	O
functions	O
that	O
do	O
the	O
same	O
thing	O

Basically	O
I	O
want	O
a	O
function	O
that	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
be	O
called	O
case-insensitively	O
.	O

Example	O
:	O
I	O
want	O
applepie()	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
called	O
case-insensitively	O
:	O

to	O

another	O

functions	O
with	O
some	O

in	O
caps	O
:	O

and	O

.	O
.	O

all	O
the	O
way	O
to	O

There	O
are	O
in	O
total	O
256	O
(	O
2	O
to	O
the	O
power	O
of	O
8	O
)	O
of	O
them	O

Is	O
it	O
possible	O
to	O
do	O
it	O
quickly	O
?	O

Or	O
is	O
there	O
a	O
more	O
"	O
built-in	O
"	O
approach	O
like	O

or	O
is	O
it	O
possible	O
to	O
do	O
it	O
like	O

that	O
can	O
passes	O
all	O
the	O
parameters	O
to	O
applepie	O
instead	O
of	O
using	O
a	O
for	O
loop	O
for	O
B	O
in	O
"	O
$@	O
"	O
;	O
?	O

You	O
can	O
fake	O
a	O
case-insensitive	O
function	O
name	O
by	O
defining	O
all-lowercase	O
function	O
names	O
and	O
using	O
bash	B-Skill
's	O
trap	O
for	O
missing	O
command	O
names	O
(	O
requires	O
bash	B-Skill
4	O
,	O
which	O
you	O
would	O
need	O
to	O
install	O
yourself	O
on	O
OS	B-Skill
X	I-Skill
)	O
:	O

So	O
if	O
apple	O
is	O
a	O
function	O
,	O
but	O
you	O
try	O
to	O
call	O
it	O
as	O
ApPlE	O
,	O
command_not_found_handle	O
is	O
called	O
with	O
the	O
command	O
as	O
the	O
arguments	O
.	O

The	O
first	O
line	O
takes	O
the	O
first	O
argument	O
(	O
ApPlE	O
)	O
and	O
lower-cases	O
it	O
.	O

Then	O
it	O
attempts	O
to	O
run	O
apple	O
with	O
the	O
original	O
arguments	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
a	O
pretty	O
obtuse	O
answer	O
,	O
and	O
definitely	O
not	O
a	O
one-liner	O
,	O

is	O
how	O

can	O

done	O
in	O
bash	B-Skill
,	O
with	O
a	O
little	O
help	O
from	O
bc	O
and	O
tr	O
(	O
works	O
on	O
osx	B-Skill
)	O
:	O

This	O
does	O
the	O
following	O
;	O

gets	O
the	O
length	O
of	O
the	O
function	O
name	O

figures	O
out	O
number	O
of	O
case	O
combinations	O
(	O
2^n	O
)	O

loops	O
over	O
each	O
combination	O

turns	O
the	O
combination	O
number	O
into	O
a	O
string	O
of	O
binary	O
digits	O

Fiddles	O
the	O
string	O
of	O
binary	O
digits	O
so	O
it	O
is	O
the	O
same	O
length	O
as	O
the	O
function	O
name	O

indexes	O
through	O
each	O
char	O
of	O
the	O
function	O
name	O
and	O
string	O
of	O
binary	O
digits	O
and	O
does	O
a	O
toupper()	O
case	O
change	O
only	O
if	O
the	O
corresponding	O
binary	O
digit	O
is	O
1	O

reassembles	O
the	O
chars	O
to	O
a	O
string	O

does	O
a	O
bash	B-Skill
alias	O
from	O
each	O
combination	O
to	O
the	O
function	O
name	O

Assumes	O
the	O
function	O
is	O
defined	O
,	O
and	O
has	O
an	O
all-lowercase	O
name	O
.	O

am	O

.	O

a	O
better	O
example	O
:)	O

In	O
this	O
case	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
have	O
a	O
clear	O
and	O
distinct	O

to	O
access	O

of	O

macros	O
,	O

in	O
an	O
enum	O
for	O
example	O
)	O

I	O
've	O
UICollectionView	O
inside	O
UITableView	O
that	O
only	O
present	O
photos	O
.	O

it	O
works	O
fine	O
on	O
iOS	B-Skill
9	O

But	O
in	O
iOS	B-Skill
10	O
,	O
photos	O
not	O
appearing	O
until	O
I	O
tap	O
on	O
cell	O
that	O
holds	O
collection	O
view	O
.	O

I	O
tried	O
setPrefetchingEnabled	O
=	O
NO	O
but	O
still	O
not	O
appearing	O

any	O
suggestion	O
?	O

Thank	O
you	O

I	O
have	O
2	O
labels	O
with	O
text	O
as	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
vertically	O
align	O
two	O
UILabels	O
text	O
to	O
achieve	O
like	O
below	O
(	O
i.e	O
to	O
make	O
the	O
labels	O
text	O
align	O
vertically	O
at	O
colon	O
)	O
.	O

I	O
know	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
possible	O
with	O
4	O
different	O
labels	O
.	O

First	O
Label1	O
:	O
amount	O
label1	O

Second	O
Label2	O
:	O
amount	O
Label2	O

But	O
,	O
what	O
i	O
need	O
is	O
to	O
achieve	O
them	O
in	O
2	O
labels	O
only	O

and	O
align	O
vertically	O
at	O
colon	O

This	O
can	O
be	O
accomplished	O
by	O
using	O
AutoLayout	O
.	O

You	O
will	O
need	O
4	O
labels	O
:	O

Title	O
Labels	O

'	O
First	O
Value	O
'	O
(	O
Right	O
Aligned	O
)	O

'	O
Second	O
Value	O
'	O
(	O
Right	O
Aligned	O
)	O

Value	O
Labels	O

'	O
:1	O
,	O
000	O
'	O
(	O
Left	O
Aligned	O
)	O

'	O
:100	O
'	O
(	O
Left	O
Aligned	O
)	O

You	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
pin	O
both	O
title	O
labels	O
to	O
have	O
equal	O
widths	O
and	O
you	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
pin	O
both	O
value	O
labels	O
to	O
have	O
equal	O
widths	O
.	O

You	O
will	O
also	O
need	O
to	O
set	O
constraints	O
for	O
horizontal	O
spacing	O
between	O
both	O
title	O
and	O
value	O
.	O

To	O
ensure	O
that	O
the	O
spacing	O
is	O
always	O
equal	O
between	O
rows	O
.	O

In	O
code	O
when	O
you	O
set	O
the	O
value	O
of	O
your	O
label	O
,	O
you	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
that	O
the	O
colon	O
symbol	O
is	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
value	O
.	O

E.g	O
.	O

[	O
NSString	O
stringwithFormat	O
:	O
@	O
"	O
:%d	O
"	O
,	O
value	O
]	O
;	O

This	O
image	O
illustrates	O
the	O
constraints	O
required	O
:	O

Using	O
Autolayout	O
place	O
the	O
two	O
labels	O
in	O
the	O
UIView	O
and	O
then	O
align	O
the	O
view	O
to	O
align	O
centre	O
in	O
the	O
horizontal	O
and	O
use	O
vertical	O
spacing	O
between	O
the	O
views	O
..	O
.	O
as	O

The	O
correct	O
approach	O
is	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
container	O
view	O
,	O
which	O
derives	O
its	O
height	O
from	O
its	O
subviews	O
.	O

The	O
container	O
view	O
is	O
then	O
pinned	O
to	O
the	O
centre	O
of	O
the	O
cell	O
you	O
would	O
n't	O
have	O
any	O
constraints	O
linking	O
the	O
container	O
to	O
the	O
top	O
and	O
bottom	O
edges	O
of	O
the	O
cell	O
.	O

Within	O
the	O
container	O
,	O
the	O
vertical	O
constraints	O
would	O
be	O
|[label1]-[label2]|	O
,	O
which	O
would	O
make	O
the	O

of	O

.	O

I	O
used	O

to	O

then	O

will	O

For	O
more	O

so	O

http://iphoneincubator.com/blog/windows-views/right-scale-for-a-uiwebview	O

On	O
Android	B-Skill
6.0	O

the	O

of	O

.	O

even	O

I	O
am	O
currently	O
using	O
analog	O
pin	O
3	O
on	O
my	O
Arduino	O
Uno	O
to	O
send	O
out	O
voltage	O
from	O
0	O
to	O
5V	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
using	O
that	O
voltage	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
motor	O
and	O
currently	O
I	O
am	O
using	O
the	O
function	O
:	O

I	O
am	O
using	O
255	O
pwm	O
for	O
5V	O
and	O
127	O
for	O
2.5V	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
that	O
PWM	O
is	O
sending	O
full	O
cycle	O
at	O
255pwm(5V)	O
,	O
but	O
on	O
127V	O
the	O
cycle	O
is	O
at	O
50%	O
which	O
causes	O
my	O
motor	O
to	O
twitch	O
a	O
little	O
bit	O
.	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
solve	O
this	O
?	O

I	O
am	O
searching	O
for	O
a	O
way	O
to	O
send	O
full	O
PWM	O
cycle	O
even	O
at	O
lower	O
volts	O
.	O

Is	O
it	O
possible	O
?	O

First	O
I	O
believe	O
you	O
mean	O
D3	O
not	O
A3	O
,	O
since	O
PWM	O
does	O
not	O
exist	O
on	O
A3	O
.	O

Assuming	O
you	O
are	O
driving	O
a	O
DC	O
motor	O
,	O
and	O
not	O
something	O
like	O
a	O
servo	O
or	O
stepper	O

You	O
have	O
two	O
problems	O
.	O

1st	O
.	O

you	O
may	O
need	O
a	O
smoothing	O
capacitor	O
.	O

Where	O
your	O
formula	O
would	O
be	O
F	O
=	O
L*C	O
Noting	O
that	O
analogWrite	O
uses	O
a	O
F	O
=	O
490Hz	O
.	O

The	O
concept	O
is	O
simple	O
,	O
in	O
short	O
the	O
cap	O
average	O
out	O
the	O
high	O
and	O
lows	O
of	O
the	O
PWM	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
duty	O
cycle	O
.	O

And	O
the	O
capacitance	O
needed	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
frequency	O
and	O
impedance	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
provide	O
the	O
analog	O
voltage	O
.	O

2nd	O
.	O

And	O
bigger	O
problem	O
is	O
the	O
output	O
of	O
the	O
Arduino	O
can	O
not	O
supply	O
sufficient	O
current	O
to	O
drive	O
the	O
motor	O
correctly	O
.	O

It	O
will	O
max	O
out	O
at	O
about	O
20ma	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
motor	O
likely	O
needs	O
more	O
.	O

So	O
at	O
low	O
speeds	O
the	O
pulses	O
which	O
were	O
week	O
,	O
stall	O
out	O
during	O
their	O
low	O
periods	O
.	O

You	O
should	O
have	O
your	O
PWM	O
output	O
drive	O
a	O
transistor	O
,	O
which	O
in	O
turn	O
will	O
ON-OFF	O
the	O
motor	O
directly	O
from	O
the	O
power	O
supply	O
.	O

Now	O
your	O
motor	O
may	O
have	O
enough	O
inertia	O
as	O
not	O
to	O
need	O
the	O
cap	O
.	O

see	O
adafruit-arduino-lesson-13-dc-motors/breadboard	O
-layout	O

and	O
here	O
for	O
a	O
discussion	O
about	O
the	O
smoothing	O
cap	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
menu-bar	O
based	O
application	O
,	O
which	O
displays	O
a	O
window	O
,	O
when	O

on	O
Snow	O
Leopard	O

of	O

.	O

in	O
Mac	B-Skill
OS	I-Skill
X	I-Skill
Snow	O
Leopard	O
.	O

Btw	O
.	O

I	O
use	O
ARC	O
,	O
if	O
that	O
matters	O
at	O

.	O

You	O
're	O
loading	O
a	O
NIB	O
that	O
uses	O
a	O
10.7-specific	O
feature	O
,	O

,	O
which	O
does	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

Also	O
,	O

already	O

to	O
do	O
something	O
similar	O
for	O
your	O
target	O
's	O
build	O
settings	O
.	O

Set	O
the	O
deployment	O
target	O
.	O

Unfortunately	O
,	O
that	O
wo	O
n't	O
necessarily	O
cause	O
warnings	O
for	O
code	O
which	O

.	O

can	O

up	O

which	O
builds	O
against	O
the	O
10.6	O
SDK	B-Skill
and	O
compile	O
against	O
that	O
to	O
learn	O
where	O
you	O
're	O
using	O
post-10.6	O
features	O
.	O

Apple	B-Skill
's	O
SDK	I-Skill
Compatibility	O
Guide	O
for	O
more	O
info	O
.	O

was	O

is	O
this	O

for	O
?	O

,	O

Am	O

Sabari	O

The	O
MONGOHQ_URL	O
in	O
your	O
code	O
snippet	O
comes	O
from	O
the	O
shell	B-Skill
environment	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
in	O
bash	B-Skill
you	O
would	O
add	O
that	O
to	O
your	O
~	O
/.bash_profile	O
:	O

.	O
.	O
or	O
include	O
on	O
your	O
command	B-Skill
line	I-Skill
when	O
starting	O
the	O
node	B-Skill
app	O
:	O

Another	O
common	O
approach	O
with	O
Node.js	B-Skill
is	O
to	O
use	O
something	O
like	O
dotenv	O
,	O
which	O
will	O
load	O
environment	O
variables	O
from	O
a	O
.env	O
directory	O
in	O
your	O
project	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
default	O
;	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
define	O
this	O
if	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
connect	O
to	O
a	O
MongoHQ	B-Skill
instance	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
use	O
mootools	B-Skill
ajax	O
requests	O
to	O
record	O
clicks	O
on	O
outgoing	O
links	O
.	O

So	O
far	O
here	O
is	O
what	O
I	O
'm	O
doing	O
.	O

Each	O
link	O
looks	O
like	O
follows	O
:	O

The	O
javascript	B-Skill
function	O
clickRecord(id)	O
is	O
defined	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O

The	O
problem	O
I	O
have	O
is	O
this	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
add	O
a	O
return	O
false	O
;	O
to	O
the	O
onclick	O
=""	O
declaration	O
,	O
everything	O
works	O
fine	O
,	O
of	O
course	O
the	O
problem	O
there	O
is	O
that	O
click	O
does	O
not	O
take	O
the	O
user	O
to	O
the	O
intended	O
page	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
do	O
not	O
have	O
the	O
return	O
false	O
;	O
then	O
it	O
seems	O
like	O
the	O
ajax	B-Skill
call	O
is	O
never	O
executed	O
.	O

I	O
thought	O
the	O
onclick	O
event	O
should	O
execute	O
first	O
and	O
then	O
only	O
the	O
default	O
action	O
should	O
execute	O
.	O

Is	O
this	O
not	O
the	O
case	O
?	O

There	O
is	O
an	O
even	O
stranger	O
scenario	O
if	O
you	O
use	O
onmousedown	O
event	O
instead	O
.	O

It	O
seems	O
like	O
on	O
Firefox	B-Skill
,	O
if	O
you	O
use	O
the	O
onmousedown	O
event	O
,	O
once	O
you	O
go	O
to	O
the	O
new	O
page	O
,	O
you	O
cant	O
simply	O
navigate	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
old	O
page	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
refresh	O
the	O
old	O
page	O
.	O

Else	O
the	O
call	O
is	O
not	O
executed	O
.	O

This	O
does	O
not	O
happen	O
on	O
IE	B-Skill
.	O

OK	O
.	O
Found	O
an	O
answer	O
to	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
questions	O
:	O

The	O
inline	O
mootools	B-Skill
request	O
did	O
not	O
execute	O
when	O
declared	O
through	O
the	O
onclick()	O
.	O

It	O
seems	O
this	O
was	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
script	O
not	O
being	O
synchronous	O
.	O

So	O
probably	O
it	O
returns	O
without	O
actually	O
fully	O
committing	O
the	O
request	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
browser	B-Skill
then	O
moves	O
to	O
another	O
page	O
breaking	O
the	O
execution	O
.	O

Adding	O
a	O
synchronous	O
call	O
to	O
the	O

?	O

840	O

probably	O

into	O
account	O

call	O
in	O

requests	O
.	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

ideas	O
will	O
help	O
.	O

'	O

to	O

.	O

unable	O
to	O

subtotal	O
is	O

format	O
.	O

//Take	O

and	O
store	O
it	O

My	O
error	O
is	O
FormatException	O
was	O
unhandled	O
on	O
the	O
Convert.toInt16(xtextboxTotal.text)	O

When	O
formating	O
a	O
numeric	O
string	O
as	O
currency	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
parse	O
it	O
back	O
before	O
you	O
can	O
re-convert	O
it	O
back	O
to	O
a	O
numeric	O
form	O
,	O
this	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
curency	O
formatting	O
rules	O
you	O
used	O
to	O
create	O
the	O
number	O
in	O
the	O
first	O
place	O
.	O

See	O
:	O
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/3s27fasw.aspx	O

the	O
following	O
question	O
may	O
seem	O
stupid	O
to	O
many	O
,	O
since	O
it	O
should	O
have	O
a	O
simple	O
solution	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
am	O
a	O
beginner	O
in	O
the	O
Spring	B-Skill
framework	O
,	O
and	O
I	O
have	O
been	O
searching	O
and	O
testing	O
many	O
methods	O
with	O
no	O
success	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
implement	O
logging	O
for	O
a	O
Web	O
Service	O
based	O
on	O
Spring	B-Skill
.	O

Maven	B-Skill
is	O
used	O
for	O
dependencies	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
spring-boot-starter-ws	B-Skill
dependency	O
,	O
and	O
not	O
the	O
whole	O
starter-web	O
starter	O
.	O

I	O
tried	O
with	O
log4j	B-Skill
,	O
by	O
adding	O
a	O
dependency	O
and	O
config	O
file	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
does	O
produce	O
a	O
log	O
file	O
,	O
but	O
only	O
for	O
the	O
initialization	O
of	O
the	O
logger	O
itself	O
,	O
and	O
no	O
logging	O
about	O
when	O
the	O
service	O
is	O
used	O
,	O
although	O
log4j	B-Skill
is	O
in	O
TRACE	O
level	O
.	O

I	O
also	O
tried	O
with	O
logback	B-Skill
,	O
by	O
adding	O
the	O
logback.xml	O
file	O
,	O
and	O
adding	O
the	O
starter-logging	O
dependency	O
,	O
but	O
that	O
also	O
creates	O
empty	O
log	O
files	O
with	O
nothing	O
on	O
them	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
Spring	B-Skill
boot	I-Skill
documentation	O
,	O
the	O
application.properties	O
file	O
is	O
mentioned	O
.	O

So	O
I	O
created	O
this	O
in	O
WEB-INF	O
,	O
and	O
put	O
the	O
logging.level.org.springframework	O
and	O
the	O
logging.path	O
entries	O
.	O

But	O
still	O
no	O
log	O
file	O
created	O
at	O
all	O
.	O

I	O
do	O
n't	O
want	O
to	O
log	O
my	O
own	O
messages	O
,	O
I	O
just	O
want	O
to	O
log	O
the	O
events	O
generated	O
by	O
Spring	B-Skill
itself	O
.	O

And	O
I	O
also	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
a	O
main	O
method	O
,	O
only	O
an	O
Endpoint	O
for	O
the	O
web	O
service	O
,	O
if	O
any	O
of	O
these	O
might	O
be	O
relevant	O
.	O

So	O
what	O
I	O
need	O
is	O
the	O
simplest	O
possible	O
logging	O
,	O
possibly	O
without	O
adding	O
too	O
many	O
dependencies	O
or	O
so	O
,	O
and	O
retrieve	O
the	O
Spring	B-Skill
messages	O
into	O
the	O
log	O
.	O

Can	O
someone	O
tell	O
me	O
what	O
am	O
I	O
doing	O
wrong	O
?	O

logback	B-Skill
is	O
the	O
default	O
logging	O
implementation	O
used	O
by	O
Spring	B-Skill
Boot	I-Skill
(	O
I	O
assume	O
you	O
are	O
using	O
spring	B-Skill
boot	I-Skill
to	O
create	O
a	O
jar	O
and	O
run	O
that	O
!	O
)	O
.	O

Basicly	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
need	O
to	O
do	O
anything	O
logging	O
is	O
already	O
handled	O
by	O
the	O
starter	O
you	O
included	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
default	O
logback.xml	O
shipped	O
with	O
Spring	B-Skill
which	O
turns	O
on	O
logging	O
,	O
for	O
the	O
spring	B-Skill
framework	O
this	O
is	O
on	O
INFO	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
override	O
this	O
simply	O
create	O
a	O
logback.xml	O
file	O
with	O
the	O
same	O
content	O
as	O
the	O
default	O
one	O
and	O
put	O
the	O
logger	O
for	O
spring	B-Skill
on	O
DEBUG	O
or	O
TRACE	O
.	O

Not	O
sure	O
if	O
you	O
really	O
want	O
to	O
put	O
everything	O
on	O
trace	O
unless	O
you	O
want	O
a	O
less	O
performant	O
application	O
.	O

As	O
to	O
what	O
you	O
are	O
doing	O
wrong	O
is	O
that	O
you	O
are	O
probably	O
doing	O
to	O
much	O
and	O
thinking	O
to	O
complex	O
.	O

dont	O
know	O
if	O
logging.level.org.springframework	O
and	O
the	O
logging.path	O
works	O
with	O
spring	B-Skill
boot	I-Skill
.	O

You	O
can	O
try	O
to	O
move	O
your	O
logback.xml	O
file	O
and	O
application.properties	O
directly	O
to	O
resources	O
dir	O
+	O
paste	O
this	O
to	O
logback.xml	O

this	O
should	O
log	O
on	O
console	B-Skill
and	O
your	O
/tmp	O
(	O
if	O
linux	B-Skill
)	O
dir	O
.	O

to	O

opencv-2.4.10	B-Skill

I	O
am	O
starting	O
a	O
project	O
where	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
make	O
some	O
not	O
equality	O
Join	O
.	O

Now	O
,	O
I	O
've	O
read	O
that	O
neither	O
Pig	B-Skill
nor	O
Hive	B-Skill
support	O
inequality	O
Join	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
also	O
read	O
that	O
Pig	B-Skill
can	O
support	O
that	O
by	O
using	O
CROSS	O
and	O
FILTER	O
.	O

Could	O
I	O
do	O
that	O
also	O
in	O
Hive	B-Skill
using	O
WHERE	O
clause	O
?	O

any	O
cases	O
where	O

is	O
not	O
possible	O
?	O

Finally	O
,	O
supposed	O
that	O

and	O

,	O

would	O
be	O
better	O
about	O
performance	O
?	O

I	O
remember	O
Hive	B-Skill
can	O
only	O
use	O
one	O
reducer	O
to	O
do	O
"	O
CROSS	O
"	O
.	O

Pig	B-Skill
uses	O
a	O
smart	O
approach	O
to	O
implement	O
"	O
CROSS	O
"	O
and	O
run	O
it	O
in	O
parallel	O
and	O
it	O
usually	O
has	O
better	O
performance	O
than	O
Hive	B-Skill
.	O

BTW	O
,	O
I	O
have	O
not	O
updated	O
my	O
knowledge	O
about	O
Hive	B-Skill
and	O
Pig	B-Skill
for	O
one	O
year	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
not	O
sure	O
if	O
Hive	B-Skill
improved	O
"	O
CROSS	O
"	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
year	O
.	O

Problem	O
:	O

I	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
different	O
size	O
scale	O
for	O
edges	O
and	O
nodes	O
in	O
a	O
network	B-Skill
created	O
with	O
the	O
ggnetwork	B-Skill
package	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
look	O
at	O
the	O
image	O
below	O
you	O
may	O
think	O
I	O
already	O
did	O
that	O
since	O
they	O
all	O
have	O
different	O
sizes	O
but	O
in	O
fact	O
edge	O
and	O
node	O
size	O
are	O
not	O
scaled	O
independently	O
in	O
this	O
plot	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
both	O
scaled	O
by	O
the	O
scale_size_area()	O
function	O
towards	O
the	O
same	O
maximum	O
(	O
30	O
)	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
get	O
larger	O
nodes	O
my	O
edges	O
will	O
shrink	O
.	O

I	O
guess	O
my	O
problem	O
boils	O
down	O
to	O
scaling	O
the	O
size	O
of	O
different	O
geoms	O
with	O
different	O
functions	O
.	O

So	O
for	O
example	O
how	O
can	O
I	O
scale	O
the	O
size	O
of	O
the	O
nodes	O
with	O
scale_size_area	O
(	O
max_size	O
=	O
30	O
)	O
and	O
the	O
size	O
of	O
the	O
edges	O
with	O
scale_size_continuous	O
(	O
range	O
=	O
c(1,6))	O
?	O

Example	O
code	O
:	O

Example	O
plot	O
:	O

Almost	O
a	O
duplicate	O
of	O
this	O
question	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
not	O
a	O
ggplot2	B-Skill
expert	O
,	O
but	O
as	O
far	O
I	O
understand	O
,	O
dual-scaling	O
(	O
e.g	O
.	O
having	O
two	O
y-axes	O
or	O
two	O
color	O
scales	O
)	O
contradicts	O
the	O
grammar	O
of	O
graphics	O
.	O

The	O
solution	O
to	O
the	O
aforementioned	O
question	O
might	O
work	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
's	O
a	O
hack	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
trying	O
to	O
use	O
SVG	O
images	O
in	O
CKEDITOR	B-Skill
.	O

To	O
accomplish	O
this	O
I	O
base64_encode	O
the	O
image	O
and	O
using	O
them	O
in	O
the	O
image	O
source	O
,	O
so	O
the	O
image	O
becomes	O
:	O

This	O
almost	O
works	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
preview	B-Skill
I	O
see	O
the	O
image	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
,	O
the	O
moment	O
I	O
save	O
the	O
image	O
the	O
"	O
+	O
"	O
-signs	O
become	O
replaces	O
by	O
whitespaces	O
.	O

It	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
an	O
CKEditor	B-Skill
setting	O
.	O

I	O
var_dumped	O
the	O
variable	O
the	O
moment	O
it	O
came	O
to	O
the	O
server	B-Skill
,	O
and	O
the	O
spaces	O
where	O
already	O
there	O
.	O

Does	O
anyone	O
have	O
a	O
clue	O
how	O
this	O
is	O
happening	O
?	O

I	O
testing	O
an	O
implementation	O
of	O
the	O
singleton	O
pattern	O
and	O
I	O
feel	O
like	O
I	O
ca	O
n't	O
figure	O
out	O
why	O
IntelliJ	B-Skill
is	O
throwing	O
me	O
an	O
error	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
the	O
code	O
.	O

And	O
here	O
is	O
where	O
how	O
I	O
'm	O
calling	O
it	O
:	O

The	O
error	O
I	O
'm	O
getting	O
:	O

You	O
are	O
calling	O
static	O
method	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
called	O
by	O
the	O
Class	O
so	O
remove	O
the	O
new	O
keyword	O
and	O
update	O
the	O
code	O
as	O
below	O
:	O

The	O
other	O
answers	O
are	O
correct	O
however	O
this	O
implementation	O
of	O
the	O
Singleton	O
pattern	O
is	O
horribly	O
flawed	O
and	O
will	O
break	O
in	O
unexpected	O
ways	O
in	O
a	O
multi-threading	O
environment	O
.	O

The	O
easiest	O
way	O
is	O
not	O
to	O
have	O
lazy	O
initialization	O
of	O
the	O
singleton	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
really	O
must	O
have	O
lazy	O
initialization	O
then	O
do	O
it	O
using	O
a	O
static	O
holder	O
:	O

This	O
uses	O
the	O
class	O
loader	O
to	O
handle	O
all	O
the	O
lazy	O
initialization	O
,	O
thread	O
safety	O
,	O
etc	O
for	O
you	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
completely	O
thread	O
safe	O
and	O
fast	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
it	O
does	O
n't	O
need	O
synchronization	O
or	O
null	O
checks	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
implement	O
an	O
algorithm	O
for	O
process	O
histograms	O
images	O
using	O
multiple	O
threads	O
.	O

One	O
of	O
the	O
most	O
common	O
approach	O
is	O
to	O
split	O
multiple	O
thread	O
create	O
a	O
cache	O
buffer	B-Skill
on	O

one	O
,	O
do	O
the	O
histogram	O
on	O
the	O
cache	O
buffer	B-Skill
and	O
then	O
lock	O
a	O
mutex	O
addition	O
the	O
values	O
on	O
the	O
local	O
to	O
the	O
output	O
vector	B-Skill
,	O
and	O
unlock	O
the	O
buffer	B-Skill
.	O

This	O
approach	O
is	O
very	O
efficient	O
but	O
can	O
introduce	O
a	O
'	O
jam	O
'	O
.	O

I	O
mean	O
the	O
additions	O
of	O
the	O
datas	O
cannot	O
be	O

.	O

In	O
most	O

the	O

)	O

to	O
proceed	O

addition	O

.	O

of	O
datas	O

of	O
unsigned	O

values	O

)	O

the	O
range	O
.	O

.	O

-notify	O

do	O
a	O
null	O
check	O
for	O

.	O

:	O

^	O
\[\]]*\[([^\]]+)\]	O

:	O
\1\n	O

Check	O
regular	O
expression	O

Click	O
Replace	O
or	O
Replace	O
All	O

Explanation	O

one	O
problem	O
is	O
that	O
brackets	O
are	O
RE	O
metacharacters	O
,	O
that	O
means	O
we	O
have	O
to	O
escape	O
each	O
bracket	O
,	O
when	O
we	O
need	O
a	O
literal	O
bracket	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O

a	O
literal	O
bracket	O
becomes	O
\	O
[	O
or	O
\	O
]	O
in	O
the	O
RE	O

here	O
in	O
the	O
RE	O
we	O
look	O
for	O
an	O
optional	O
part	O
that	O
may	O
consist	O
of	O
everything	O
not	O
brackets	O
(	O
[	O
\	O
[	O
\	O
]	O
]	O
*)	O

followed	O
by	O
an	O
opening	O
bracket	O
,	O
followed	O
by	O
somthing	O
not	O
a	O
closing	O
bracket	O
((	O
[	O
^\	O
]	O
]	O
+))	O
which	O
is	O
also	O
captured	O
into	O
\1	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
parentheses	O
,	O
for	O
reuse	O
in	O
the	O
substitution	O

whatever	O
is	O
matched	O
above	O
is	O
completely	O
replaced	O
by	O
whatever	O
was	O
captured	O
into	O
\1	O
followed	O
by	O
a	O
newline	O
(	O
\n	O
)	O
,	O
when	O
you	O
need	O
windows-style	O
lineendings	O
,	O
you	O
might	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
\r\n	O
instead	O

I	O
am	O

Notice	O

did	O

"	O
or	O
the	O
like	O
.	O

The	O

purpose	O
of	O

command	O
is	O
to	O

configure	O
how	O
git	B-Skill
works	O
.	O

The	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

.	O

,	O
I	O

to	O
"	O
alias	O
.	O
"	O

!	O

My	O
question	O
is	O
:	O
Which	O
is	O
better	O
between	O
using	O
NotificationCenter	O
and	O
using	O
Closures	O
to	O
communicate	O
between	O
two	O
instances	O
?	O

If	O
they	O
are	O
similar	O
,	O
what	O
should	O
I	O
use	O
?	O

Hopefully	O
,	O
this	O
example	O
helps	O
you	O
to	O
understand	O
better	O
:	O

If	O
we	O
take	O
URLSession	O
class	O
as	O
an	O
example	O
.	O

Why	O
do	O
most	O
of	O
its	O
methods	O
have	O
a	O
closure	O
?	O

Why	O
do	O
not	O
they	O
send	O
a	O
notification	O
with	O
Data	O
,	O
Response	O
,	O
and	O
Error	O
inside	O
it	O
?	O

I	O
know	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
them	O
,	O
I	O
just	O
do	O
n't	O
know	O
in	O
what	O
situations	O
should	O
I	O
use	O
each	O
one	O
.	O

In	O
some	O
cases	O
the	O
patterns	O
are	O
interchangeable	O
,	O
however	O
:	O

Using	O
a	O
closure	O
is	O
the	O
simplest	O
solution	O
for	O
simple	O
cases	O

Using	O
a	O
delegate	O
is	O
common	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
complex	O
communication	O
between	O
two	O
objects	O
.	O

One	O
delegate	O
can	O
be	O
better	O
than	O
many	O
closures	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
notifications	O
when	O
you	O
have	O
multiple	O
observers	O
or	O
when	O
you	O
are	O
not	O
sure	O
what	O
objects	O
will	O
be	O
observing	O
.	O

You	O
might	O
be	O
asking	O
yourself	O
why	O
we	O
are	O
using	O
closures	O
for	O
simple	O
cases	O
and	O
not	O
delegates	O
or	O
notifications	O
.	O

The	O
answer	O
is	O
that	O
closures	O
are	O
the	O
most	O
lightweight	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
easy	O
to	O
create	O
and	O
they	O
positively	O
affect	O
your	O
code	O
quality	O
.	O

Let	O
's	O
consider	O
a	O
completion	O
callback	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
decide	O
to	O
use	O
a	O
notification	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
another	O
method	O
that	O
will	O
handle	O
that	O
notification	O
.	O

The	O
same	O
is	O
valid	O
for	O
delegates	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
need	O
some	O
context	O
(	O
e.g	O
.	O
the	O
parameters	O
that	O
triggered	O
the	O
actions	O
)	O
,	O
you	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
save	O
it	O
into	O
a	O
property	O
.	O

On	O
the	O
other	O
hand	O
,	O
a	O
closure	O
can	O
be	O
created	O
inline	O
.	O

That	O
means	O
that	O
the	O
code	O
that	O
triggers	O
the	O
action	O
and	O
handles	O
its	O
result	O
is	O
at	O
one	O
place	O
.	O

This	O
really	O
simplifies	O
the	O
structure	O
of	O
your	O
code	O
.	O

Also	O
note	O
that	O
if	O
the	O
closure	O
needs	O
some	O
context	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
capture	O
it	O
,	O
without	O
the	O
need	O
to	O
create	O
an	O
additional	O
property	O
.	O

Here	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
pass	O
the	O
value	O
which	O
am	O
getting	O
in	O
data	O
to	O
the	O
controller	O
so	O
I	O
gave	O
my	O
code	O
like	O
this	O
.	O

My	O
controller	O
looks	O
like	O
this	O
.	O

But	O
when	O
I	O
pass	O
into	O
the	O
controller	O
am	O
getting	O
error	O
like	O
undefined	O
index	O
data	O
in	O
console	B-Skill

My	O
toPost	O
variable	O
contains	O
value	O
like	O
this	O

If	O
submit_data	O
referred	O
here	O
is	O
a	O
form	O
field	O

Try	O
to	O
get	O
data	O
by	O

Serialization	O
basically	O
does	O
this	O
:	O

and	O
this	O
:	O
field_name_1	O
=	O
field_value_1&field_name_2	O
=	O
field_value_2	O

Instead	O

you	O

to	O

^	O

.	O

.	O

stuff.sql	O

Edit	O
:	O

This	O
code	O
will	O

"	O

.	O

I	O

that	O
function	O
:	O

int	O
&	O
is	O
a	O
reference	O
to	O
an	O
int	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O
an	O

to	O

function	O

function	O
will	O

,	O

.	O

So	O
maybe	O
you	O
already	O
see	O
it	O
:	O
passing	O
a	O
constant	O
is	O
not	O

.	O

I	O
'm	O
not	O
into	O
python	B-Skill
at	O
all	O
,	O
so	O
I	O
do	O

to	O
the	O
function	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
implemented	O
an	O
OpenID	O
IdP	O
and	O
an	O
RP	O
.	O

They	O
seem	O
to	O
be	O
working-	O
the	O

https://github.com/senayar/books	O

form	O

:	O

on	O

.	O

Sample	O
run	O

Here	O
's	O
a	O
simple	O
pure-Python	B-Skill
way	O
to	O
do	O
it	O
:	O

I	O
have	O
implemented	O
an	O
invitation	O
system	O
in	O
my	O
application	O
,	O
that	O
generates	O
an	O
ical	O
attachment	O
that	O
is	O
sent	O
to	O
the	O
appropriate	O
users	O
.	O

Is	O
it	O
possible	O
to	O
add	O
a	O
link	O
in	O
the	O
email	O
body	O
that	O
would	O
trigger	O
the	O
processing	O
of	O
the	O
invitation	O
?	O

(	O
in	O
addition	O
to	O
the	O
extra	O
buttons	O
provided	O
by	O
some	O
email	B-Skill
clients	I-Skill
)	O

This	O
question	O
mentions	O
that	O
for	O
email	O
attachments	O
in	O
the	O
general	O
case	O
it	O
's	O
not	O
possible	O
.	O

Is	O
it	O
still	O
the	O
case	O
for	O
icalendar	B-Skill
attachments	O
?	O

Other	O
questions	O
suggest	O
using	O
a	O
service	O
like	O
https://www.addevent.com/	O
,	O
but	O
this	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
more	O
oriented	O
toward	O
"	O
public	O
events	O
"	O
,	O
whereas	O
in	O
my	O
case	O
I	O
would	O
need	O
something	O
quite	O
private	O
(	O
only	O
invitations	O
between	O
2	O
people	O
)	O
,	O
that	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
generates	O
quite	O
often	O
(	O
should	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
scale	O
up	O
to	O
100/day	O
without	O
problem	O
)	O
,	O
or	O
it	O
it	O
just	O
me	O
getting	O
a	O
bad	O
impression	O
?	O

Dealt	O
with	O
this	O
problem	O
several	O
years	O
ago	O
and	O
there	O
was	O
no	O
way	O
you	O
could	O
force	O
most	O
email	B-Skill
client	I-Skill
to	O
"	O
process	O
"	O
(	O
trigger	O
"	O
Add	O
to	O
calendar	O
"	O
menu	O
)	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
is	O
just	O
make	O
some	O
element	O
in	O
your	O
email	O
trigger	O
that	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
do	O
this	O
by	O
simply	O
linking	O
that	O
element	O
to	O
.ical	O
file	O
on	O
your	O
server	O
.	O

The	O
advantage	O
is	O
that	O
you	O
can	O
attache	O
some	O
parameters	O
to	O
your	O
link	O
and	O
generate	O
that	O
event	O
file	O
dynamically	O
.	O

Also	O
,	O
it	O
scales	O
pretty	O
well	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
using	O
standard	O
GWT	B-Skill
(	O
2.0.1	O
)	O
to	O
make	O
an	O
internet	O
app	O
and	O
i	O
have	O
this	O
wierd	O
issue	O
with	O
huge	O
fonts	O
(	O
edit	O
:	O
well	O
,	O
larger	O
than	O
normal	O
)	O
with	O
the	O
default	O
style	O
in	O
IE	B-Skill
7	O
&	O
8	O
,	O
while	O
FF	B-Skill
,	O
Chrome	B-Skill
and	O
Safari	B-Skill
are	O
displaying	O
fonts	O
correctly	O
.	O

At	O
first	O
i	O
thought	O
it	O
must	O
be	O
on	O
error	O
on	O
my	O
side	O
(	O
i	O
use	O
UiBinder	O
with	O
some	O
custom	O
css	B-Skill
)	O
but	O
then	O
I	O
noticed	O
that	O
on	O
the	O
GWT	B-Skill
showcases	O
site	O
the	O
various	O
widget	O
fonts	O
are	O
also	O
too	O
big	O
.	O

Any	O
ideas	O
?	O

This	O
is	O
due	O
to	O
IE	B-Skill
default	O
font	O
size	O
rendering	O
and	O
has	O
nothing	O
to	O
do	O
with	O
GWT	B-Skill
but	O
rather	O
with	O
CSS	B-Skill
styling	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
ensure	O
that	O
fonts	O
are	O
consistent	O
over	O
multiple	O
browser	B-Skill
with	O
a	O
CSS	B-Skill
like	O
that	O
(	O
for	O
instance	O
)	O
:	O

EDIT	O
:	O

To	O
ensure	O
all	O
widgets	O
"	O
get	O
"	O
this	O
new	O
style	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
put	O
your	O
CSS	O
file	O
in	O
the	O
*	O
.gwt.xml	O
file	O
in	O
the	O
following	O
way	O
(	O
the	O
order	O
of	O
lines	O
is	O
important	O
)	O
:	O

do	O
n't	O
put	O
it	O
in	O
the	O
HTML	B-Skill
page	O
!	O

This	O
will	O
ensure	O
that	O
your	O
style	O
override	O
the	O
widget	O
styles	O
.	O

PS	O
:	O
You	O
might	O
override	O
some	O
widget	O
styles	O
by	O
hand	O
(	O
I	O
have	O
a	O
GwtOverride.css	O
for	O
that	O
purpose	O
)	O
..	O
.	O
see	O
snippet	O
:	O

A	O
quick	O
comparison	O
between	O
Opera	B-Skill
10.10	O
,	O
IE	B-Skill
6	O
and	O
FF	B-Skill
3.6	O
(	O
all	O
on	O
WinXP	B-Skill
SP	O
3)	O
Opera	B-Skill
and	O
IE	B-Skill
show	O
slightly	O
larger	O
fonts	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
not	O
sure	O
if	O
that	O
's	O
GWT	B-Skill
's	O
fault	O
every	O
browser	B-Skill
has	O
some	O
core	O
CSS	B-Skill
rules	O
defining	O
the	O
default	O
look	O
,	O
if	O
no	O
additional	O
CSS	B-Skill
styles	O
are	O
applied	O
(	O
like	O
that	O
annoying	O
blue	O
border	O
on	O
all	O
images	O
in	O
FF	B-Skill
)	O
,	O
so	O
just	O
make	O
sure	O
you	O
set	O
explicitly	O
your	O
font	O
size	O
,	O
etc	O
to	O
nullify	O
these	O
differences	O
.	O

That	O
is	O
,	O
unless	O
you	O
are	O
seeing	O
fonts	O
way	O
larger	O
than	O
they	O
should	O
be	O
then	O
it	O
might	O
be	O
a	O
bug	O
.	O

Update	O
:	O
under	O
Linux	B-Skill
(	O
Gentoo	O
amd6	O
4)	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
same	O
Opera	B-Skill
reneders	O
slightly	O
larger	O
fonts	O
than	O
Firefox	B-Skill
,	O
but	O
nothing	O
that	O
looks	O
odd	O
.	O

So	O
I	O
have	O
my	O
main	O
dialog	O
that	O
calls	O
modeless	O
dialogs	O
through	O
this	O
function	O
(	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
legacy	O
code	O
on	O
the	O
project	O
)	O
:	O

Problem	O
:	O
all	O
sub	O
dialogs	O
stay	O
on	O
top	O
of	O
my	O
main	O
dialog	O
.	O

Desired	O
behavior	O
:	O
whichever	O
's	O
focused	O
(	O
they	O
are	O
all	O
modeless	O
)	O
,	O
be	O
it	O
the	O
main	O
dialog	O
,	O
or	O
sub	O
dialogs	O
,	O
I	O
want	O
it	O
to	O
be	O
the	O
topmost	O
dialog	O
.	O

Thank	O
you	O
!	O

Note	O
:	O
I	O
already	O
tried	O
on	O
my	O
main	O
dialog	O
's	O
OnInitDialog()	O
these	O
but	O
did	O
n't	O
work	O
:	O

1	O
.	O
SetWindowPos(&this->wndTop,0,0,0,0,SWP_NOMOVE|SWP_NOSIZE)	O
;	O

2	O
.	O
SetWindowPos(&this->wndTopMost,0,0,0,0,SWP_NOMOVE|SWP_NOSIZE)	O
;	O

EDIT	O

Also	O
,	O
sub	O
dialogs	O
are	O
created	O
this	O
way	O
:	O

m_subDlg1->Create	O
(	O
SubDlg1::IDD	O
,	O
this	O
)	O
;	O

As	O
long	O
as	O
there	O
is	O
an	O
owner	O
relation	O
between	O
two	O
windows	O
.	O

the	O
owner	O
of	O
a	O
window	O
can	O
never	O
be	O
on	O
top	O
of	O
the	O
owned	O
window	O
.	O

Windows	O
in	O
an	O
owner	O
,	O
parent	O
,	O
child	O
relation	O
always	O
behave	O
the	O
same	O
.	O

The	O
owned/child	O
window	O
is	O
always	O
on	O
top	O
of	O
the	O
parent/owner	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
break	O
this	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
break	O
the	O
owner/child	O
relation	O
.	O

Let	O
all	O
dialog	O
windows	O
have	O
no	O
owner	O
..	O
.	O
than	O
they	O
may	O
float	O
freely	O
.	O

But	O
:	O
I	O
will	O
expect	O
the	O
you	O
program	O
does	O
n't	O
behave	O
better	O
.	O

Even	O
worse	O
.	O

User	O
might	O
search	O
windows	O
that	O
are	O
deep	O
below	O
covered	O
under	O
other	O
windows	O
.	O

And	O
they	O
will	O
never	O
get	O
in	O
front	O
,	O
when	O
your	O
program	O
gets	O
active	O
.	O

See	O
the	O
description	O
about	O
parent/child/owned	O
windows	O
here	O
.	O

Also	O
this	O
article	O
might	O
be	O
helpful	O
.	O

Edit	O
:	O
The	O
problem	O
is	O
that	O
internally	O
the	O
MFC	B-Skill
sets	O
the	O
main	O
window	O
as	O
an	O
owner	O
if	O
no	O
parent	O
is	O
given	O
.	O

Only	O
the	O
call	O
to	O
BOOL	O
Wnd	O
::	O

lpDialogTemplate	O
,	O
CWnd	O
*	O
pParentWnd	O
,	O
HINSTANCE	O
hInst	O
)	O
allows	O
to	O
leave	O
pParentWnd	O
NULL	O
.	O

So	O
you	O
may	O
create	O
the	O
window	O
as	O
normal	O
,	O

use	O

after	O

was	O

.	O

Again	O
the	O
MFC	B-Skill
ASSERTs	O
this	O
.	O

you	O
may	O
use	O
the	O
API	B-Skill
function	O
and	O
the	O
handle	O
of	O
your	O
dialog	O
.	O

I	O
am	O

some	O

into	O
the	O
Memento	B-Skill
Pattern	I-Skill
and	O
I	O
am	O
generally	O
new	O
to	O
behavioural	O
patterns	O
and	O

my	O
research	O
I	O
have	O
been	O

pretty	O
confused	O
.	O

One	O
of	O
the	O
main	O
things	O
I	O
have	O
been	O
getting	O
confused	O
on	O
is	O
the	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
Memento	B-Skill
Pattern	I-Skill
and	O
Serialization	O
.	O

From	O
what	O
I	O
can	O
gather	O
both	O
can	O
be	O
used	O
to	O
store	O
objects	O
and	O
have	O
them	O
brought	O
back	O
at	O
a	O
later	O
date	O
but	O
I	O
have	O
not	O
been	O
able	O
to	O
find	O
a	O
clear	O
cut	O
answer	O
on	O
what	O
the	O
key	O
differences	O
between	O
them	O
are	O
,	O
maybe	O
I	O
have	O
missed	O
something	O
in	O
my	O
research	O
but	O
I	O
was	O
wondering	O
if	O
anyone	O
could	O
shed	O
some	O
light	O
on	O
what	O
the	O
differences	O
are	O
between	O
the	O
two	O
.	O

Thanks	O

Typically	O
the	O
Memento	B-Skill
pattern	I-Skill
is	O
used	O
to	O
implement	O
roll-back/save	O
point	O
support	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
I	O
might	O
want	O
to	O
mark	O
the	O
state	O
of	O
an	O
object	O
at	O
a	O
point	O
in	O
time	O
,	O
do	O
some	O
work	O
and	O
then	O
decide	O
to	O
revert	O
that	O
object	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
point	O
at	O
which	O
is	O
was	O
marked	O
.	O

The	O
implementation	O
of	O
a	O
Memento	B-Skill
pattern	I-Skill
could	O
use	O
serialisation	O
,	O
which	O
would	O
involve	O
saving	O
the	O
contents	O
of	O
the	O
object	O
into	O
a	O
byte[]	B-Skill
and	O
keeping	O
in	O
memory	O
or	O
writing	O
to	O
disk	O
.	O

When	O
reverting	O
the	O
content	O
of	O
the	O
object	O
would	O
be	O
rebuilt	O
from	O
the	O
serialised	O
copy	O
.	O

Conversely	O
I	O
could	O
implement	O
a	O
Memento	B-Skill
pattern	I-Skill
by	O
cloning	O
the	O
object	O
in	O
memory	O
and	O
keeping	O
a	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
copy	O
and	O
then	O
copying	O
the	O
state	O
back	O
if	O
the	O
object	O
needs	O
reverting	O
.	O

This	O
method	O
does	O
n't	O
use	O
serialisation	O
.	O

The	O
Memento	B-Skill
pattern	I-Skill
is	O
an	O
OO	B-Skill
design	I-Skill
pattern	I-Skill
used	O
to	O
keep	O
previous	O
states	O
of	O
an	O
object	O
in	O
memory	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
useful	O
to	O
implement	O
an	O
"	O
Undo	O
"	O
operation	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
.	O

Serialization	O
is	O
the	O
process	O
of	O
transforming	O
a	O
graph	B-Skill
of	O
objects	O
to	O
a	O
byte	B-Skill
array	I-Skill
,	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
save	O
it	O
on	O
disk	O
,	O
or	O
send	O
it	O
to	O
another	O
JVM	B-Skill
over	O
the	O
network	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
.	O

They	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
much	O
in	O
common	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
different	O
<select>	O
in	O
a	O
ng-repeat	O
div	O
.	O

What	O
I	O
want	O
is	O
to	O
avoid	O
users	O
select	O
several	O
times	O
a	O
same	O
option	O
.	O

I	O
used	O
the	O
filter	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

The	O
filter	O
works	O
like	O
I	O
want	O
(	O
I	O
tested	O
it	O
separately	O
)	O
.	O

But	O
the	O
result	O
is	O
not	O
good	O
.	O

When	O
the	O
filter	O
is	O
active	O
,	O
options	O
in	O
different	O
select	O
have	O
to	O
show	O
only	O
"	O
free	O
"	O
attributes	O
(	O
it	O
means	O
,	O
attributes	O
which	O
are	O
not	O
yet	O
selected	O
)	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
a	O
Demo	O
which	O
is	O
more	O
explicit	O
I	O
suppose	O
.	O

I	O
found	O
that	O
std::condition_variable	O
is	O
very	O
difficult	O
to	O
use	O
due	O
to	O
spurious	O
wakeups	O
.	O

So	O
sometimes	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
set	O
a	O
flags	O
such	O
as	O
:	O

I	O
set	O
is_ready	O
to	O
true	O
before	O
I	O
call	O
notify	O
(	O
notify_one()	O
or	O
notify_all())	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
I	O
wait	O
:	O

Is	O
there	O
any	O
reason	O
that	O
I	O
should	O
n't	O
just	O
do	O
this	O
:	O
(	O
Edit	O
:	O
Ok	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
really	O
a	O
bad	O
idea	O
.	O
)	O

And	O
if	O
condition_variable	O
had	O
chosen	O
a	O
waiting	O
duration	O
(	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
know	O
whether	O
this	O
is	O
true	O
or	O
not	O
)	O
,	O
I	O
prefer	O
choose	O
it	O
myself	O
.	O

The	O
purpose	O
of	O
std::condition_variable	O
is	O
to	O
wait	O
for	O
some	O
condition	O
to	O
become	O
true	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
not	O
designed	O
to	O
be	O
just	O
a	O
receiver	O
of	O
a	O
notify	O
.	O

You	O
might	O
use	O
it	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
when	O
a	O
consumer	O
thread	O
needs	O
to	O
wait	O
for	O
a	O
queue	B-Skill
to	O
become	O
non-empty	O
.	O

The	O
consumer	O
(	O
get_from_queue	O
)	O
is	O
not	O
waiting	O
for	O
the	O
condition	O
variable	O
,	O
they	O
are	O
waiting	O
for	O
the	O
condition	O
the_queue.empty()	O
.	O

The	O
condition	O
variable	O
gives	O
you	O
the	O
way	O
to	O
put	O
them	O
to	O
sleep	O
while	O
they	O
are	O
waiting	O
,	O
simultaneously	O
releasing	O
the	O
mutex	O
and	O
doing	O
so	O
in	O
a	O
way	O
that	O
avoids	O
race	O
conditions	O
where	O
you	O
miss	O
wake	O
ups	O
.	O

The	O
condition	O
you	O
are	O
waiting	O
on	O
should	O
be	O
protected	O
by	O
a	O
mutex	O
(	O
the	O
one	O
you	O
release	O
when	O
you	O
wait	O
on	O
the	O
condition	O
variable	O
.	O
)	O

This	O
means	O
that	O
the	O
condition	O
rarely	O
(	O
if	O
ever	O
)	O
needs	O
to	O
be	O
an	O
atomic	O
.	O

You	O
are	O
always	O
accessing	O
it	O
from	O
within	O
a	O
mutex	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
code	O
this	O
either	O
way	O
:	O

Using	O
atomics	O
and	O
a	O
polling	O
loop	O
.	O

Using	O
a	O
condition_variable	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
coded	O
it	O
both	O
ways	O
for	O
you	O
below	O
.	O

On	O
my	O
system	O
I	O
can	O
monitor	O
in	O
real	O
time	O
how	O
much	O
cpu	O
any	O
given	O
process	O
is	O
using	O
.	O

First	O
with	O
the	O
polling	O
loop	O
:	O

For	O
me	O
this	O
takes	O
30	O
seconds	O
to	O
execute	O
,	O
and	O
while	O
executing	O
the	O
process	O
takes	O
about	O
99.6	O
%	O
of	O
a	O
cpu	O
.	O

Alternatively	O
with	O
a	O
condition_variable	O
:	O

This	O
has	O
the	O
exact	O
same	O
behavior	O
except	O
that	O
during	O
the	O
30	O
second	O
execution	O
,	O
the	O
process	O
is	O
taking	O
0.0	O
%	O
cpu	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
're	O
writing	O
an	O
app	O
that	O
might	O
execute	O
on	O
a	O
battery	O
powered	O
device	O
,	O
the	O
latter	O
is	O
nearly	O
infinitely	O
easier	O
on	O
the	O
battery	O
.	O

Now	O
admittedly	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
had	O
a	O
very	O
poor	O
implementation	O
of	O
std::condition_variable	O
,	O
it	O
could	O
have	O
the	O
same	O
inefficiency	O
as	O
the	O
polling	O
loop	O
.	O

However	O
in	O
practice	O
such	O
a	O
vendor	O
ought	O
to	O
go	O
out	O
of	O
business	O
fairly	O
quickly	O
.	O

Update	O

For	O
grins	O
I	O
augmented	O
my	O
condition_variable	O
wait	O
loop	O
with	O
a	O
spurious	O
wakeup	O
detector	O
.	O

I	O
ran	O
it	O
again	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
did	O
not	O
print	O
out	O
anything	O
.	O

Not	O
one	O
spurious	O
wakeup	O
.	O

That	O
is	O
of	O
course	O
not	O
guaranteed	O
.	O

But	O
it	O
does	O
demonstrate	O
what	O
a	O
quality	O
implementation	O
can	O
achieve	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
5000	O
data	O
in	O
DB	O
table	B-Skill
,	O
and	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
apply	O
jQuery	B-Skill
Autosuggestion	O
Filter	O
on	O
frontend	O
and	O
for	O
this	O
requirement	O
implemented	O
js	B-Skill
&	O
CSS	B-Skill

select2.css	O
and	O
select2.js	O
with	O
jquery-2.1.1.js	O
.	O

But	O
unfortunately	O
after	O
implementing	O
and	O
when	O
I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
access	O
Autosuggestion	O
Filter	O
from	O
front-end	O
,	O
here	O
I	O
found	O
delay	O
is	O
more	O
so	O
can	O
anyone	O
suggest	O
me	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
will	O
load	O
very	O
fast	O
and	O
no	O
delay	O
.	O

Thanks	O
!	O

Are	O
you	O
limiting	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
records	O

are	O

to	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

Hope	O

.	O

I	O

bad	O

Can	O
it	O

an	O

Plus	I-Skill

as	O
a	O

.	O
http://domain.com/ads/	O
...	O

of	O

allows	O
to	O
block	O

embeds	O
from	O

.	O

browsers	B-Skill
,	O
expecially	O
mobile	O

all	O

user	O

on	O
particular	O

download	O
and	O
start	O
it	O
.	O

Microsoft	O
announced	O
the	O
availability	O
of	O
Azure	B-Skill
DocumentDB	I-Skill
as	O
follows	O
..	O
.	O

I	O
really	O
like	O
the	O
"	O
transactional	O
execution	O
of	O
JavaScript	B-Skill
logic	O
"	O
.	O

Sounds	O
like	O
an	O
approach	O
similar	O
to	O
that	O
of	O
PostgreSQL	B-Skill
NoSQL	I-Skill
.	O

Anyone	O
know	O
what	O
is	O
the	O
technological	O
basis	O
for	O
the	O
Azure	B-Skill
DocumentDB	I-Skill
service	O
?	O

SQL	B-Skill
Server	B-Skill
?	O

DocumentDB	B-Skill
has	O
been	O
built	O
from	O
the	O
ground	O
up	O
as	O
an	O
entirely	O
new	O
database	O
specifically	O
designed	O
for	O
JSON	O
and	O
one	O
that	O
has	O
deep	O
integration	O
with	O
JavaScript	B-Skill
.	O

It	O
does	O
not	O
share	O
anything	O
with	O
SQL	B-Skill
Server	B-Skill
.	O

Using	O
a	O
KnockBack	O
ViewModel	O
,	O
is	O
there	O
a	O
way	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
computed	O
observable	O
from	O
the	O
underlying	O
Backbone	B-Skill
model	O
's	O
methods	O
?	O

As	O
an	O
example	O
,	O
in	O
javascript	B-Skill
:	O

and	O
in	O
the	O
Knockout	B-Skill
markup	O
:	O

When	O
I	O
try	O
to	O
run	O
this	O
,	O
I	O
get	O
the	O
error	O
:	O

Am	O
I	O
doing	O
something	O
wrong	O
,	O
or	O
do	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
create	O
the	O
observable	O
in	O
the	O
ViewModel	O
manually	O
?	O

jsfiddles	B-Skill
:	O
without	O
observable	O
,	O
with	O
observable	O

A	O
little	O
preamble	O
:	O
Knockback	B-Skill
puts	O
the	O
model	O
in	O
MVVM	B-Skill
,	O
where	O
Knockout	B-Skill
is	O
really	O
just	O
VVM	B-Skill
.	O

Knockback	B-Skill
also	O
gives	O
you	O
some	O
automatic	O
synchronization	O
between	O
them	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
nice	O
.	O

But	O
you	O
still	O
need	O
to	O
keep	O
in	O
mind	O
that	O
the	O
model	O
and	O
the	O
viewmodel	O
are	O
two	O
different	O
pieces	O
of	O
your	O
app	O
.	O

The	O
viewmodel	O
is	O
n't	O
just	O
a	O
Knockout	B-Skill
copy	O
of	O
the	O
Bootstrap	B-Skill
model	O
.	O

Do	O
n't	O
put	O
viewmodel	O
pieces	O
in	O
the	O
model	O
.	O

So	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
decide	O
whether	O
validation	O
is	O
a	O
viewmodel	O
behavior	O
or	O
a	O
model	O
behavior	O
.	O

I	O
say	O
viewmodel	O
,	O
because	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
it	O
in	O
the	O
view	O
.	O

So	O
remove	O
it	O
from	O
the	O
model	O
and	O
define	O
a	O
computed	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
wanted	O
it	O
to	O
be	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
model	O
,	O
you	O
would	O
want	O
to	O
define	O
an	O
attribute	O
,	O
not	O
just	O
a	O
method	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
model	O
event	O
handler	O
that	O
would	O
update	O
the	O
attribute	O
on	O
change	O
.	O

Knockback	B-Skill
will	O
dutifully	O
copy	O
the	O
attribute	O
into	O
the	O
viewmodel	O
,	O
and	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
it	O
there	O
.	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
use	O
TCP	O
Keep	O
Alive	O
connection	O
options	O
on	O
psql.exe	O
running	O
on	O
Windows	B-Skill
connecting	O
to	O
AWS	B-Skill
Redshift	I-Skill
?	O

I	O
tried	O
using	O
this	O
:	O
set	O
PGOPTIONS='-c	O
tcp_keepalives_idle	O
=	O
30	O
-c	O
tcp_keepalives_interval	O
=	O
1	O
-c	O
tcp_keepalives_count=10	O
'	O

I	O
get	O
errors	O
from	O
Redshift	B-Skill
unknown	O
parameters	O
.	O

I	O
tried	O
Windows	B-Skill
Registry	I-Skill
Editor	I-Skill
to	O
change	O
TCP	O
Keep	O
Alive	O
parameters	O
,	O
with	O
reboot	O
,	O
no	O
effect	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
not	O
able	O
to	O
run	O
via	O
psql	B-Skill
any	O
moderately	O
long	O

statement	O
such	O
as	O

,	O
Copy	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

I	O
can	O

,	O

and	O

but	O

.	O

So	O

option	O
,	O
except	O
that	O

only	O
works	O
on	O
short	O

.	O

thanks	O
!	O
!	O

I	O
am	O
new	O
on	O
Draft-JS	B-Skill
and	O
able	O
to	O
create	O
a	O

.	O

have	O

into	O

,	O
But	O

and	O

are	O

like	O
this	O
.	O

I	O
may	O
sound	O
strange	O
but	O
your	O
help	O
will	O
be	O
highly	O
appreciated	O
as	O
I	O
am	O
unable	O
to	O
find	O
good	O
resources	O
of	O
Draft-JS	B-Skill

My	O
Code	O
for	O
adding	O
html	B-Skill
which	O
I	O
am	O
currently	O
using	O
is	O
:	O

In	O
the	O
above	O
code	O

html	B-Skill
from	O

state	O
from	O
html	B-Skill
and	O
edit	O
the	O
editor	O
state	O
.	O

Thank	O
You.	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
below	O
query	O
in	O
mysql	B-Skill
where	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
check	O
if	O
branch	O
id	O
and	O
year	O
of	O
finance	O
type	O
from	O

are	O
equal	O
with	O
branch	O
id	O
and	O
year	O
of	O
manager	O
then	O
update	O
status	O
in	O
manager	O
table	B-Skill
against	O
branch	O
id	O
in	O
manager	O

but	O
getting	O
error	O

This	O
is	O
a	O
typical	O

thing	O
and	O
can	O
usually	O

by	O

from	O
the	O

derived	O
,	O
i.e	O

:	O

to	O
use	O
the	O

operator	O
:	O

:	O
The	O
query	O
uses	O

nesting	O
level	O

proposed	O

as	O

error	O
.	O

Demo	O
here	O

Overview	O
:	O

I	O
have	O
written	O
an	O
application	O
that	O
allows	O

to	O
define	O

,	O
submit	O

to	O
a	O
server	O
and	O
view	O
the	O
results	O
.	O

The	O
software	O
can	O
run	O
on	O
DB2	B-Skill
or	O
MySQL	B-Skill
.	O

Problem	O
:	O

We	O
've	O
had	O
issues	O
in	O
the	O
DB2	B-Skill
version	O
where	O
a	O
user	O
has	O
tried	O
to	O
run	O
a	O

,	O
and	O
found	O
that	O

has	O

because	O
their	O
user	O
profile	O
has	O
been	O
disabled	O
.	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
run	O
a	O
query	O
on	O
DB2	B-Skill
(	O
on	O
an	O
IBM	B-Skill
i)	I-Skill
,	O
the	O
user	O
's	O
profile	O
name	O
and	O
password	O
are	O
provided	O
in	O
the	O
connection	O
string	O
.	O

Security	O
on	O
the	O
server	O
can	O
specify	O
that	O
a	O
user	O
's	O
profile	O
is	O
disabled	O
after	O
two	O
or	O
three	O
incorrect	O
logins	O
.	O

Question	O
:	O

I	O
've	O
debugged	O
the	O
application	O
and	O
found	O
that	O
the	O
problem	O
is	O
down	O
to	O
the	O
query	O
being	O
submitted	O
twice	O
.	O

If	O

user	O

wrong	O
,	O

,	O
this	O

their	O
profile	O
.	O

On	O

,	O

logs	O
on	O
the	O
server	O
(	O

line	O

)	O

've	O
found	O
that	O

is	O

the	O

call	O

when	O

is	O

to	O

(	O
which	O
is	O

to	O

to	O
the	O
server	O
)	O
.	O

Here	O
's	O
an	O

of	O
the	O
code	O

to	O

the	O

:	O

.	O

's	O
sql	O

?	O

i.e	O

,	O

point	O

on	O
the	O
IBM	B-Skill
i	I-Skill

adoqry.sql.add	O

"	O

"	O

application	O
,	O
via	O
function	O
"	O

and	O

.	O

adoqry.active	O

in	O
the	O
above	O

goes	O

the	O

"	O
Open/Describe	O
"	O
function	O
.	O

If	O

not	O

with	O
the	O
IBM	B-Skill
i	I-Skill
,	O
do	O

about	O

I	O

just	O

that	O

twice	O
.	O

The	O

is	O
with	O
the	O
TADOQuery	B-Skill
's	O
sql.add()	O
processing	O
.	O

From	O
your	O
description	O
of	O
your	O
problem	O
,	O
I	O
assume	O
you	O
specify	O
the	O
ConnectionString	O
of	O
the	O
ADOQuery	O
.	O

Doing	O
this	O
combines	O
the	O
database	O
login	O
with	O
the	O
running	O
of	O
the	O
query	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
found	O
that	O
this	O
has	O
undesirable	O
side	O
effects	O
when	O
the	O
user	O
's	O
credentials	O
are	O
invalid	O
.	O

Separate	O
the	O
database	O
login	O
from	O
the	O
query	O
by	O
using	O
an	O
ADOConnection	O
.	O

Specify	O
the	O
ConnectionString	O
of	O
the	O
ADOConnection	O
and	O
assign	O
the	O
ADOConnection	O
to	O
the	O
ADOQuery.Connection	O
property	O
.	O

This	O
way	O
,	O
you	O
control	O
the	O
database	O
login	O
and	O
can	O
catch	O
logins	O
with	O
bad	O
credentials	O
.	O

Additionally	O
the	O
ADOConnection.Open	O
method	O
allows	O
you	O
to	O
specify	O
the	O
username	O
and	O
password	O
so	O
you	O
do	O
not	O
have	O
to	O
put	O
them	O
in	O
the	O
ConnectionString	O
.	O

While	O
this	O
does	O
not	O
answer	O
you	O
specific	O
questions	O
,	O
this	O
approach	O
will	O
help	O
you	O
solve	O
the	O
problem	O
of	O
the	O
user	O
's	O
profile	O
being	O
disabled	O
by	O
separating	O
the	O
login	O
from	O
the	O
running	O
of	O
the	O
query	O
.	O

I	O
have	O

application	O
on	O

server	I-Skill
(	O
i.e	O
on	O

)	O
.	O

.	O

that	O

.	O

.	O

I	O

.	O

,	O

Shipping	O

:	O

:	O

and	O

.	O

UPDATE	O
from	O
real	O
code	O
:	O

You	O
can	O

,	O

.	O

(	O

)	O

You	O
could	O
try	O

]	O

.	O

not	O

whether	O

for	O

situation	O
or	O
not	O
.	O

Given	O
HTML	B-Skill
that	O

like	O
this	O
:	O

I	O
would	O

,	O

(	O

.	O

Only	O
html	B-Skill
as	O
you	O
pointed	O
out	O
or	O
Javascript	B-Skill
.	O

I	O
am	O
new	O
to	O
android	B-Skill
.	O

My	O
project	O
is	O
having	O
one	O
activity	O
and	O
one	O
service	O
.	O

My	O
service	O
is	O
having	O
one	O
broadcast	O
receiver	O
and	O
activity	O
is	O
having	O
broadcast	O
sender	O
which	O
is	O
in	O
PeriodSender	O
method	O
.Dynamically	O
when	O
i	O
am	O

receiver	O

of	O

service	O

not	O

but	O
if	O
i	O
send	O
some	O
thing	O
after	O

moment	O
then	O

.	O

But	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
register	O
it	O
in	O
Manifest	O
,	O
I	O
have	O
included	O
the	O
receiver	O
details	O
in	O
Manifest	O
but	O
the	O
receiver	O
is	O
not	O
invoking	O
.	O

My	O
receiver	O
class	O
name	O
is	O
MyReceiver21	O
and	O
the	O
intent	O
action	O
is	O
MY_ACTION1	O
.	O

actually	O
I	O
want	O
my	O
broadcast	O
receiver	O
to	O
be	O
registered	O
at	O
the	O
starting	O
it	O
self	O
.	O

You	O
do	O

have	O
to	O
add	O
the	O
intent	O
filter	O
for	O
your	O
own	O
broadcasts	O
.	O

Just	O
register	O
the	O
service	O
for	O
that	O
broadcasts	O
with	O
registerReceiver()	O
when	O
the	O
service	O
is	O
started	O
.	O

Note	O
,	O
that	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
start	O
the	O
service	O
manually	O
when	O
your	O
App	O
starts	O
,	O
for	O
instance	O
in	O
the	O

:	O

When	O
the	O
MainActivity	O
has	O
been	O
created	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
start	O
the	O
service	O
,	O
which	O
itself	O
registers	O
for	O
BroadcastIntents	O
and	O
starts	O
listening	O
for	O
them	O
.	O

This	O
should	O
work	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
making	O
a	O
game	O
with	O
Kivy	B-Skill
where	O
you	O
can	O
move	O
a	O
character	O
around	O
the	O
screen	O
.	O

Earlier	O
,	O
I	O
had	O
it	O
working	O
where	O
when	O
you	O
move	O
the	O
character	O
right	O
,	O
the	O
background	O
image	O
would	O
scroll	O
to	O
the	O
left	O
,	O
and	O
same	O
with	O
the	O
right	O
.	O

http://kivy.org/docs/api-kivy.uix.relativelayout.html	O

.	O

The	O
following	O
C++	B-Skill
function	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
working	O
in	O
Visual	B-Skill
Studio	I-Skill
6	O
(	O
1998	O
year	O
)	O
until	O
I	O
added	O
static	O
.	O

Why	O
?	O

It	O
's	O
dangerously	O
unsafe	O
(	O
undefined	O
behavior	O
)	O
to	O
return	O
a	O
pointer	O
to	O
a	O
stack	B-Skill
variable	O
.	O

That	O
includes	O
arrays	B-Skill
allocated	O
on	O
the	O
stack	B-Skill
.	O

The	O
memory	O
occupied	O
by	O
a	O
stack	B-Skill
variable	O
is	O
essentially	O
deallocated	O
as	O
soon	O
as	O
the	O
function	O
returns	O
.	O

By	O
making	O
the	O
array	B-Skill
allocation	O
static	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
allocation	O
will	O
persist	O
and	O
is	O
safer	O
..	O
.	O

But	O
if	O
any	O
code	O
path	O
caches	O
the	O
pointer	O
returned	O
from	O
"	O
test	O
"	O
,	O
another	O
code	O
path	O
that	O
calls	O
this	O
function	O
could	O
invalidate	O
the	O
previous	O
result	O
.	O

For	O
your	O
example	O
,	O
you	O
probably	O
want	O
to	O
duplicate	O
the	O
string	O
before	O
returning	O
.	O

With	O
the	O
expectation	O
that	O
the	O
caller	O
will	O
"	O
free	O
"	O
the	O
memory	O
later	O
:	O

I	O
want	O
to	O
iterate	O
through	O
a	O
java	B-Skill
arraylist	O
passed	O
as	O
message	O
header	O
to	O
a	O
camel	B-Skill
route	O
via	O
bean	O
so	O
that	O
each	O
string	O
item	O
which	O
is	O
basically	O
an	O
url	O
can	O
be	O
passed	O
as	O
uri	O
argument	O
inside	O
tag	O
in	O
camel	B-Skill
route	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
passing	O
an	O
array	O
list	O
as	O
message	O
header	O
to	O
camel	O
route	O
through	O
java	B-Skill
bean	O
as	O
follows	O

and	O
,	O
inside	O
camel	O
route	O
i	O
want	O
to	O
iterate	O
through	O
this	O
list	O
and	O
retrieve	O
each	O
list	O
item	O
one	O
by	O
one	O
so	O
that	O
i	O
can	O
pass	O
these	O
items	O
in	O
uri	O
.	O

here	O
's	O
my	O
camel	B-Skill
route	O
:	O

But	O
i	O
am	O
not	O
able	O
to	O
iterate	O
through	O
each	O
item	O
in	O
list	O
recieved	O
as	O
header.endpoints	O
inside	O
camel	B-Skill
route	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
the	O
recipient	O
list	O
EIP	O
pattern	O
than	O
can	O
send	O
messages	O
to	O
N+	O
destinations	O
:	O
http://camel.apache.org/recipient-list.html	O

The	O
recipient	O
list	O
EIP	O
is	O
basically	O
a	O
toD	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
do	O
1.N	O
endpoints	O
.	O

Where	O
as	O
toD	O
can	O
only	O
do	O
1	O
.	O

And	O
it	O
should	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
take	O
your	O
message	O
header	O
as-is	O
,	O
eg	O
a	O
List	B-Skill
or	O
Collection	B-Skill
and	O
send	O
to	O
each	O
destination	O
.	O

So	O
do	O

Sorry	O
I	O
will	O
rewrite	O
the	O
question	O
hoping	O
to	O
be	O
clear	O
.	O

In	O
my	O
.cpp	O
code	O
I	O
create	O
a	O
list	B-Skill
of	O
quads	O
,	O
a	O
few	O
of	O
them	O
have	O
a	O
flag	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
pixel	O
shader	O
I	O
check	O
if	O
this	O
flag	O
is	O
set	O
or	O
not	O
,	O
if	O
the	O
flag	O
is	O
not	O
set	O
,	O

quad	O
gets	O
colored	O
in	O
red	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
if	O
the	O
flag	O
is	O
set	O
,	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
decide	O

if	O

to	O

of	O
the	O
flagged	O
quad	O
in	O
red	O
and	O
the	O
other	O
half	O
in	O
blue	O
I	O
can	O
simply	O
do	O
something	O
like	O
:	O

In	O
this	O
way	O
I	O
can	O

to	O

blue	O

.	O

Imagine	O
I	O
've	O
got	O
a	O
quad	O
50x50	O
pixels	O

[	O
frag	O
]	O

In	O
this	O
case	O
I	O
would	O
expect	O
that	O
a	O
quad	O
with	O
the	O
flag	O
set	O

per	O
face	O
.	O

I	O
hope	O
I	O
have	O
been	O
more	O
specific	O
now	O
.	O

thanks	O
.	O

Just	O
to	O
add	O
something	O
I	O
ca	O

use	O
any	O
texture	O
.	O

Ok	O
i	O
do	O
this	O
now	O
:	O

Every	O
quad	O
has	O
4	O
textures	O
coordinated	O
(	O
0	O
,	O
0	O
)	O
,	O
(	O
0	O
,	O
1)	O
,	O
(	O
1	O
,	O
1)	O
,	O
(	O
1	O
,	O
0	O
)	O
;	O

enable	O
the	O
texture	O
coordinates	O

:	O

[	O
vert	O
]	O

[	O
frag	O
]	O

always	O

yellow	O

=	O
1	O
and	O
x2	O
=	O
1	O

.	O

I	O
would	O
expect	O
that	O
the	O
texture	O
coordinates	O
change	O
in	O
the	O
fragment	O
shader	O
and	O
so	O
I	O
should	O
get	O
a	O
gradient	O
,	O
am	O
I	O
wrong	O
?	O

In	O
addition	O
to	O
Chris	O
Dodd	O
's	O
answer	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
also	O
access	O
the	O
screen-space	O
coordinate	O
(	O
in	O
pixels	O
,	O
though	O
actually	O
pixel	O
centers	O
and	O
thus	O
?	O
.	O
5)	O
of	O
the	O
currently	O
processed	O
fragment	O
through	O
the	O
special	O
fragment	O
shader	O
variable	O
gl_FragCoord	O
:	O

But	O
this	O
gives	O
you	O
the	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
fragment	O
in	O
screen-space	O
and	O
thus	O
relative	O
to	O
the	O
lower	O
left	O
corner	O
of	O
you	O
viewport	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
actually	O
need	O
to	O
know	O
the	O
position	O
inside	O
the	O
individual	O
quad	O
(	O
which	O
makes	O
more	O
sense	O
if	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
actually	O
color	O
each	O
quad	O
half-by-half	O
,	O
since	O
the	O
"	O

"	O

otherwise	O
vary	O
with	O
the	O
quad	O
's	O
position	O
)	O
,	O
then	O
Chris	O
Dodd	O
's	O
answer	O
is	O
the	O
correct	O
approach	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
know	O
the	O
coordinate	O
within	O
the	O
quad	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
calculate	O
it	O
yourself	O
.	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
that	O
,	O
you	O
'll	O
need	O
to	O
create	O
a	O
new	O
interpolant	O
(	O
call	O
it	O
something	O
like	O
vec2	O
quadCoord	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
set	O
it	O
appropriately	O
for	O
each	O
vertex	O
,	O
which	O
means	O
you	O
'll	O
likely	O
also	O
need	O
to	O
add	O
it	O
as	O
an	O
attribute	O
and	O
pass	O
it	O
through	O
your	O
vertex	O
shader	O
.	O

eg	O
:	O

You	O
'll	O
need	O
to	O
feed	O
in	O
this	O
attribute	O
in	O
your	O
drawing	O
code	O
when	O
drawing	O
your	O
quads	O
.	O

For	O
each	O
quad	O
,	O
the	O
vertexes	O
will	O
have	O
likely	O
have	O
quadCoordIn	O
values	O
of	O
(	O
0	O
,	O
0	O
)	O
,	O
(	O
0	O
,	O
1)	O
,	O
(	O
1	O
,	O
1)	O
and	O
(	O
1	O
,	O
0	O
)	O
you	O
could	O
use	O
some	O
other	O
coordinate	O
system	O
if	O
you	O
prefer	O
,	O
but	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
easiest	O
.	O

Then	O
,	O
in	O
your	O
fragment	O
program	O
,	O

to	O

are	O
.	O

i	O
have	O
a	O

,	O

values	O
of	O
which	O

to	O

.	O

eg	O
:	O

what	O

?	O

should	O

a	O
counter	B-Skill

%	O

vice	O

counter	O

2	O

Your	O
suggestion	O
sounds	O
good	O
to	O
me	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
file	O
format	O
is	O
really	O
so	O
predictable	O
,	O
any	O
more	O
sophisticated	O
approaches	O
might	O
just	O

in	O
my	O
opinion	O
.	O

But	O
if	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
see	O
a	O
different	O
approach	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
my	O
idea	O
:	O
Every	O
line	O
that	O
does	O
not	O
start	O
with	O
an	O
%	O
is	O
something	O
we	O
want	O
to	O
parse	O
to	O
an	O
ArrayList	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
whenever	O
you	O
come	O
across	O
a	O
line	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
comment	O
,	O
you	O
start	O
parsing	O
the	O
following	O
lines	O
to	O
an	O
ArrayList	O
until	O
you	O
either	O
hit	O
another	O
comment	O
or	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
file	O
.	O

Both	O
options	O
mark	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
part	O
that	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
store	O
in	O
one	O
single	O
ArrayList	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
something	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

where	O
lineIsComment	O
(	O
String	O
line	O
)	O
returns	O
a	O
boolean	O
that	O
indicates	O
whether	O
the	O
given	O
line	O
is	O
a	O
comment	O
,	O
and	O
addToList	O
(	O
String	O
line	O
,	O
ArrayList	O
<Integer>	O
list	O
)	O
uses	O
your	O
method	O
to	O
parse	O
a	O
line	O
of	O
numbers	O
and	O
stores	O
them	O
in	O
the	O
provided	O
list	O
.	O

status	O

.	O

code	O

.	O

this	O
.	O

if("status".equalsIgnoreCase((nNode.getNodeName())))	O
{	O
nNode.setTextContent("2000000")	O
;	O
}	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
use	O
case	O
where	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
preppend	O
<span>word</span>	O
tags	O
before	O
the	O
tree	B-Skill
leaf	O
nodes	O
.	O

The	O
tree	B-Skill
node	O
is	O
loaded	O
asynchronously	O
and	O
it	O
becomes	O
impossible	O
to	O
check	O
on	O
load	O
event	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
tried	O
node.rendered	O
and	O
node.childrenrendered	O
but	O
not	O
all	O
the	O
elements	O
are	O
loaded	O
at	O
same	O
time	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
keeping	O
an	O
approx	O
timeout	O
such	O
as	O

Even	O
though	O
this	O
solution	O
works	O
for	O
me	O
.	O

But	O
I	O
am	O
not	O
satisfied	O
with	O
it	O
.	O

I	O
want	O
to	O
know	O
if	O
their	O
is	O
an	O
event	O
which	O
is	O
fired	O
when	O
the	O
node	O
is	O
rendered	O
in	O
UI	O
.	O

(	O
like	O
the	O
load	O
event	O
for	O
loading	O
)	O
.	O

PS	O
:	O
I	O
have	O
tried	O
the	O
load	O
event	O
already	O
but	O
I	O
does	O
not	O
work	O
.	O

Pretty	O
much	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
that	O
load	O
happens	O
before	O
the	O
node	O
is	O

.	O

.	O

Thanks	O
!	O

Here	O
's	O
the	O
JavaScript	B-Skill
:	O

Another	O
note	O
,	O
some	O
of	O
your	O
inputs	O
share	O
the	O
same	O
ID	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
're	O
going	O
to	O
use	O
ID	O
and	O
name	O
,	O
I	O
would	O
make	O
them	O
match	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
also	O
give	O
the	O
submit	O
button	O
an	O
ID	O
.	O

You	O
may	O
want	O
to	O
also	O
look	O
into	O
HTML5	B-Skill
form	O
input	O
validation	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
mostly	O
supported	O
by	O
browsers	B-Skill
,	O
but	O
ultimately	O
,	O
you	O
want	O
the	O
javascript	B-Skill
(	O
client-side	B-Skill
)	O
and	O
server	B-Skill
side	O
code	O
to	O
validate	O
your	O
input	O
.	O

With	O
the	O
following	O
script	O
,	O
I	O
split	O
text	O
into	O
sentences	O
,	O
and	O
create	O
images	O
dynamically	O
from	O
each	O
sentence	O
.	O

My	O
for	O
loop	O
is	O
not	O
executing	O
properly	O
.	O

I	O
do	O
not	O
understand	O
,	O
why	O
?	O

The	O
image	O
creation	O
function	O
is	O
being	O
called	O
only	O
once	O
,	O
creating	O
just	O
one	O
image	O
,	O
despite	O
the	O
text	O
contains	O
4	O
distinct	O
sentences	O
.	O

The	O
purpose	O
of	O
the	O
script	O
is	O
creating	O
four	O
images	O
and	O
saving	O
them	O
into	O
the	O
hard	O

.	O

.	O

are	O

the	O

the	O
code	O
runs	O

(	O

ISE	I-Skill

is	O
a	O

Application	O
(	O
NT	B-Skill
GUI	I-Skill
subsystem	I-Skill
)	O

console	B-Skill
.	O

-Oisin	O

I	O
have	O
3	O
cassandra	B-Skill

,	O

2	O

(	O

)	O

How	O
to	O

this	O

I	O
did	O
the	O
following	O
steps	O
,	O

problem	O

is	O
in	O

nodes	B-Skill

'	O

'	O
2	O
'	O
to	O
'	O

'	O

'	O
3	O
'	O

1.You	O
are	O
not	O
using	O
Network	O
topology	O
.	O

2.Your	O
replication	O
factor	O
is	O
2	O
.	O

Simple	O
strategy	O
:	O
Use	O
only	O
for	O
a	O
single	O
datacenter	O
and	O
one	O
rack	O
.	O

SimpleStrategy	O
places	O
the	O
first	O
replica	O
on	O
a	O
node	B-Skill
determined	O
by	O
the	O
partitioner	O
.	O

Additional	O
replicas	O
are	O
placed	O
on	O
the	O
next	O
nodes	B-Skill
clockwise	O
in	O
the	O
ring	O
without	O
considering	O
topology	O
(	O
rack	O
or	O
datacenter	O
location	O
)	O
.	O

Go	O
to	O
this	O
link	O
:	O

https://docs.datastax.com/en/cassandra/3.0/cassandra/architecture/archDataDistributeReplication.html	O

This	O
function	O
retrieves	O
the	O
array	B-Skill
of	O
item	O
representation	O
from	O
disk	O
,	O
converts	O
it	O
to	O
an	O
array	B-Skill
of	O
TodoItem	O
instances	O
using	O
an	O
unnamed	O
closure	O
we	O
pass	O
to	O
map	O
,	O
and	O
sorts	O
that	O
array	B-Skill
chronologically	O
.	O

Sorted	O
does	O
n't	O
work	O
anymore	O
,	O

ca	O

.	O

Just	O
replace	O
sorted	O

like	O
you	O
've	O

Reminder	O
:	O
sorted	O
has	O
become	O
sort	O
and	O
