is	O
now	O
sortInPlace	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
developing	O
a	O
c#	B-Skill
.net	B-Skill
app	O
in	O
which	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
subtract	O
two	O
time	O
periods	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
taken	O
two	O
date	O
objects	O
and	O
subtracted	O
them	O
but	O
it	O
does	O
n't	O
work	O
.	O

Subtracting	O
one	O
DateTime	O
from	O
another	O
returns	O
a	O
Timespan	O
object	O
.	O

which	O
basically	O
tells	O
you	O
how	O
many	O
days/hours/mins/secs/milliseconds/ticks	O
that	O
occured	O
between	O
the	O
2	O
DateTimes	O
.	O

Check	O
the	O
TimeSpan	O
struct	B-Skill
.	O

Also	O
,	O
for	O
DateTime	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
handy	O
procedures	O
such	O
as	O
AddDays	O
:	O

Similarlly	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
AddHours	O
,	O
AddMonths	O
and	O
even	O
AddMilliseconds	O
:	O

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.datetime_members.aspx	O

Imagine	O
a	O
plane	O
with	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
points	O
at	O
known	O
locations	O
.	O

Most	O
are	O
clustered	O
close	O
together	O
,	O
but	O
some	O
are	O
outliers	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
are	O
large	O
areas	O
where	O
there	O
are	O
no	O
points	O
at	O
all	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
multiple	O
clients	O
who	O
can	O
view	O
the	O
plane	O
through	O
rectangular	O
viewports	O
.	O

Each	O
client	O
's	O
viewport	O
may	O
be	O
of	O
different	O
dimensions	O
,	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
moved	O
instantly	O
to	O
any	O
location	O
on	O
the	O
plane	O
.	O

The	O
clients	O
do	O
not	O
know	O
the	O
locations	O
of	O
the	O
points	O
;	O
only	O
the	O
server	O
does	O
.	O

When	O
a	O
client	O
connects	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
communicate	O
the	O
size	O
of	O
its	O
viewport	O
to	O
the	O
server	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
server	O
should	O
respond	O
with	O
a	O
location	O
where	O
one	O
or	O
more	O
points	O
will	O
be	O
visible	O
to	O
that	O
client	O
's	O
viewport	O
.	O

The	O
client	O
visits	O
that	O
location	O
,	O
collects	O
data	O
from	O
visiting	O
those	O
points	O
,	O
sends	O
that	O
data	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
server	O
,	O
then	O
requests	O
the	O
next	O
location	O
to	O
visit	O
.	O

This	O
continues	O
until	O
all	O
points	O
have	O
been	O
visited	O
by	O
at	O
least	O
one	O
client	O
.	O

I	O
need	O
an	O
efficient	O
algorithm	O
that	O
will	O
choose	O
the	O
locations	O
to	O
visit	O
.	O

An	O
ideal	O
solution	O
will	O
minimize	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
locations	O
that	O
clients	O
need	O
to	O
visit	O
by	O
including	O
as	O
many	O
unvisited	O
points	O
as	O
possible	O
within	O
a	O
viewport	O
location	O
,	O
minimizing	O
duplicate	O
visits	O
on	O
points	O
,	O
and	O
not	O
visiting	O
locations	O
with	O
no	O
unvisited	O
points	O
.	O

Can	O
you	O
recommend	O
an	O
algorithm	O
?	O

To	O
do	O
this	O
:	O

I	O
have	O
2	O
FileHandlers	O
that	O
write	O
out	O
to	O
two	O
separate	O
files	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
I/O	O
occurring	O
is	O
slowing	O
down	O
my	O
application	O
quite	O
a	O
bit	O
:	O

I	O
've	O
decided	O
to	O
have	O
the	O
FileHandlers	O
run	O
on	O
separate	O
threads	O
.	O

As	O
they	O
are	O
on	O
separate	O
threads	O
,	O
I	O
needed	O
a	O
concept	O
of	O
a	O
"	O
queue	B-Skill
"	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
these	O
separate	O
threads	O
can	O
poll	O
this	O
queue	O
and	O
print	O
out	O
any	O
incoming	O
messages	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
preformatted	O
messages	O
so	O
that	O
any	O
arguments	O
used	O
do	O
not	O
change	O
before	O
they	O
actually	O
reach	O
the	O
print	O
out	O
in	O
the	O
FileHandler	O
.	O

Now	O
I	O
've	O
realised	O
that	O
I	O
ca	O
n't	O
use	O
the	O
"	O
log	O
"	O
methods	O
provided	O
by	O
the	O
logger	O
,	O
as	O
that	O
attempts	O
to	O
invoke	O
methods	O
on	O
the	O
current	O
thread	O
to	O
format	O
and	O
print	O
out	O
the	O
messages	O
.	O

So	O
I	O
simply	O
call	O
a	O
method	O
that	O
adds	O
my	O
trace	O
message	O
to	O
the	O
queue	O
.	O

I	O
then	O
use	O
run()	O
method	O
of	O
the	O
FileHandlers	O
to	O
print	O
out	O
the	O
messages	O
using	O
publish()	O
.	O

I	O
now	O
realise	O
publish()	O
only	O
takes	O
in	O
a	O
LogRecord	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
just	O
a	O
level	O
+	O
message	O
.	O

My	O
traces	O
have	O
much	O
more	O
,	O
which	O
ca	O
n't	O
simply	O
be	O
placed	O
in	O
an	O
overall	O
message	O
,	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
"	O
Formatter	O
"	O
that	O
I	O
've	O
set	O
to	O
the	O
FileHandler	O
.	O

So	O
I	O
create	O
an	O
instance	O
of	O
the	O
logger	O
in	O
the	O
FileHandler	O
,	O
so	O
I	O
can	O
use	O
the	O
log	O
method	O
and	O
format	O
the	O
string	O
as	O
designed	O
in	O
the	O
Formatter	O
.	O

Which	O
works	O
,	O
kinda	O
.	O

..	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
getting	O
a	O
bit	O
silly	O
,	O
is	O
it	O
worth	O
continuing	O
on	O
like	O
this	O
,	O
working	O
AROUND	O
the	O
java.util.Logger	O
rather	O
than	O
working	O
with	O
it	O
?	O

One	O
of	O
the	O
useful	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
java.util.Logger	O
is	O
having	O
a	O
separate	O
logger	O
instance	O
for	O
each	O
class	O
and	O
being	O
able	O
to	O
have	O
more	O
control	O
over	O
the	O
messages	O
..	O
.	O

Any	O
suggestions	O
?	O

The	O
code	O
is	O
quite	O
long	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
think	O
it	O
's	O
easily	O
understood	O
from	O
the	O
description	O
above	O
,	O
if	O
not	O
let	O
me	O
know	O
and	O
I	O
'll	O
upload	O
somewhere	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
use	O
log4j	B-Skill
2	O
JDK	O
Logging	O
Adapter	O
to	O
enable	O
logging	O
with	O
log4j	B-Skill
,	O
And	O
log4j	B-Skill
2	O
provide	O
remarkable	O
asynchronous	O
Logging	O
mechanism	O
with	O
lot	O
of	O
configuration	O
options	O
.	O

Necessary	O
VM	O
arguments	O

You	O
can	O
find	O
more	O
information	O
about	O
log4j	B-Skill
2	O
async	O
logging	O
here	O
and	O
tomcat	B-Skill
configuration	O
details	O
here	O

sample	O
Log4j2.xml	O
for	O
async	O
loggign	O

You	O
should	O
really	O
consider	O
using	O
SLF4J	B-Skill
.	O

These	O
issues	O
you	O
are	O
describing	O
come	O
along	O
with	O
rolling	O
your	O
own	O
logger	B-Skill
.	O

SLF4J	B-Skill
is	O
really	O
commonly	O
used	O
because	O
it	O
is	O
not	O
very	O
intrusive	O
,	O
should	O
you	O
decide	O
that	O
you	O
need	O
something	O
different	O
you	O
can	O
swap	O
it	O
out	O
for	O
a	O
different	O
framework	O
.	O

http://saltnlight5.blogspot.ca/2013/08/how-to-configure-slf4j-with-different.html	O

http://www.slf4j.org/manual.html	O

If	O
you	O
do	O
decide	O
to	O
stick	O
with	O
your	O
own	O
logger	B-Skill
I	O
would	O
say	O
that	O
you	O
should	O
start	O
by	O
making	O
it	O
a	O
singleton	O
with	O
several	O
logwriters	O
attached	O
to	O
log	O
levels	O
,	O
you	O
then	O
setup	O
a	O
non-blocking	O
queue	B-Skill
for	O
each	O
logger	B-Skill
(	O
there	O
are	O
tons	O
of	O
examples	O
of	O
this	O
out	O
there	O
)	O
and	O
simply	O
call	O
log(logLevel,	O
logOrigin,	O
logMessage)	O
and	O
under	O
the	O
hood	O
send	O
this	O
to	O
each	O
logwriter	O
,	O
which	O
would	O
be	O
a	O
non-blocking	O
queue	B-Skill
that	O
runs	O
on	O
a	O
thread	O
for	O
each	O
logwriter	O
.	O

Each	O
logwriter	O
should	O
be	O
it	O
's	O
own	O
thread	O
,	O
not	O
each	O
log	O
,	O
and	O
you	O
only	O
need	O
one	O
logger	B-Skill
as	O
all	O
it	O
is	O
is	O
a	O
short	O
hand	O
to	O
place	O
things	O
in	O
your	O
logwriter	O
's	O
queues	B-Skill
from	O
anywhere	O
in	O
your	O
app	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
using	O
an	O
AVAssetReaderOutput	O
to	O
read	O
samples	O
from	O
an	O
AVAsset	O
,	O
do	O
some	O
processing	O
on	O
them	O
,	O
and	O
play	O
the	O
result	O
using	O
a	O
RemoteIO	O
AU	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
that	O
after	O
calling	O
AudioOutputUnitStop	O
to	O
pause	O
the	O
playback	O
,	O
then	O
after	O
going	O
to	O
the	O
background	O
and	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
foreground	O
the	O
audio	O
wo	O
n't	O
start	O
again	O
after	O
calling	O
AudioOutputUnitStart	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
due	O
to	O
an	O
error	O
returned	O
from	O
the	O
copyNextSampleBuffer	O
method	O
of	O
AVAssetReaderOutput	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
called	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
rendering	O
pipeline	O
.	O

The	O
status	O
property	O
of	O
AVAssetReader	O
after	O
calling	O
copyNextSampleBuffer	O
is	O
AVAssetReaderStatusFailed	O
,	O
and	O
its	O
error	O
property	O
is	O
Error	O
Domain	O
=	O
AVFoundationErrorDomain	O
Code	O
=	O
-11847	O
"	O
Operation	O
Interrupted	O
"	O
UserInfo	O
=	O
0x1d8b6100	O
{	O
NSLocalizedRecoverySuggestion	O
=	O
Stop	O
other	O
operations	O
and	O
try	O
again	O
.	O
,	O
NSLocalizedDescription	O
=	O
Operation	O
Interrupted}	O

I	O
'm	O
looking	O
for	O
a	O
solution	O
which	O
wo	O
n't	O
force	O
me	O
to	O
reinitialize	O
the	O
entire	O
pipeline	O
after	O
coming	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
foreground	O
Hoping	O
there	O
is	O
such	O
a	O
solution	O
,	O
that	O
AVAssetReaders	O
can	O
survive	O
the	O
app	O
going	O
to	O
background	O
and	O
back.	O
.	O

Notes	O

The	O
app	O
is	O
entitled	O
to	O
play	O
audio	O
in	O
the	O
background	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
handling	O
audio	O
interruptions	O
Setting	O
my	O
AVAudioSession	O
as	O
the	O
active	O
one	O
both	O
on	O
AVAudioSessionDelegates	O
endInterruptionWithFlags	O
:	O
event	O
and	O
whenever	O
the	O
app	O
becomes	O
active	O
.	O

Does	O
n't	O
make	O
a	O
difference	O
whether	O
I	O
do	O
this	O
or	O
not	O
,	O
getting	O
the	O
same	O
error	O
.	O

Some	O
code	O
:	O

AudioPlayer	O

AudioReader	O
Setup	O

AudioReader	O
Render	O
Method	O
,	O
called	O
eventually	O
by	O
the	O
RenderCallback	O
function	O

The	O
graph	O
and	O
AVReader	O
underpinnings	O
are	O
not	O
connected/linked	O
whatsoever	O
.	O

The	O
confusion	O
perhaps	O
comes	O
from	O
that	O
iOS	B-Skill
wo	O
n't	O
"	O
background	O
"	O
(	O
hibernate	O
)	O
a	O
process	O
if	O
it	O
sees	O
the	O
audio	O
graph	O
running	O
(	O
because	O
then	O
audio	O
data	O
would	O
be	O
unable	O
to	O
be	O
generated	O
)	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
why	O
when	O
you	O
stop	O
the	O
audio	O
graph	O
,	O
2-3	O
minutes	O
later	O
,	O
iOS	B-Skill
will	O
background	O
your	O
process	O
(	O
as	O
of	O
iOS	B-Skill
9	O
)	O
.	O

Presumably	O
,	O
iOS	B-Skill
looks	O
at	O
what	O
's	O
going	O
on	O
in	O
your	O
process	O
and	O
decides	O
when	O
your	O
process	O
should	O
be	O
forced	O
to	O
background	O
(	O
via	O
beginBackgroundTaskWithName:expirationHandler	O
)	O
.	O

Apple	O
devs	O
decided	O
for	O
whatever	O
reason	O
to	O
make	O
AVReader	O
stop	O
when	O
put	O
into	O
background	O
mode	O
(	O
my	O
best	O
guess	O
is	O
QA	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
good	O
news	O
is	O
that	O
you	O
can	O
detect	O
it	O
and	O
recover	O
when	O
your	O
process	O
exits	O
background	O
mode	O
,	O
but	O
you	O
WILL	O
need	O
to	O
restart	O
your	O
reader	O
and	O
readerOutput	O
again	O
.	O

First	O
,	O
when	O
AVAssetReaderOutput	O
's	O
copyNextSampleBuffer	O
returns	O
NULL	O
,	O
check	O
AVAssetReader.error.code	O
for	O
AVErrorOperationInterrupted	O
.	O

The	O
way	O
we	O
pull	O
off	O
a	O
gapless	O
recovery	O
here	O
is	O
when	O
we	O
get	O
to	O
that	O
point	O
,	O
we	O
first	O
calculate	O
the	O
exact	O
time	O
we	O
left	O
off	O
at	O
(	O
easy	O
to	O
do	O
just	O
maintain	O
a	O
counter	O
of	O
the	O
total	O
samples	O
already	O
output	O
)	O
.	O

Then	O
,	O
you	O
WILL	O
need	O
to	O
restart	O
your	O
AVAssetReader	O
and	O
AVAssetReaderOutput	O
flow	O
.	O

But	O
that	O
's	O
no	O
problem	O
since	O
your	O
good	O
development	O
practices	O
would	O
have	O
encapsulated	O
that	O
in	O
a	O
single	O
function	O
that	O
has	O
a	O
seek	O
time	O
as	O
an	O
argument	O
.	O

In	O
that	O
function	O
,	O
use	O
AVAssetReader.timeRange	O
to	O
seek	O
to	O
that	O
time	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
resume	O
at	O
and	O
presto	O
!	O

There	O
first	O
thing	O
I	O
would	O
try	O
is	O
:	O

Not	O
calling	O
AudioOutputUnitStop	O
?	O

Why	O
do	O
n't	O
you	O
leave	O
the	O
graph	O
running	O
and	O
when	O
the	O
audio	O
is	O
paused	O
simply	O
not	O
call	O

Instead	O
just	O
fill	O
the	O
buffer	B-Skill
with	O
0	O
's	O
and/or	O
use	O
a	O
render	O
action	O
of	O
kAudioUnitRenderAction_OutputIsSilence	O
for	O
the	O
buffers	B-Skill
.	O

Starting	O
and	O
stopping	O
the	O
graph	O
takes	O
time	O
and	O
leads	O
to	O
an	O
unresponsive	O
graph	O
.	O

I	O
never	O
stop	O
the	O
graph	O
while	O
my	O
apps	O
are	O
running	O
.	O

(	O
Unless	O
some	O
serious	O
interruption	O
happens	O
)	O
This	O
may	O
keep	O
the	O
asset	O
reader	O
around	O
and	O
happy	O
.	O

But	O
I	O
have	O
a	O
hunch	O
that	O
as	O
the	O
AVAssetReader	O
is	O
not	O
directly	O
connected	O
to	O
the	O
audio	O
graph	O
(	O
you	O
just	O
happen	O
to	O
request	O
samples	O
and	O
place	O
them	O
in	O
the	O
buffer	B-Skill
supplied	O
by	O
the	O
render	O
callback	O
)	O
the	O
problem	O
does	O
not	O
lie	O
with	O
the	O
audio	O
graph	O
being	O
stopped	O
and	O
restarted	O
at	O
all	O
.	O

So	O
the	O
next	O
line	O
of	O
attack	O
I	O
would	O
try	O
is	O
to	O
request	O
samples	O
from	O
an	O
AVAsset	O
,	O
put	O
the	O
app	O
into	O
the	O
background	O
and	O
bring	O
it	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
foreground	O
without	O
using	O
an	O
AUGraph	O
at	O
all	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
determine	O
if	O
the	O
problem	O
is	O
related	O
to	O
the	O
AUGraph	O
or	O
the	O
app	O
entering	O
a	O
background	O
state	O
.	O

If	O
something	O
happens	O
that	O
forces	O
you	O
to	O
tear	O
down	O
your	O
AVAssetReader	O
you	O
will	O
have	O
to	O
reconnect	O
to	O
the	O
asset	O
.	O

So	O
as	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
write	O
that	O
code	O
another	O
the	O
option	O
I	O
would	O
look	O
at	O
is	O
the	O
one	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
want	O
to	O
do	O
.	O

Reconnect	O
to	O
the	O
AVAssetReader	O
,	O
seek	O
to	O
the	O
position	O
you	O
left	O
off	O
at	O
and	O
keep	O
going	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
struggling	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
login	O
code	O
to	O
run	O
successfully	O
.	O

It	O
keeps	O
on	O

"	O

in	O

.	O

.	O

I	O
am	O

to	O
Java	B-Skill
and	O
I	O

.	O

,	O
but	O

the	O
soultions	O
worked	O
.	O

My	O
code	O
:	O

RacerMain.java	O

Dot.java	O

Why	O
it	O
does	O
not	O
work	O
and	O
how	O
to	O
get	O
this	O
code	O
working	O
?	O

Or	O
you	O
can	O
set	O
preferred	O
size	O
in	O
constructor	O
:	O

JPanel	O
uses	O
FlowLayout	O
which	O
respects	O
preferred	O
sizes	O
but	O
the	O
default	O
size	O
of	O
the	O
Dot	O
component	O
is	O
too	O
small	O
to	O
be	O
seen	O
.	O

You	O
need	O
to	O
use	O
a	O

I	O
am	O

and	O

:	O

The	O

the	O

:	O

The	O
Graph.txt	O
contains	O
the	O
following	O

viz	O
is	O
a	O
Stack	O
,	O
not	O
an	O
array	B-Skill
.	O

You	O
ca	O
n't	O
use	O
the	O
array	B-Skill
notation	O
viz[node]	O
on	O
it	O
.	O

this	O
is	O
also	O
an	O
error	O
,	O
since	O
your	O
Stack	O
is	O
not	O
generic	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
must	O
cast	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
pop()	O
to	O
Integer	O
:	O

An	O
alternative	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
change	O
the	O
type	O
of	O
stack	O
:	O

You	O
ca	O
n't	O
use	O
array	B-Skill
syntax	O
(array	O
[	O
index	O
]	O
)	O
for	O
stacks	O
,	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
push()	O
,	O
pop()	O
,	O
and	O
peek()	O

Stacks	O
work	O
on	O
a	O
first-in	O
,	O
last-out	O
basis	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
the	O
only	O
element	O
in	O
the	O
stack	O
that	O
is	O
accessible	O
is	O
the	O
top	O
one	O
.	O

When	O
you	O
use	O
pop()	O
,	O
you	O
remove	O
the	O
top	O
item	O
so	O
that	O
the	O
next	O
can	O
be	O
accessed	O
.	O

push()	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
put	O
a	O
value	O
on	O
the	O
top	O
and	O
peek()	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
check	O
the	O
top	O
item	O
without	O
popping	O
it	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
have	O
the	O
following	O
stack	O

Using	O
pop()	O
,	O
will	O
return	O
"	O
Sam	O
"	O
and	O
remove	O
it	O
from	O
the	O
stack	B-Skill
,	O
so	O
it	O
will	O
look	O
like	O
this	O
.	O

Pushing	O
"	O
Charlie	O
"	O
will	O
make	O
the	O
stack	O
look	O
this	O
this	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
have	O
to	O
pop	O
twice	O
in	O

to	O
access	O
"	O
Adam	O
"	O

to	O

a	O

.	O

code	O
:	O

:	O

I	O
guess	O

's	O
an	O
error	O
while	O
using	O

but	O

to	O

a	O

.	O

a	O

.	O

I	O
cannot	O
find	O
the	O
problem	O
.	O

Please	O
somebody	O
help	O
me	O
.	O

I	O
need	O
to	O
handle	O
tens	O
of	O
Gigabytes	O
data	O
in	O
one	O
binary	O
file	O
.	O

Each	O
record	O
in	O
the	O
data	O
file	O
is	O
variable	O
length	O
.	O

So	O
the	O
file	O
is	O
like	O
:	O

The	O
data	O
contains	O
integer	O
,	O
pointer	O
,	O
double	O
value	O
and	O
so	O
on	O
.	O

I	O
found	O
python	B-Skill
can	O
not	O
even	O
handle	O
this	O
situation	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
problem	O
if	O
I	O
read	O
the	O
whole	O
file	O
in	O
memory	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
fast	O
.	O

But	O
it	O
seems	O
the	O
struct	B-Skill
package	O
is	O
not	O
good	O
at	O
performance	O
.	O

It	O
almost	O
stuck	O
on	O
unpack	O
the	O
bytes	O
.	O

Any	O
help	O
is	O
appreciated	O
.	O

Thanks	O
.	O

struct	B-Skill
and	O
array	B-Skill
,	O
which	O
other	O
answers	O
recommend	O
,	O
are	O
fine	O
for	O
the	O
details	O
of	O
the	O
implementation	O
,	O
and	O
might	O
be	O
all	O
you	O
need	O
if	O
your	O
needs	O
are	O
always	O
to	O
sequentially	O
read	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
file	O
or	O
a	O
prefix	O
of	O
it	O
.	O

Other	O
options	O
include	O
buffer	B-Skill
,	O
mmap	B-Skill
,	O
even	O
ctypes	B-Skill
,	O
depending	O
on	O
many	O
details	O
you	O
do	O

your	O
exact	O
needs	O
.	O

Maybe	O
a	O
little	O
specialized	O

helper	O
can	O
offer	O
all	O
the	O
extra	O
performance	O
you	O

,	O
if	O
no	O
suitable	O
and	O
accessible	O
library	O
(	O
in	O
C	B-Skill
,	O
C++	B-Skill
,	O
Fortran	B-Skill
,	O
..	O
.	O
)	O
already	O
exists	O
that	O
can	O
be	O
interfaced	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
handling	O
this	O
humongous	O
file	O
as	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
.	O

But	O
clearly	O
there	O
are	O
peculiar	O
issues	O
here	O
how	O
can	O
a	O
data	O
file	O
contain	O
pointers	O
,	O
for	O

,	O
which	O
are	O

to	O

?	O

maybe	O
"	O
offsets	O
"	O
instead	O
,	O
and	O
,	O

so	O
,	O
how	O
exactly	O
are	O
they	O
based	O
and	O
coded	O
?	O

Are	O
your	O
needs	O
at	O
all	O
more	O
advanced	O
than	O
simply	O
sequential	O
reading	O
(	O
e.g	O
.	O
,	O
random	O
access	O
)	O
,	O

.	O

"	O

..	O
.	O

I	O
tried	O
to	O
use	O
the	O
Slider	B-Skill
in	O
my	O
project	O
.	O

When	O
I	O
tried	O
to	O

.	O

but	O

do	O
n't	O
show	O
up	O
,	O
so	O
I	O
ca	O
n't	O
see	O
the	O
value	O
.	O

Any	O
help	O
will	O
be	O
very	O
much	O
appreciated	O
.	O

I	O
found	O
out	O
that	O
using	O
the	O
attribute	O
does	O
the	O
trick	O
and	O
it	O
actually	O
works	O
on	O
touch	O
devices	O
like	O
my	O
IPhone	O
6s	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
remarable	O
because	O
tooltips	O
do	O
n't	O
work	O
on	O
buttons	O
using	O
gwtbootstrap3	B-Skill
.	O

Actually	O
they	O
work	O
but	O
they	O
take	O
the	O
first	O
tip	O
to	O
show	O
up	O
.	O

So	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
tip	O
twice	O
on	O
a	O
button	O
which	O
is	O
not	O
good	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
create	O
thread	O
library.For	O
this	O
I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
implement	O
queue	B-Skill
to	O
store	O
the	O
pending	O
threads	O
to	O
be	O
executed	O
.	O

The	O
reason	O
I	O
mentioned	O
the	O
queue	B-Skill
because	O
i	O
tried	O
experimenting	O
by	O
removing	O
below	O
code	O
from	O
'	O
MyThreadYield	O
'	O
function	O
and	O
it	O
workes	O
fine	O
but	O
doesnt	O
do	O
the	O
intended	O
functionality	O
.	O

getcontext(&(save.context))	O
;	O

addToQueue(save)	O
;	O

For	O
one	O
,	O
your	O
queue	B-Skill
implementation	O
is	O
not	O
thread-safe	O
at	O
this	O
point	O
.	O

Your	O
question	O
strongly	O
suggests	O
that	O
this	O
code	O
will	O
be	O
used	O
in	O
a	O
multi-threaded	O
environment	O
.	O

Having	O
a	O
non	O
thread-safe	O
queue	B-Skill
will	O
give	O
you	O
wrong	O
results	O
,	O
and	O
weird	O
things	O
can	O
happen	O
(	O
like	O
removeFromQueue()	O
returning	O
the	O
same	O
thing	O
to	O
two	O
different	O
threads	O
,	O
or	O
addToQueue()	O
inserting	O
two	O
items	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
position	O
)	O
.	O

Aside	O
from	O
that	O
,	O
your	O
queue	B-Skill
implementation	O
would	O
never	O
work	O
.	O

You	O
are	O
not	O
using	O
front	O
and	O
rear	O
correctly	O
.	O

Look	O
carefully	O
at	O
the	O
insert	O
function	O
:	O

You	O
check	O
if	O
rear	O
is	O
MAX	O
,	O
yet	O
,	O
you	O
write	O
into	O
queue[front]	O
and	O
increment	O
front	O
.	O

What	O
if	O
I	O
just	O
keep	O
adding	O
items	O
to	O
the	O
queue	O
,	O
eventually	O
reaching	O
the	O
buffer	O
's	O
limit	O
?	O

rear	O
will	O
always	O
be	O
0	O
,	O
front	O
will	O
grow	O
indefinitely	O
,	O
and	O
your	O
function	O
will	O
write	O
beyond	O
the	O
limits	O
of	O
queue	B-Skill
.	O

That	O
's	O
probably	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
your	O
segmentation	O
fault	O
errors	O
.	O

I	O
think	O
you	O
wanted	O
to	O
check	O
for	O
front	O
instead	O
:	O

The	O
code	O
for	O
removeFromQueue()	O
looks	O
superficially	O
ok	O
,	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
queue	B-Skill
is	O
a	O
global	O
array	B-Skill
(	O
since	O
you	O
're	O
returning	O
a	O
pointer	O
,	O
and	O
ca	O
n't	O
return	O
pointers	O
to	O
local	O
variables	O
)	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
single	O
,	O
most	O
important	O
fact	O
you	O
have	O
to	O
take	O
out	O
of	O
this	O
answer	O
,	O
is	O
that	O
your	O
queue	B-Skill
implementation	O
will	O
not	O
scale	O
in	O
the	O
long-term	O
.	O

An	O
array-based	O
queue	B-Skill
is	O
a	O
terrible	O
choice	O
.	O

What	O
do	O
you	O
do	O
when	O
you	O
run	O
out	O
of	O
space	O
in	O
the	O
array	B-Skill
?	O

What	O
if	O
I	O
insert	O
MAX	O
elements	O
,	O
then	O
remove	O
2	O
or	O
3	O
,	O
and	O
try	O
to	O
insert	O
more	O
?	O

Your	O
code	O
will	O
say	O
the	O
queue	B-Skill
is	O
full	O
,	O
because	O
it	O
only	O
ever	O
allows	O
you	O
to	O
insert	O
MAX	O
elements	O
in	O
total	O
.	O

You	O
could	O
shift	O
every	O
element	O
in	O
the	O
queue	B-Skill
to	O
the	O
left	O
when	O
an	O
element	O
is	O
removed	O
,	O
but	O
that	O
's	O
crazy	O
,	O
and	O
extremely	O
inefficient	O
.	O

Or	O
you	O
could	O
increment	O
front	O
modulo	O
MAX	O
,	O
allowing	O
rear	O
to	O
be	O
ahead	O
of	O
front	O
,	O
as	O
long	O
as	O
you	O
know	O
that	O
no	O
more	O
than	O
MAX	O
elements	O
can	O
be	O
inserted	O
.	O

That	O
would	O
be	O
better	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
would	O
break	O
the	O
logic	O
in	O
removeFromQueue()	O
,	O
since	O
the	O
pointers	O
returned	O
earlier	O
will	O
possibly	O
point	O
to	O
a	O
different	O
thread	O
struct	B-Skill
as	O
you	O
manipulate	O
the	O
queue	B-Skill
total	O
disaster	O
.	O

Definitely	O
not	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
.	O

A	O
much	O
,	O
much	O
better	O
approach	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
implement	O
this	O
with	O
a	O
linked	B-Skill
list	I-Skill
where	O
you	O
keep	O
a	O
pointer	O
to	O
the	O
head	O
and	O
a	O
pointer	O
to	O
the	O
tail	O
.	O

Have	O
a	O
look	O
at	O
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queue_(abstract_data_type)#Queue_implementation	O

I	O
tried	O
this	O
code	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
not	O
working	O
.	O

Try	O
:	O

I	O
destroyed	O
my	O
subversion	B-Skill
tree	B-Skill
,	O
and	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
know	O
what	O
could	O
have	O
caused	O
it	O
.	O

I	O
used	O
svn	O

on	O
some	O
files	O
a	O

ago	O
,	O
but	O

is	O

.	O

This	O

I	O

,	O

.	O

:	O

found	O
that	O

.	O

Is	O
there	O
a	O

way	O
?	O

You	O
could	O
use	O
a	O
dependency	O
analyzer	O
like	O
:	O

JarAnalyzer	B-Skill

This	O
will	O
parse	O
a	O
directory	O
full	O
of	O
Jars	O
and	O
give	O
you	O
an	O
XML	B-Skill
output	O
dependency	O
map	O
,	O
for	O
which	O
there	O
are	O
several	O
tools	O
for	O
displaying	O
in	O
either	O
graphical	O
or	O
text	O
form	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
refer	O
to	O
this	O
SO	O
question	O
Finding	O
unused	O
jars	O
used	O
in	O
an	O
eclipse	B-Skill
project	O
,	O
you	O
also	O
have	O
:	O

ClassPathHelper	B-Skill
,	O
which	O
can	O
quickly	O
focus	O
on	O
unresolved	O
classes	O
:	O

It	O
automatically	O
identifies	O
orphan	O
jars	O
,	O
blocked	O
(	O
obscured	O
)	O
classes	O
,	O
and	O
much	O
more	O
.	O

The	O
only	O
limit	O
is	O
dependencies	O
that	O
are	O
not	O
defined	O
in	O
classes	O
,	O
e.g	O
.	O
in	O
dependency	O
injection	O
framework	O
configuration	O
files	O
.	O

I	O
got	O
a	O
problem	O
when	O
positioning	O
three	O
divs	O
side	O
by	O
side	O
.	O

Those	O
three	O
divs	O
contain	O
normal	O
text	O
but	O
also	O
have	O
a	O
link	O
at	O
the	O
bottom	O
.	O

To	O
get	O
this	O
responsive	O
,	O
the	O
items	O
are	O
inline-block	O
with	O
a	O
width	O
of	O
32%	O
.	O

Now	O
the	O
problem	O
is	O
,	O
that	O
when	O
I	O
change	O
the	O
window	O
size	O
,	O
the	O
height	O
of	O
the	O
items	O
are	O

Creating	O
a	O

view	O
in	O
iOS	B-Skill

It	O
's	O
very	O
straightforward	O
,	O
assuming	O

your	O

around	O
table	O
controllers	O

http://www.icodeblog.com/2008/08/08/iphone-programming-tutorial-populating-uitableview-with-an-nsarray/	O

http://cocoawithlove.com/2009/04/easy-custom-uitableview-drawing.html	O

those	O
helps	O

edit	O
:	O
I	O
pasted	O
the	O
wrong	O
link	O
in	O
my	O
initial	O
post	O
(	O
one	O
for	O
mono	B-Skill
touch	I-Skill
meant	O
to	O
include	O
on	O
for	O
UITableView	O
over	O
array	B-Skill
)	O

I	O
have	O
seen	O
too	O
much	O
C#	B-Skill
and	O
C++	B-Skill
code	O
where	O
the	O
variable	O
naming	O
convention	O
seems	O
to	O
ask	O
programmers	O
to	O
write	O
variable	O
names	O
using	O
underscore	O
before	O
the	O
text	O
of	O
the	O
variable	O
.	O

e.gr	O
.	O

What	O
's	O
the	O
rationale	O
supporting	O
that	O
convention	O
?	O

The	O
Microsoft	O
Guidelines	O
for	O
member	O
naming	O
specifies	O
that	O
you	O
do	O
not	O
use	O
prefixes	O
for	O
fields	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
read	O
Microsoft	O
's	O
guidelines	O
for	O
names	O
here	O
.	O

This	O
just	O
applies	O
to	O
C#	B-Skill
,	O
of	O
course	O
.	O

In	O
C#	B-Skill
I	O
usually	O
prefix	O
with	O
_	O
private	O
fields	O
but	O
never	O
local	O
variables	O
.	O

The	O
rationale	O
behind	O
this	O
is	O
that	O
when	O
I	O
need	O
a	O
private	O
variable	O
I	O
type	O
_	O
and	O
the	O
Intellisense	B-Skill
filters	O
the	O
list	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
easier	O
to	O
find	O
.	O

This	O
way	O
I	O
am	O
also	O
able	O
to	O
distinguish	O
between	O
private	O
from	O
local	O
variables	O
and	O
I	O
no	O
longer	O
need	O
to	O
type	O
this.variablename	O
for	O
class	O
fields	O
but	O
simply	O
_variablename	O
.	O

I	O
want	O
to	O
show	O
a	O
note/label	O
on	O
my	O
tableview	O
background	O
when/if	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
data	O
to	O
load	O
,	O
or	O
data	O
is	O
being	O
fetched	O
etc	O
.	O

I	O
ca	O
n't	O
see	O
what	O
am	O
I	O
doing	O
wrong	O
here	O
.	O

Xcode	B-Skill
is	O
showing	O
a	O
warning	O
"	O
Will	O
never	O
be	O
executed	O
"	O
on	O
this	O
line	O
of	O
code	O
:	O

I	O
am	O
currently	O
developing	O
an	O
application	O
in	O
C#	B-Skill
where	O
I	O
display	O
a	O
MessageBox	O
.	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
automatically	O
close	O
the	O
message	O
box	O
after	O
a	O
couple	O
of	O
seconds	O
?	O

You	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
create	O
your	O
own	O
Window	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
code-behind	O
containing	O
a	O
loaded	O
handler	O
and	O
a	O
timer	O
handler	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O

You	O
can	O
then	O
make	O
your	O
custom	O
message	O
box	O
appear	O
by	O
calling	O
ShowDialog()	O
:	O

The	O
System.Windows.MessageBox.Show()	O
method	O
has	O
an	O
overload	O
which	O
takes	O
an	O
owner	O
Window	O
as	O
the	O
first	O
parameter	O
.	O

If	O
we	O
create	O
an	O
invisible	O
owner	O
Window	O
which	O
we	O
then	O
close	O
after	O
a	O
specified	O
time	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
child	O
message	O
box	O
would	O
close	O
as	O
well	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
the	O
complete	O
answer	O
:	O
https://stackoverflow.com/a/20098381/2190520	O

I	O
've	O
been	O
using	O
AsyncTask	O
for	O
some	O
time	O
already	O
and	O
it	O
never	O
stopped	O
working	O
after	O
some	O
time	O
like	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
.	O

After	O
I	O
open	O
my	O
app	O
for	O
the	O
first	O
time	O
everything	O
works	O
fine	O
and	O
I	O
can	O
execute	O
AsyncTask	O
many	O
times	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
after	O
I	O
close	O
my	O
app	O
and	O
put	O
device	O
to	O
stand	O
still	O
for	O
a	O

of	O
minutes	O
,	O
AsyncTask	O
becomes	O
impossible	O
to	O
execute	O
.	O

Usually	O
it	O
takes	O
for	O
1-2	O
seconds	O
to	O
load	O
data	O
,	O
but	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
it	O
takes	O
for	O
a	O

of	O
minutes	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
my	O
AsyncTask	O
:	O

more	O
thing	O
I	O
've	O
noticed	O
is	O
that	O

.	O

.	O

p.s	O
in	O
php	B-Skill
info	O

is	O
off	O
.	O

i	O
tried	O

on	O
my	O
subfolder	O
without	O
no	O
luck	O
either	O
.	O

Make	O
sure	O
of	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

is	O
right	O
after	O
<	O
?	O
php	O
tag	O

There	O
is	O
indeed	O
a	O
PHP	B-Skill
error	O
try	O
to	O
deliberately	O
make	O
one	O
.	O

Maybe	O
the	O
error	O
is	O
elsewhere	O
,	O
not	O
your	O
PHP	B-Skill
but	O
the	O
.htaccess	O
file	O
(	O
since	O
you	O
're	O
getting	O
500	O
)	O
,	O
or	O
maybe	O
it	O
's	O
a	O
logical	O
error	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
trying	O
to	O
find	O
the	O
upcoming	O
birthdays	O
in	O
a	O
week	O
on	O
iOS	B-Skill
.	O

I	O
pulled	O
the	O
birthday	O
data	O
from	O
Facebook	O
and	O
trimmed	O
the	O
year	O
part	O
(	O
since	O
it	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
available	O
for	O
some	O
users	O

on	O
user	O
's	O
privacy	O
settings	O
)	O
hence	O
the	O
birthday	O
data	O
is	O
an	O
NSString	O
with	O
date	O
format	O
@	O
"	O
MM/dd	O
"	O

where	O
dateFormatterWithFormat	O
:	O
is	O
a	O
category	O
on	O
NSDateFormatter	O
:	O

2	O
questions	O
here	O
:	O

1	O
I	O
have	O
a	O
bug	O
in	O
this	O
code	O
,	O
if	O
there	O
is	O
less	O
than	O
a	O
week	O

,	O

wo	O

to	O

birthdays	O
in	O
the	O
new	O
year	O
since	O
I	O
'm	O
setting	O
the	O
year	O
of	O
the	O
birthday	O
to	O
the	O
current	O
year	O
and	O
difference.day	O
will	O
be	O
way	O
less	O
than	O
0	O
for	O
the	O
birthdays	O
in	O
the	O
new	O
year	O
.	O

How	O
do	O
I	O
go	O
about	O
fixing	O
that	O
?	O

2	O
As	O
you	O
can	O
see	O
from	O
the	O
above	O
snippet	O
I	O
'm	O
doing	O
a	O

:	O

get	O

's	O
date	O
and	O

[	O

date	O
]	O
,	O
then	O
I	O
rip	O
it	O

specify	O

as	O

"	O
sheet3	O
"	O

"	O

.	O

I	O
had	O
to	O
step	O
through	O
161	O
PackagePart	O
objects	O
to	O
see	O
this	O
.	O

LINQ	B-Skill
is	O
just	O
so	O
damn	O
efficient	O
that	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
hard	O
to	O
debug	O
when	O
there	O
are	O
problems	O
.	O

The	O
.Single()	O
is	O
what	O
's	O
throwing	O
the	O
exception	O
.	O

Either	O
your	O
query	O
is	O
returning	O
no	O
items	O
or	O
it	O
's	O
returning	O
>	O
1	O
item	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
're	O
not	O
sure	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
items	O
you	O
're	O
expecting	O
,	O
you	O
should	O
be	O
using	O
FirstOrDefault()	O
which	O
will	O
return	O
the	O
first	O
match	O
or	O
null	O
if	O
no	O
matches	O
are	O
found	O
.	O

The	O
non-LINQ	B-Skill
equivalent	O
is	O
something	O
like	O
this	O

It	O
's	O
basically	O
doing	O
this	O
.	O

In	O
your	O
version	O
,	O
try	O
replacing	O
.Single()	O
with	O
.FirstOrDefault()	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
failing	O
because	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
match	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
running	O
two	O
http/2	O
servers	B-Skill
on	O
my	O
ubuntu	B-Skill
server	B-Skill
.	O

Both	O
should	O
be	O

over	O
port	O
443	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
a	O
simple	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
on	O
Ubuntu	B-Skill
?	O

Yes	O
this	O
is	O
possible	O
.	O

You	O
need	O
to	O
run	O
a	O
webserver	B-Skill
or	O
loadbalancer	B-Skill
listening	O
to	O
port	O
443	O
and	O
forwarding	O
requests	O
appropriately	O
.	O

In	O
Apache	B-Skill
for	O
example	O
this	O
would	O
be	O
handled	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O

Now	O
while	O
Apache	B-Skill
does	O
support	O
HTTP/2	O
in	O
both	O
the	O
front	O
end	O
client	O
connections	O
and	O
the	O
back	O
end	O
ProxyPass	O
requests	O
(	O
with	O
mod_proxy_http	O
2)	O
,	O
some	O
other	O
webservers/loadbalancers	B-Skill
do	O
n't	O
(	O
e.g	O
.	O
Nginx	B-Skill
)	O
.	O

To	O
be	O
honest	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
benefits	O
for	O
HTTP/2	O
are	O
in	O
the	O
client	O
to	O
edge	O
.	O

So	O
if	O
you	O
prefer	O
to	O
use	O
Nginx	B-Skill
for	O
example	O
,	O
you	O
could	O
just	O
have	O
Nginx	B-Skill
support	O
HTTP/2	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
connection	O
from	O
Nginx	B-Skill
to	O
your	O
back	O
end	O
apps	O
be	O
plain	O
old	O
HTTP/1.1	O
.	O

At	O
least	O
until	O
HTTP/2	O
becomes	O
more	O
regularly	O
supported	O
.	O

See	O
here	O
for	O
more	O
discussion	O
on	O
this	O
:	O

with	O
node.js	B-Skill
behind	O
nginx	B-Skill
proxy	O

I	O
am	O
attempting	O
to	O
accept	O
a	O
user	O
name	O
through	O

script	O
:	O

.	O

after	O
the	O
first	O

.	O

AppleScript	B-Skill
Overview	O

|	O
Scripting	O
with	O
AppleScript	B-Skill

One	O
way	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
use	O
properties	O
.	O

The	O
property-value	O
is	O
stored	O
within	O
the	O
compiled	O
script	O
.	O

It	O
also	O
works	O
when	O
the	O
script	O
is	O
saved	O
as	O
an	O
application	O
.	O

Opening	O
and	O
recompiling	O
it	O
in	O
AppleScript	B-Skill
Editor	I-Skill
resets	O
the	O
values	O
.	O

I	O

.	O

1)	O
Attribute	O

I	O

class	O
with	O
a	O

and	O

type	O

have	O

in	O

.	O

I	O
find	O
that	O

of	O
reflection	O
.	O

Is	O

2	O
?	O

This	O
is	O

.	O

:	O

Option	O
1	O
:	O

are	O

,	O

1	O
,	O
attributes	O

.	O

to	O

)	O

I	O
'm	O
using	O
Mule	B-Skill
standalone	I-Skill
3.1.0	O
and	O
I	O
have	O
a	O

a	O

.	O

My	O
fooImpl	O
class	O
throws	O
an	O
exception	O
on	O
purpose	O

gets	O

onto	O

stdout	O
ExceptionTransformer	O
is	O

and	O

no	O

.	O

If	O
I	O
remove	O
the	O
default-exception-strategy	O
completely	O
nothing	O
at	O
all	O
changes	O
.	O

I	O
want	O
it	O
to	O
send	O
an	O
email	O
and	O
print	O
the	O
exception	O
with	O
ExceptionTransformer	O
.	O

What	O
am	O
I	O
doing	O
wrong	O
?	O

Further	O
on	O
,	O
I	O
tried	O
to	O
use	O
<custom-exception-strategy	O
class="com.arcusys.nkeservice.mule.dynasty.ExceptionTest">	O
instead	O
of	O
default-exception-strategy	O
.	O

Then	O
ExceptionTest	O
gets	O
instantiated	O
during	O
service	O
startup	O
,	O
but	O
@override	O
handleException	O
never	O
gets	O
called	O
.	O

My	O
forced	O
exception	O
I	O
get	O
to	O
stdout	O
is	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

There	O
was	O
problems	O
with	O
CXF	B-Skill
components	O
invoking	O
exception	O
strategies	O
prior	O
to	O
Mule	B-Skill
3.1.3	O
:	O

(	O

2)	O

.	O

way	O

as	O

.	O

Is	O
there	O
are	O
short	O
command	O
for	O
these	O
?	O

If	O
<branch>	O
is	O
specified	O
,	O
git	O
rebase	O
will	O
perform	O
an	O
automatic	O
git	O
checkout	O
before	O
doing	O
anything	O
else	O
.	O

Otherwise	O
it	O
remains	O
on	O
the	O
current	O
branch	O
.	O

My	O

:	O

option	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
fix	O
this	O
,	O
what	O
are	O
my	O
basic	O
thinking	O
mistakes	O
?	O

Best	O
Regards	O
sKylo	O

Your	O
code	O
is	O
all	O
good	O
.	O

Just	O
one	O
mistake	O
,	O
you	O
are	O
using	O
%d	O
to	O
concatenate	O
the	O
decimals	O
after	O
your	O
id	O
.	O

But	O
that	O
is	O
not	O
necessary	O
since	O
%d	O
is	O
automatically	O
added	O
to	O
the	O
supplied	O
id	O
.	O

Please	O
find	O
codex	O
link	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
this	O
answer	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
I	O
removed	O
the	O
%d	O
from	O
the	O
id	O
section	O
of	O
your	O
code	O
and	O
now	O
it	O
works	O
.	O

Solution	O
:	O

and	O

You	O
do	O
not	O
need	O
to	O
add	O
%d	O
to	O
id	O
of	O
register_sidebars	O
.	O

Please	O
read	O
the	O
codex	O
,	O

it	O
says	O
:	O

"	O
%d	O
"	O
is	O
added	O
automatically	O
to	O
supplied	O
'	O
id	O
'	O
value	O
after	O
the	O
first	O
;	O
e.g	O
.	O
,	O
"	O
Sidebar-1	O
"	O
,	O
"	O
Sidebar-2	O
"	O
,	O
"	O
Sidebar-3	O
"	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

the	O
question	O
i	O
am	O
asking	O
is	O
what	O
is	O
the	O
highest	O
numeric	O
value	O
X	O
will	O
hold	O
and	O
what	O
is	O
the	O
lowest	O
in	O
this	O
code	O
:	O

Random	O
rand	O
=	O
new	O
Random()	O
;	O

int	O
x	O
=	O
1	O
rand.Next()%15	O
;	O

I	O
have	O
entered	O
this	O
and	O
receive	O
a	O
value	O
of	O
-12	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
but	O
cannot	O
get	O
a	O
range	O
.	O

rand.Next()	O
%	O
15	O
will	O
give	O
you	O
a	O
number	O
between	O
0	O
and	O
14	O
.	O

(	O
If	O
we	O
assume	O
that	O
it	O
generates	O
only	O
positive	O
integers	O
,	O
otherwise	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
do	O
it	O
with	O
a	O
negative	O
number	O
too	O
take	O
a	O
look	O
here	O
how	O
:	O

https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/519845/modulo-of-a-negative-number	O

Then	O
add	O
the	O
1	O
{	O
a	O
number	O
from	O
the	O
set	O
of	O
0	O
and	O
14}	O
and	O
you	O
get	O
your	O
answer	O
.	O

However	O
pay	O
attention	O
that	O
"rand.Next()	O
%	O
15	O
"	O
is	O
equal	O
to	O
"rand.Next(15)"	O
and	O
also	O
you	O
can	O
use	O
this	O
code	O
:	O

rand.Next(minValue,maxValue)	O
where	O
minValue	O
inclusive	O
,	O
maxValue	O
exclusive	O

I	O
'm	O
using	O
.NET	B-Skill
entity	I-Skill
framework	I-Skill
4.1	O
with	O
code-first	O
approach	O
to	O
effectively	O
solve	O
the	O
following	O
problem	O
,	O
here	O
simplified	O
.	O

There	O
's	O
a	O
database	O
table	B-Skill
with	O
tens	O
of	O

.	O

Several	O
users	O
of	O

program	O

to	O

to	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

Modify	O
values	O
of	O
any	O
random	O
row	B-Skill
,	O
changes	O
are	O
frequent	O
but	O
need	O

.	O

It	O
's	O

rows	B-Skill
,	O
but	O

.	O

is	O
permitted	O
,	O
as	O
users	O
will	O
most	O
likely	O

same	O
rows	B-Skill
to	O
same	O
values	O
.	O

On	O
occasion	O
add	O
new	O
rows	B-Skill
.	O

Sounds	O
simple	O

.	O

My	O

to	O

a	O

.	O

This	O

.	O

am	O
performing	O
a	O
custom	O
traversal	O
in	O
Neo4J	B-Skill
,	O
using	O
my	O
own	O
evaluator	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
traversal	O
are	O
two	O
nodes	O
,	O
connected	O
by	O
two	O
different	O
relationships	O
.	O

What	O
I	O
'm	O
seeing	O
is	O
that	O
only	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
two	O
relationships	O
will	O
be	O
walked	O
during	O
the	O
traversal	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
my	O
custom	O
evaluation	O
changes	O
its	O
behavior	O
based	O
on	O
whether	O
both	O
relationships	O
are	O
present	O
.	O

It	O
seems	O
like	O
during	O
a	O
traversal	O
,	O
Neo4J	B-Skill
maintains	O
a	O
set	O
of	O
visited	O
nodes	O
,	O
and	O
if	O
a	O
candidate	O
path	O
ends	O
at	O
a	O
node	O
that	O
has	O
already	O
been	O
visited	O
,	O
then	O
that	O
path	O
is	O
never	O
sent	O
to	O
my	O
evaluator	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
a	O
way	O
around	O
this	O
?	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
have	O
a	O
custom	O
evaluator	O
examine	O
every	O
possible	O
path	O
to	O
the	O
nodes	O
?	O

Here	O
's	O
a	O
quick	O
example	O
:	O

Say	O
that	O
the	O
graph	O
looks	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

The	O
traversal	O
begins	O
at	O
A	O
.	O

A	O
has	O
two	O
different	O
relationships	O
tying	O
it	O
to	O
B	O
(	O
of	O
two	O
different	O
types	O
)	O
.	O

All	O
of	O
the	O
remaining	O
nodes	O
are	O
connected	O
by	O
only	O
1	O
relationship	O
.	O

The	O
goal	O
of	O
the	O
evaluator	O
is	O
to	O
return	O
A-D	O
,	O
A-B	O
,	O
and	O
B-C	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
D-E	O
.	O

The	O
determination	O
that	O
B-C	O
is	O
valid	O
comes	O
from	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
there	O
are	O
two	O
relationships	O
between	O
A	O
and	O
B	O
.	O

How	O
can	O
this	O
be	O

?	O

You	O
may	O
need	O
to	O
think	O
your	O
use	O
case	O
through	O
a	O
bit	O
more	O
carefully	O
.	O

One	O
suggestion	O
is	O
that	O
when	O
you	O
use	O
the	O
traversal	B-Skill
framework	I-Skill
in	O
java	B-Skill
,	O

O(n^2)	O
.	O

O(n^2)	O
.	O

This	O

.	O

of	O
high	O
curvature	O
and	O
removing	O
data	O
points	O
in	O
areas	O
of	O
little	O
curvature	O
is	O
a	O
general	O
approach	O
.	O

We	O
have	O
svn	B-Skill
1.6	O
,	O
a	O
trunk	O
with	O
approx	O
30000	O
files	O
(	O
1	O

)	O
,	O

a	O
"	O

"	O

trunk	O
.	O

"	O

svn	O

^	O
/trunk	O

.	O

:	O

?	O

:	O

.	O

?	O

It	O
is	O
probably	O

.	O

.	O

would	O

any	O
faster	O
,	O
though	O
..	O
.	O

Even	O

,	O

a	O

.	O

assembly	I-Skill
that	O

2	O

.	O

:	O

.	O

I	O
know	O
the	O
interaction	O
between	O
Javascript	B-Skill
and	O
XML	B-Skill
is	O
good	O
and	O
fairly	O

,	O
but	O
XML	B-Skill
is	O

.	O

Is	O

to	O

of	O
both	O
?	O

Have	O
a	O

(	O
PHP	B-Skill
)	O
generate	O

and	O
have	O

by	O

?	O

Or	O

in	O

wrong	O

with	O
this	O
?	O

Javascript	B-Skill
itself	O
does	O
n't	O
do	O
queries	O
....	O
it	O
needs	O
a	O
helper	O
like	O
PHP	B-Skill
,	O
.net	B-Skill
,	O
or	O
Java	B-Skill
.	O

It	O
can	O
traverse	O
XML	B-Skill
or	O
JSON	B-Skill
just	O
fine	O
like	O
you	O
say	O
,	O

all	O
possible	O

is	O
actually	O
required	O

to	O
massive	O
overhead	O
that	O
will	O
bring	O
your	O
app	O
to	O
its	O
knees	O
.	O

It	O
's	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
lack-of-scalability	O
.	O

My	O
personal	O
preference	O
is	O
JQuery	B-Skill
Ajax	O
talking	O
to	O
a	O
PHP	B-Skill
backend	O
(	O
transactions	O
via	O
JSON	B-Skill
)	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
'm	O
dealing	O
with	O
the	O
presentation	O
of	O
large	O
datasets	O
I	O
'll	O
always	O
page	O
the	O
information	O
server-side	O
and	O
pipeline	O
it	O
(	O
load	O
data	O
ahead	O
of	O
and	O
behind	O
the	O
current	O
view	O
to	O
reduce	O
transactions	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
usually	O
present	O
in	O
via	O
jQuery	B-Skill
DataTables	O
.	O

Grids	O
are	O
always	O
your	O
friend	O
with	O
large	O
amounts	O
of	O
data	O
.	O

Again	O
,	O
personal	O
preference	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
make	O
heavy	O
use	O
of	O
jQuery	B-Skill
UI	O
for	O
layout	O
and	O
presentation	O
,	O
and	O
I	O
do	O
write	O
custom	O
Javascript	B-Skill
for	O
the	O
"	O
nifty	O
"	O
one-off	O
type	O
things	O
that	O
come	O
up	O
.	O

Again	O
,	O
any	O
server	O
language	O
you	O
have	O
access	O
to	O
and	O
are	O
comfortable	O
with	O
will	O
suffice	O
,	O
as	O
Javascript	B-Skill
is	O
language	O
agnostic	O
.	O

Javascript	B-Skill
can	O
get	O
out	O
of	O
hand	O
in	O
a	O
hurry	O
.	O

I	O
'd	O
recommend	O
that	O
unless	O
you	O
have	O
a	O
ton	O
of	O
time	O
on	O
your	O
hands	O
that	O
you	O
focus	O
on	O
clean	O
presentation	O
via	O
something	O
baseline	O
like	O
HTML	B-Skill
with	O
judicious	O
use	O
of	O
Javascript	B-Skill
and	O
CSS	B-Skill
for	O
progressive	O
enhancement	O
.	O

Think	O
about	O
the	O
user	O
before	O
you	O
go	O
crazy	O
with	O
motion	O
,	O
dynamic	O
elements	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

Do	O
n't	O
forget	O
the	O
old	O
adage	O
,	O
"	O
80%	O
of	O
the	O
people	O
only	O
use	O
20%	O
of	O
the	O
functionality	O
"	O
Nail	O
that	O
20%	O
cleanly	O
before	O
going	O
to	O
town	O
on	O
flashy	O
javascript	B-Skill
fluff	O
.	O

Your	O
users	O
will	O
thank	O
you	O
!	O

JSON	O
is	O
by	O
far	O
the	O
fastest	O
to	O
parse	O
,	O
since	O
it	O
IS	O
JavaScript	B-Skill
.	O

Application	O
frameworks	O
like	O
EXT.JS	B-Skill
are	O
already	O
doing	O
this	O
with	O
great	O
success	O
.	O

The	O
following	O
describes	O
what	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
bug	O
in	O
Ruby	B-Skill
1.8	O
(	O
and	O
REE	O
)	O
but	O
has	O
been	O
fixed	O
in	O
1.9	O
.	O

I	O
'd	O
like	O
to	O
know	O
:	O

Why	O
calling	O
==	O
on	O
String	O
or	O
Fixnum	O
triggers	O
calling	O
==	O
on	O
other	O
object	O
at	O
all	O
?	O

Why	O
calling	O
==	O
on	O
String	O
works	O
differently	O
depending	O
on	O
the	O
other	O
object	O
class	O
?	O

Now	O
the	O
code	O
:	O

Example	O
1	O

Nothing	O
interesting	O
here	O
,	O
move	O
along	O
.	O

Example	O
2	O

Calling	O
==	O
on	O
String	O
triggers	O
==	O
on	O
other	O
object	O
of	O
Exception	O
class	O
.	O

Example	O
3	O

Calling	O
==	O
on	O
Fixnum	O
triggers	O
==	O
on	O
other	O
object	O
.	O

Example	O
4	O

Calling	O
==	O
on	O
String	O
triggers	O
==	O
on	O
other	O
object	O
of	O
Exception	O
class	O
.	O

Ruby	B-Skill
is	O
an	O
object-oriented	O
language	O
.	O

In	O
an	O
object-oriented	O
language	O
,	O
you	O
send	O
messages	O
to	O
objects	O
and	O
those	O
objects	O
then	O
respond	O
to	O
those	O
messages	O
however	O
they	O
see	O
fit	O
.	O

This	O
means	O
that	O
the	O
receiver	O
of	O
the	O
message	O
,	O
and	O
only	O
the	O
receiver(!)	O

is	O
in	O
total	O
control	O
of	O
what	O
a	O
message	O
means	O
.	O

With	O
some	O
operators	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
certain	O
expectations	O
of	O
symmetry	O
:	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
a	O
==	O
b	O
is	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
the	O
same	O
as	O
b	O
==	O
a	O
.	O

But	O
in	O
an	O
OO	O
language	O
that	O
is	O
impossible	O
!	O

Either	O
a	O
or	O
b	O
must	O
be	O
the	O
receiver	O
of	O
the	O
message	O
,	O
so	O
in	O
one	O
case	O
a	O
gets	O
to	O
decide	O
whether	O
a	O
and	O
b	O
are	O
equal	O
and	O
in	O
the	O
other	O
case	O
b	O
gets	O
to	O
decide	O
.	O

They	O
might	O
decide	O
differently	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
the	O
expectation	O
of	O
symmetry	O
would	O
be	O
broken	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
in	O
some	O
classes	O
equality	O
is	O
actually	O
implemented	O
something	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

Here	O
's	O
an	O
example	O
:	O
if	O
you	O
write	O
your	O
own	O
Numeric	O
class	O
(	O
say	O
,	O
a	O
Quaternion	O
class	O
)	O
,	O
then	O
the	O
system	O
builtin	O
Fixnum	O
class	O
does	O
n't	O
know	O
anything	O
about	O
Quaternions	O
.	O
So	O
,	O
when	O
you	O
ask	O
the	O
Fixnum	O
0	O
whether	O
it	O
is	O
equal	O
to	O
the	O
Quaternion	O
(	O
0	O
,	O
0	O
,	O
0	O
,	O
0	O
)	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
responds	O
false	O
,	O
even	O
though	O
that	O
's	O
wrong	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
instead	O
the	O
Fixnum	O
will	O
first	O
check	O
:	O
do	O
I	O
know	O
how	O
to	O
compare	O
myself	O
to	O
a	O
Quaternion	O
?	O

No	O
,	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
,	O
but	O
maybe	O
a	O
Quaternion	O
knows	O
how	O
to	O
compare	O
itself	O
to	O
a	O
Fixnum	O
!	O

After	O
all	O
,	O
the	O
Quaternion	O
class	O
did	O
n't	O
exist	O
when	O
the	O
Fixnum	O
class	O
was	O
written	O
,	O
so	O
the	O
Fixnum	O
class	O
cannot	O
know	O
about	O
Quaternions	O
.	O
But	O
when	O
the	O
Quaternion	O
class	O
was	O
written	O
,	O
maybe	O
the	O
author	O
was	O
so	O
thoughtful	O
to	O
make	O
it	O
possible	O
to	O
compare	O
Quaternions	O
with	O
Fixnums	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
why	O
Fixnum#	O
==	O
reverses	O
the	O
arguments	O
and	O
tries	O
again	O
.	O

With	O
String	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
the	O
same	O
but	O
somewhat	O
more	O
complicated	O
.	O

In	O
Ruby	B-Skill
,	O
classes	O
are	O
n't	O
types	O
and	O
subtyping	O
and	O
subclassing	O
are	O
different	O
.	O

Ruby	B-Skill
itself	O
does	O
n't	O
have	O
a	O
concept	O
of	O
type	O
at	O
all	O
!	O

The	O
type	O
of	O
an	O
object	O
is	O
its	O
protocol	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O
the	O
messages	O
it	O
understands	O
and	O
how	O
it	O
responds	O
to	O
them	O
.	O

But	O
that	O
concept	O
is	O
not	O
recorded	O
in	O
Ruby	B-Skill
(	O
unlike	O
Objective-C	B-Skill
,	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
which	O
does	O
have	O
an	O
explicit	O
notion	O
of	O
protocol	O
)	O
.	O

There	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
some	O
cases	O
,	O
where	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
break	O
OO	O
encapsulation	O
,	O
and	O
know	O
the	O
specific	O
type	O
and	O
even	O
more	O
:	O
the	O
specific	O
representation	O
of	O
the	O
type	O
.	O

(	O
Note	O
:	O
this	O
violates	O
OO	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
is	O
sometimes	O
necessary	O
for	O
performance	O
.	O
)	O

In	O
cases	O
,	O
where	O
Ruby	B-Skill
needs	O
an	O
object	O
to	O
be	O
of	O
a	O
specific	O
class	O
instead	O
of	O
just	O
responding	O
to	O
a	O
specific	O
protocol	O
,	O
you	O
would	O
lose	O
a	O
lot	O
of	O
flexibility	O
.	O

You	O
have	O
to	O
use	O
,	O
say	O
,	O
a	O
String	O
,	O
even	O
though	O
you	O
would	O
much	O
rather	O
use	O
a	O
Rope	O
instead	O
.	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
give	O
you	O
back	O
some	O
flexibility	O
,	O
Ruby	B-Skill
allows	O
you	O
to	O
pass	O
in	O
something	O
which	O
is	O
not	O
exactly	O
a	O
String	O
but	O
which	O
is	O
equivalent	O
to	O
one	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
converted	O
to	O
one	O
with	O
a	O
to_str	O
method	O
.	O

So	O
,	O
unlike	O
other	O
languages	O
,	O
where	O
A	O
IS-A	O
String	O
is	O
represented	O
by	O
A	O
being	O
a	O
subclass	O
of	O
String	O
,	O
in	O
Ruby	B-Skill
,	O
the	O
relationship	O
A	O
IS-A	O
String	O
is	O
represented	O
by	O
A	O
having	O
a	O
to_str	O
method	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
what	O
you	O
are	O
seeing	O
above	O
.	O

If	O
the	O
argument	O
to	O
String#	O
==	O
is	O
n't	O
a	O
String	O
,	O
then	O
String#	O
==	O
does	O
n't	O
know	O
what	O
to	O
do	O
with	O
it	O
.	O

But	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
"	O
string-like	O
"	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O
it	O
implements	O
to_str	O
,	O
then	O
maybe	O
it	O
does	O
know	O
how	O
to	O
compare	O
itself	O
to	O
a	O
String	O
?	O

Note	O
that	O
equality	O
is	O
very	O
hard	O
to	O
get	O
right	O
.	O

People	O
cannot	O
even	O
agree	O
on	O
what	O
it	O
means	O
in	O
a	O
purely	O
functional	O
language	O
,	O
and	O
that	O
's	O
the	O
easy	O
case	O
!	O

In	O
Ruby	B-Skill
,	O
there	O
are	O
two	O
additional	O
complications	O
:	O
mutable	O
state	O
and	O
OO	O
.	O

Mutable	O
state	O
means	O
that	O
two	O
objects	O
that	O
were	O
equal	O
a	O
moment	O
ago	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
equal	O
anymore	O
a	O
couple	O
of	O
moments	O
later	O
.	O

Or	O
should	O
they	O
be	O
?	O

Or	O
should	O
n't	O
they	O
be	O
?	O

And	O
OO	O
means	O
that	O
equality	O
cannot	O
be	O
symmetric	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
why	O
the	O
implementations	O
of	O
==	O
for	O
various	O
core	O
and	O
stdlib	B-Skill
classes	O
are	O
constantly	O
improved	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
also	O
why	O
you	O
may	O
see	O
weird	O
behavior	O
now	O
and	O
again	O
.	O

Sometimes	O
it	O
may	O
just	O
be	O
an	O
artifact	O
of	O
trying	O
to	O
get	O
equality	O
right	O
,	O
and	O
sometimes	O
it	O
might	O
just	O
simply	O
be	O
a	O
bug	O
.	O

By	O
the	O
way	O
:	O
for	O
the	O
arithmetic	O
operators	O
,	O
subclasses	O
of	O
Numeric	O
actually	O
have	O
a	O
more	O
formal	O
double-dispatch	O
protocol	O
using	O
the	O
coerce	O
method	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
Numeric	O
object	O
does	O
n't	O
know	O
what	O
to	O
do	O
with	O
another	O
Numeric	O
,	O
it	O
will	O
ask	O
that	O
other	O
object	O
to	O
coerce	O
the	O
two	O
objects	O
to	O
a	O
type	O
that	O
does	O
know	O
that	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
try	O
to	O
add	O
a	O
Quaternion	O
to	O
a	O
Fixnum	O
,	O
the	O
Fixnum	O
wo	O
n't	O
know	O
what	O
to	O
do	O
:	O

The	O
+	O
method	O
of	O
Fixnum	O
will	O
then	O
call	O
:	O

IOW	O
:	O
it	O
will	O
call	O
Quaternion	O
#coerce	O
with	O
the	O
equivalent	O
of	O

to	O
which	O
Quaternion	O
will	O
respond	O
with	O
an	O
Array	B-Skill
of	O
[	O
Quaternion.new(2,0,0,0)	O
,	O
Quaternion.new(1,0,0,0)	O
]	O

Then	O
,	O
Fixnum#+	O
will	O
try	O
again	O
by	O
simply	O
calling	O

Which	O
will	O
now	O
work	O
because	O
a	O
is	O
a	O
Quaternion	O
also	O
and	O
knows	O
how	O
to	O
add	O
two	O
Quaternions	O
.	O

A	O
very	O
common	O
implementation	O
of	O
coerce	O
is	O
simply	O
to	O
swap	O
the	O
arguments	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
equivalent	O
to	O
the	O
behavior	O
you	O
are	O
seeing	O
with	O
Fixnum#	O
==	O
.	O

Again	O
:	O
this	O
kind	O
of	O
dispatch	O
is	O
hard	O
to	O
get	O
right	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
are	O
improvements	O
being	O
made	O
to	O
the	O
coerce	O
protocol	O
.	O

Ruby	B-Skill
has	O
four	O
levels	O
of	O
object	O
equivalence	O
:	O

#equal	O
?	O
–	O
same	O
object	O

#eql	O
?	O
–	O
highest	O
level	O
of	O
equivalence	O
below	O
same	O
object	O

#	O
==	O
–	O
"	O
standard	O
"	O
equality	O

#	O
==	O
=	O
,	O
#	O
=	O
~	O
,	O
#hash	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

–	O
loose	O
equivalence	O
,	O
"	O
same	O
group	O
"	O
equivalence	O

Mindful	O
programmer	O
equips	O
each	O
of	O
her	O
classes	O
with	O
all	O
of	O
these	O
methods	O
except	O
#equal	O
?	O
,	O
which	O
should	O
never	O
be	O
overriden	O
.	O

Going	O
back	O
to	O
the	O
subject	O
of	O
your	O
question	O
,	O
many	O
built-in	O
Ruby	B-Skill
objects	O
have	O
their	O
share	O
of	O
idiosyncrasies	O
in	O
the	O
implementation	O
of	O
these	O
methods	O
.	O

Ruby	B-Skill
core	O
team	O
constantly	O
works	O
to	O
improve	O
them	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
should	O
make	O
your	O
way	O
from	O
1.8	O
to	O
2.0	O
,	O
which	O
fixes	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
1.8	O
problems	O
.	O

One	O
more	O
thing	O
to	O
mention	O
with	O
#	O
==	O
method	O
,	O
is	O
that	O
for	O
the	O
classes	O
that	O
represent	O
elements	O
of	O
ordered	O
sets	O
,	O
you	O
do	O
not	O
implement	O
#	O
==	O
directly	O
,	O
but	O
instead	O
you	O
provide	O
#<=>	O
three-way	O
comparison	O
method,	O
and	O
include	O
Comparable	B-Skill
module,	O
which	O
gives	O
you	O
for	O
free	O
methods	O
such	O
as	O
#==,	O
#<,	O
#>	O
,	O
#sort	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

Yet	O
one	O
more	O
thing	O
to	O
mention	O
with	O
all	O
of	O
these	O
operators	O
and	O
operator-like	O
methods	O
,	O
be	O
mindful	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
of	O
#coerce	O
method	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
currently	O
undergoing	O
improvements	O
in	O
Ruby	B-Skill
2.0	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
web	O
application	O
and	O
it	O
has	O
two	O
controller	O
classes	O
.	O

The	O
two	O
controllers	O
have	O
an	O
action	O
with	O
FormCollection	O
parameter	O
with	O
HTTPPost	O
attribute	O
decorated	O
.	O

If	O
I	O
click	O
on	O
Form	O
submit	O
button	O
then	O
which	O
action	O
will	O
be	O
triggered	O
to	O
capture	O
the	O
form	O
's	O
values	O
within	O
the	O
controller	O
.	O

Using	O
the	O
Form	O
Collection	O
class	O
we	O
can	O
capture	O
the	O
form	O
's	O
values	O
within	O
the	O
controller.There	O
are	O
many	O
ways	O
to	O
fetch	O
these	O
values	O
and	O
Form	O
Collection	O
is	O
the	O
one	O
of	O
them	O
.	O

http://tutorial.techaltum.com/Form-collection-in-MVC.html	O

http://www.c-sharpcorner.com/UploadFile/dacca2/understand-formcollection-in-mvc-controller/	O

Follow	O
above	O
link	O
It	O
will	O
help	O
you	O
to	O
understand	O
more	O
.	O

Dave	O

.	O

.	O

I	O
have	O
a	O

server	O
and	O

install	O

on	O
this	O
for	O

When	O
you	O
use	O
server	B-Skill
side	O
rendering	O
,	O
you	O
cannot	O
close	O
the	O
"	O
chain	O
"	O
you	O
are	O
refering	O
to	O
as	O
easily	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
because	O
what	O
Django	B-Skill
does	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
is	O
serve	O
all	O
the	O
HTML	B-Skill
and	O
JS	B-Skill
(	O
at	O
leas	O
the	O
JS	B-Skill
inside	O
your	O
HTML	B-Skill
view	O
)	O
in	O
a	O
single	O
initial	O
response	O
.	O

The	O
ajax	O
requests	O
you	O
do	O
after	O
that	O
will	O
not	O
be	O
bound	O
to	O
the	O
variables	O
you	O
send	O
initially	O
in	O
your	O
response	O
because	O
this	O
variables	O
are	O
populated	O
when	O
the	O
render()	O
function	O
is	O
called	O
.	O

After	O
that	O
moment	O
,	O
you	O
cannot	O
add	O
or	O
update	O
the	O
variables	O
that	O
were	O
sent	O
to	O
the	O
HTML	B-Skill
template	O
.	O

The	O
only	O
way	O
you	O
can	O
manage	O
rendering	O
small	O
parts	O
of	O
HTML	B-Skill
is	O
using	O
JQuery	B-Skill
or	O
making	O
your	O
backend	O
a	O
REST	O
API	O
with	O
Django	B-Skill
Rest	O
Framework	O
and	O
moving	O
to	O
a	O
more	O
complete	O
frontend	O
framework	O
like	O
Angular	B-Skill
or	O
React	B-Skill
.	O

The	O
are	O
many	O
discussions	O
over	O
server	B-Skill
side	O
rendering	O
vs	O
client	B-Skill
side	O
rendering	O
.	O

can	O

more	O
about	O
it	O

:	O

https://medium.com/@adamzerner/client-side-rendering-vs-server-side-rendering-a32d2cf3bfcc	O

a	O

.	O

,	O

ca	O

an	O
.html	O
file	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
got	O
a	O
few	O
questions	O
about	O
throwing	O
exceptions	O
in	O
C++	B-Skill
.	O

From	O
what	O
I	O
know	O
about	O
them	O
..	O
.	O

An	O
exception	O
can	O
be	O
thrown	O
from	O
within	O
the	O
main()	O
function	O
.	O

Any	O
block	O
of	O
code	O
that	O
can	O
throw	O
an	O
exception	O
in	O
the	O
main()	O
function	O
should	O
be	O
surrounded	O
by	O
try	O
and	O
catch	O
statements	O
as	O
follows	O

In	O
the	O
example	O
above	O
,	O
why	O
is	O
the	O
argument	O
to	O
the	O
catch	O
a	O
const	O
char	O
*	O
.	O

Does	O
n't	O
C++	B-Skill
allow	O
for	O
strings	O
?	O

Also	O
,	O
is	O
it	O
possible	O
to	O
throw	O
an	O
exception	O
that	O
is	O
n't	O
a	O
const	O
char	O
*	O
,	O
like	O
an	O
int	O
?	O

or	O
a	O
char	O
?	O

Does	O
throwing	O
an	O
exception	O
in	O
foo	O
,	O
terminate	O
the	O
foo	O
function	O
?	O

Are	O
there	O
cases	O
where	O
you	O
could	O
put	O
the	O
try	O
and	O
catch	O
statements	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
function	O
as	O
the	O
throw	O
?	O

Sorry	O
if	O
these	O
are	O
basic	O
questions	O
.	O

Thanks	O
SO	O

Because	O
you	O
threw	O
string	O
literal	O
which	O
decays	O
to	O
const	O
char*	O
.	O

In	O
short	O
,	O
you	O
catch	O
what	O
you	O
throw	O
.	O

It	O
does	O
,	O
but	O
to	O
catch	O
string	O
,	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
throw	O
string	O
in	O
first	O
place	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
throw	O
literally	O
anything	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
a	O
good	O
idea	O
to	O
throw	O
special	O
exception	O
classes	O
,	O
like	O
std::exception	O
and	O
derived	O
from	O
it	O
.	O

Yes	O
,	O
it	O
does	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
do	O
that	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
not	O
much	O
cases	O
where	O
doing	O
it	O
is	O
a	O
good	O
idea	O
.	O

It	O
looks	O
like	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
get	O
a	O
good	O
book	O
and	O
read	O
chapter	O
about	O
exceptions	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
meantime	O
this	O
super-FAQ	O
entry	O
might	O
help	O
you/	O

You	O
can	O
throw	O
an	O
object	O
of	O
any	O
type	O
.	O

EDIT	O
:	O
(	O
Hopefully	O
I	O
got	O
this	O
right	O
now	O
)	O

What	O
you	O
have	O
done	O
is	O
throw	O
a	O
C-string	B-Skill
,	O
which	O
is	O
of	O
type	O
const	O
char[13]	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
.	O

C-Arrays	B-Skill
will	O
decay	O
to	O
pointers	O
to	O
their	O
first	O
element	O
,	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
a	O
pointer	O
of	O
type	O
const	O
char*	O
.	O

Typically	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
do	O
is	O
throw	O
a	O
predefined	O
exception	O
object	O
.	O

They	O
can	O
be	O
found	O
in	O
header	O
<stdexcept>	O
and	O
are	O
derived	O
from	O
a	O
base	O
class	O
std::exception	O
.	O

The	O
derived	O
exception	O
classes	O
are	O
for	O
instance	O
std::logic_error	O
,	O
std::range_error	O
,	O
std::bad_alloc	O
etc	O
.	O

Their	O
constructors	O
take	O
a	O
string	O
as	O
argument	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
can	O
for	O
instance	O

This	O
message	O
can	O
be	O
accessed	O
in	O
a	O
catch	O
statement	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

If	O
an	O
exception	O
is	O
caught	O
,	O
so-called	O
stack	B-Skill
unwinding	O
takes	O
place	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
then	O
deal	O
with	O
the	O
error	O
locally	O
,	O
or	O
rethrow	O
the	O
exception	O
.	O

Only	O
when	O
an	O
exception	O
is	O
thrown	O
and	O
never	O
caught	O
,	O
std::terminate()	O
is	O
called	O
an	O
the	O
program	O
aborted	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
put	O
try/catch	O
statements	O
anywhere	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
remember	O
what	O
the	O
term	O
"	O
exception	O
"	O
actually	O
means	O
.	O

Cases	O
that	O
can	O
easily	O
dealt	O
with	O
using	O
a	O
simple	O
conditional	O
expression	O
if	O
(	O
n	O
<	O
0	O
)	O
break	O
;	O
or	O
something	O
like	O
that	O
,	O
do	O
n't	O
need	O
the	O
exception	O
treatment	O
.	O

Especially	O
if	O
you	O
can	O
realistically	O
expect	O
this	O
kind	O
of	O
unwanted	O
condition	O
to	O
be	O
true	O
often	O
.	O

Then	O
it	O
is	O
not	O
something	O
"	O
exceptional	O
"	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
decide	O
to	O
deal	O
with	O
an	O
error	O
using	O
exceptions	O
and	O
they	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
treated	O
locally	O
,	O
you	O
may	O
put	O
try/catch	O
clauses	O
around	O
the	O
beginning	O
and	O
end	O
of	O
main()	O
.	O

Since	O
you	O
can	O
put	O
several	O
catch	O
statements	O
directly	O
after	O
a	O
try	O
statement	O
,	O
you	O
can	O
then	O
begin	O
to	O
deal	O
with	O
more	O
specific	O
errors	O
,	O
or	O
simply	O
catch	O
anything	O
via	O
catch(...)	O
{	O
//..	O
.	O
}	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
all	O
described	O
in	O
great	O
detail	O
(	O
including	O
pointers	O
on	O
when	O
and	O
when	O
not	O
to	O
use	O
it	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
C++	B-Skill
FAQ	O
.	O

EDIT	O
:	O
Here	O
's	O
an	O
example	O
that	O
makes	O
use	O
of	O
try/catch	O
statements	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
not	O
an	O
exception	O
object	O
is	O
caught	O
,	O
but	O
an	O
int	O
(	O
errno	O
)	O
.	O

Just	O
to	O
show	O
,	O
that	O
you	O
can	O
really	O
throw/catch	O
anything	O
you	O
like	O
.	O

Let	O
process_several_files()	O
be	O
a	O
function	O
somewhere	O
nested	O
in	O
your	O
code	O
:	O

if	O
want	O
to	O
allocate	O
non-cacheable	O
physical	O
memory	O
(	O
DRAM	O
)	O
for	O
usage	O
in	O
the	O
driver	B-Skill
,	O
(	O
ie	O
.	O
do	O
n't	O
want	O
the	O
data	O
being	O
cached	O
into	O
the	O
CPU	O
's	O
data	O
cache	O
when	O
the	O
data	O
are	O
accessed	O
)	O
how	O
could	O
I	O
do	O
this	O
?	O

there	O
are	O
functions	O
like	O
kmalloc()	O
,	O
get_free_pages	O
,	O
vmalloc	O
,	O
etc	O
,	O
but	O
seems	O
like	O
that	O
I	O
ca	O
n't	O
specify	O
if	O
the	O
data	O
can	O
be	O
cached	O
or	O
not	O
using	O
these	O
functions	O
?	O

any	O
suggestion	O
on	O
how	O
to	O
do	O
it	O
?	O

thanks	O
!	O

In	O
short	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
easy	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
this	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
very	O
platform	O
dependent	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
want	O
a	O
go	O
at	O
it	O
read	O
drivers/char/mem.c	O
and	O
Chapter	O
15	O
of	O
the	O
Linux	B-Skill
Device	O
Drivers	O
3rd	O
Edition	O
book	O
.	O

I	O
'm	O
trying	O
to	O
add	O
pie	O
charts	O
using	O
chart.js	O
.	O

But	O
instead	O
of	O

data	O
in	O
js	O
file	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
generate	O
charts	O
using	O
HTML	B-Skill
data	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
my	O
HTML	B-Skill
:	O

I	O
need	O
every	O
chart	O
retrieve	O
it	O
's	O
sibling	O
chart	O
data	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
my	O
js	B-Skill
:	O

Ok	O
anyway	O
I	O
solve	O
it	O
by	O
myself	O
.	O

Here	O
is	O
the	O
answer	O
for	O
other	O
if	O
have	O
the	O
same	O
problem	O
.	O

Sorry	O
if	O
there	O
's	O
bad	O
practices	O
in	O
my	O
js	B-Skill
.	O

I	O
'm	O
not	O
a	O
pro	O
.	O

To	O
create	O
new	O
graphs	B-Skill
to	O
dynamics	O
elements	O
inserted	O
you	O
can	O
create	O
a	O
DOM	B-Skill
Observer	O
.	O

I	O
create	O
a	O
fiddle	B-Skill
with	O
a	O
example	O
in	O

I	O
see	O
a	O
warning	O
like	O
this	O
in	O
my	O
logs	O
:	O

This	O
message	O
does	O
not	O
help	O
very	O
much	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
like	O
to	O
see	O
the	O
stacktrace	O
where	O
this	O
happens	O
.	O

Please	O
do	O
n't	O
look	O
into	O
the	O
content	O
of	O
this	O
warning	O
.	O

This	O
question	O
is	O
not	O
about	O
Beautiful	B-Skill
Soup	I-Skill
:-)	O

An	O
easy	O
solution	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
modify	O
the	O
third	O
party	O
code	O

and/or	O
a	O
Handler	O
.	O

They	O
should	O
do	O
something	O
every	O
second	O
,	O
no	O
matter	O
if	O
the	O
screen	O
is	O
on	O
or	O
not	O
(	O
standby	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
problem	O
is	O
,	O

some	O

(	O

)	O

has	O

.	O

I	O
am	O
using	O
SignalR	B-Skill
Self	B-Skill

Service	I-Skill
(	O

)	O

.	O

I	O
am	O
having	O
a	O
button	O
to	O
stop	O
connection	O
to	O
the	O
SignalR	B-Skill
service	O
.	O

What	O

,	O

this	O
button	O
,	O
Connection	O
of	O
that	O
Client	B-Skill
should	O
get	O
disconnected	O
from	O
SignalR	B-Skill
Hub	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
able	O
to	O
get	O
disconnected	O
from	O
SignalR	B-Skill
Hub	O
but	O
it	O
takes	O
so	O
much	O
time	O
to	O
respond	O
and	O
my	O
Client	B-Skill
(	O
Silverlight	B-Skill
Web	O
Application	O
)	O
gets	O
into	O
unresponsive	O
state	O
and	O
comes	O
back	O
after	O
around	O
28-30	O
secs	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
any	O
way	O
to	O
disconnect	O
client	B-Skill
immediately	O
once	O
the	O
button	O
is	O
clicked	O
?	O

This	O
is	O
because	O
of	O
a	O
deadlock	O
.	O

SignalR	B-Skill
client	B-Skill
blocks	O
the	O
thread	O
when	O
sending	O
the	O
Abort	O
request	O
.	O

However	O
Silverlight	B-Skill
wants	O
to	O
send	O
the	O
request	O
on	O
the	O
UI	O
thread	O
.	O

The	O
default	O
timeout	O
for	O
stopping	O
the	O
connection	O
is	O
30	O
seconds	O
so	O
after	O
the	O
timeout	O
the	O
thread	O
is	O
unblocked	O
and	O
execution	O
continues	O
.	O

This	O
can	O
be	O
worked	O
around	O
by	O
invoking	O
stop	O
asynchronously	O
(	O
await	O
Task.Factory.StartNew	O
(()	O
=>	O
hubConnection.Stop());)	O
or	O
making	O
the	O
timeout	O
smaller	O
.	O

?	O

The	O
reason	O
your	O
gsub	O
does	O
n't	O
work	O
is	O
because	O
.	O
has	O
a	O
special	O
meaning	O
in	O
regex	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
have	O
it	O
interpreted	O
literally	O
by	O
specifying	O
fixed	O
=	O
TRUE	O
.	O

in	O
your	O
gsub	O
call	O
,	O
"	O
.	O
"	O
is	O
your	O
pattern	O
.	O

The	O
"	O
.	O
"	O
symbol	O
in	O
a	O
pattern	O
means	O
"	O
any	O
character	O
"	O
,	O
so	O
you	O
're	O
talling	O
gsub	O
to	O
replace	O
every	O
character	O
with	O
a	O
dash	O
.	O

The	O
correct	O
gsub	O
call	O
requires	O
escaping	O
the	O
period	O
so	O
R	B-Skill
knows	O
this	O
is	O
a	O
literal	O
period	O
:	O

This	O
syntax	O
will	O
have	O
gsub	O
replace	O
all	O
periods	O
with	O
dashes	O
.	O

But	O
really	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
n't	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
,	O
you	O
want	O
dates	O
.	O

You	O
need	O
to	O
use	O
as.Date	O
like	O
so	O
:	O

Your	O
intended	O
solution	O
would	O
only	O
have	O
converted	O
your	O
strings	O
to	O
a	O
different	O
string	O
format	O
.	O

Using	O
as.Date	O
tells	O
R	B-Skill
to	O
treat	O
the	O
values	O
as	O
dates	O
and	O
not	O
strings	O
.	O

will	O
produce	O
an	O
error	O
(	O
because	O
R	B-Skill
does	O
n't	O
understand	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
when	O
you	O
ask	O
it	O
to	O
plot	O
nothing	O
but	O
strings	O
)	O
,	O
whereas	O
:	O

Produces	O
a	O
plot	O
of	O
index	O
vs	O
.	O
day	O
of	O
the	O
week	O
(	O
since	O
R	B-Skill
recognizes	O
that	O
you	O
have	O
timeseries	O
data	O
)	O
.	O

My	O

like	O

where	O
keywords	O
is	O

of	O

so	O

,	O
and	O
session	O
is	O

a	O
new	O

from	O
the	O
requests	B-Skill
module	O
.	O

The	O

Here	O

that	O
I	O
am	O
running	O
:	O

From	O
my	O
experience	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
hit	O

with	O
multiple	O
cart	O
changes	O
at	O
the	O
same	O
time	O
,	O
only	O
one	O
will	O
go	O
through	O
.	O

My	O
guess	O
is	O
that	O

handles	O
the	O
cart	O
something	O
like	O
this	O
:	O

At	O
time	O
0	O
we	O
have	O
our	O
initial	O
cart	O
call	O
it	O
cart0	O

At	O
time	O
t	O
,	O
we	O
submit	O
n	O
simultaneous	O
requests	O
to	O
add/update/change	O
the	O
cart	O

Request	O
0	O
:	O
take	O
cart0	O
and	O
apply	O
request	O
,	O
return	O
result	O

Request	O
1	O
:	O
take	O
cart0	O
and	O
apply	O
request	O
,	O
return	O
result	O

..	O
.	O

Request	O
n	O
:	O
take	O
cart0	O
and	O
apply	O
request	O
,	O
return	O
result	O

This	O
seems	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
cart	O
return	O
values	O
that	O
I	O
got	O
when	O
I	O
tested	O
multiple	O
requests	O
at	O
the	O
same	O
time	O
each	O
callback	O
function	O
would	O
trigger	O
with	O
a	O
cart	O
that	O
had	O
a	O
single	O
change	O
applied	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
found	O
two	O
ways	O
to	O
deal	O
with	O
this	O
limitation	O
.	O

The	O
first	O
is	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
the	O
requests	O
are	O
chained	O
so	O
that	O
we	O
wait	O
for	O
one	O
to	O
finish	O
before	O
making	O
the	O
next	O
effectively	O
turning	O

asynchronous	O
requests	O
into	O
synchronous	O
ones	O
.	O

Not	O
the	O
best	O
for	O
speed	O
.	O

The	O
other	O
method	O
only	O
works	O
if	O
we	O
do	O

have	O
line	O
item	O
properties	O
to	O
worry	O
about	O
:	O
combining	O
all	O
the	O
additions/changes	O
into	O
one	O
call	O
to	O
/cart/update.js	O
,	O
passing	O
the	O
variant	O
IDs	O
and	O
desired	O
quantities	O
all	O
at	O
once	O
see	O
https://help.shopify.com/themes/development/getting-started/using-ajax-api#update-cart	O
for	O
examples	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
do	O
n't	O
have	O
line	O
properties	O
to	O
worry	O
about	O
,	O
changing	O
your	O
single-line	O
additions	O
into	O
one	O
big	O
update	O
will	O
be	O
a	O
significant	O
speed	O
and	O
reliability	O
increase	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
javafx	B-Skill
application	O

a	O

.	O

can	O

?	O

I	O

not	O

,	O
Get	O

like	O

,	O

Can	O

what	O

gcov	B-Skill
message	O
"	O

mismatch	O
for	O

"	O

I	O
have	O
found	O
the	O

in	O

gcc	B-Skill
source	O
here	O
:	O

http://www.opensource.apple.com/source/gcc/gcc-5646/gcc/libgcov.c	O

It	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
sanity	O
check	O
that	O
the	O
tags	O
in	O
the	O
.gcda	O
files	O
match	O
,	O
but	O
I	O
'm	O
not	O
sure	O
.	O

Anyone	O
know	O
how	O
to	O
work	O
around	O
this	O
?	O

This	O
happens	O
when	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
objects	O
you	O
're	O
linking	O
into	O
an	O
executable	O
changes	O
significantly	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
it	O
gains	O
or	O
loses	O
some	O
lines	O
of	O
profilable	O
code	O
.	O

The	O
minimal	O
case	O
to	O
produce	O
the	O
error	O
is	O
with	O
2	O
source	O
files	O
.	O

Here	O
are	O
2	O
example	O
source	O
files	O
called	O
c	O
..	O
.	O

and	O
stuff.c	O

What	O
they	O
do	O
is	O
n't	O
important	O
.	O

To	O
build	O
them	O
,	O
here	O
is	O
a	O
simple	O
Makefile	O
:	O

The	O
Makefile	O
is	O
set	O
up	O
so	O
that	O
the	O
compilation	O
is	O
main.c	O
->	O
main.o	O
,	O
stuff.c	O
->	O
stuff.o	O
and	O
finally	O
stuff.o	O
+	O
main.o	O
->	O
testexe	O
.	O

If	O
we	O
compile	O
and	O
link	O
those	O
C	B-Skill
files	O
with	O
the	O
-fprofile-arcs	O
-ftest-coverage	O
options	O
then	O
the	O
executable	O
file	O
has	O
profiling	O
.	O

Run	O
that	O
execuatable	O
and	O
you	O
'll	O
get	O
2	O
output	O
files	O
,	O
main.gcda	O
and	O
stuff.gcda	O
.	O

So	O
far	O
so	O
good	O
.	O

Now	O
change	O
the	O
line	O
#if	O
0	O
to	O
#if	O
1	O
.	O

The	O
Makefile	O
should	O
cause	O
just	O
stuff.c	O
to	O
recompile	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
executable	O
to	O
relink	O
.	O

Next	O
time	O
you	O
the	O
test	O
executable	O
gets	O
run	O
you	O
'll	O
get	O
the	O
"	O
Merge	O
mismatch	O
"	O
message	O
for	O
the	O
main.gcda	O
file	O
.	O

The	O
stuff.gcda	O
file	O
is	O
not	O
affected	O
since	O
its	O
object	O
file	O
has	O
been	O
recreated	O
with	O
all	O
the	O
new	O
summary	O
information	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
recompile	O
main.c	O
and	O
relink	O
the	O
executable	O
,	O
then	O
the	O
error	O
message	O
goes	O
away	O
.	O

So	O
what	O
can	O
be	O
done	O
?	O

I	O
'd	O
love	O
to	O
know	O
!	O

the	O
moment	O
I	O
run	O
find	O
.	O
-name	O
'	O
*	O
.gcda	O
'	O
|	O
xargs	O
rm	O
whenever	O

to	O

coverage	O

.	O

profiling	O
"	O
just	O

"	O
,	O

seems	O

overkill	O
.	O

am	O
using	O
openssl	B-Skill
0.9.8g	O
to	O
validate	O
the	O
certificate	O
signature	O
.	O

.	O

.	O

I	O

that	O

is	O
"	O

"	O
,	O
which	O
should	O
be	O
left	O

.	O

The	O
braces	O
check	O
in	O
my	O
original	O
regex	O
is	O
there	O
for	O
this	O
reason	O
.	O

That	O
regex	O
is	O
not	O
legal	O
in	O
sed	O
;	O
since	O
it	O
uses	O
Perl	B-Skill
syntax	O
,	O
my	O
recommendation	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
use	O
perl	B-Skill
instead	O
.	O

The	O
regular	O
expression	O
works	O
exactly	O
as-is	O
,	O
and	O
even	O
the	O
command	B-Skill
line	I-Skill
is	O
almost	O
the	O
same	O
;	O
you	O
just	O
need	O
to	O
add	O
the	O
-p	O
option	O
to	O
get	O
perl	B-Skill
to	O
operate	O
in	O
filter	O
mode	O
(	O
which	O
sed	O
does	O
by	O
default	O
)	O
.	O

I	O
would	O
also	O
recommend	O
adding	O
an	O
argument	O
suffix	O
to	O
the	O
-i	O
option	O
(	O
whether	O
using	O
sed	O
or	O
perl	B-Skill
)	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
you	O
have	O
a	O
backup	O
of	O
the	O
original	O
file	O
in	O
case	O
something	O
goes	O

.	O

for	O

:	O

A	O

will	O
do	O
it	O
:	O

I	O
am	O
currently	O
trying	O
to	O
turn	O
a	O
Python	B-Skill
script	O

an	O

using	O

.	O

is	O

.	O

is	O

)	O

allow	O
for	O

(	O

.	O

?	O

I	O
am	O
also	O
using	O
Python	B-Skill
2.7	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
use	O
the	O
entry	O
widget	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
user	O
input	O
as	O
a	O

.	O

A	O
user	O
can	O

in	O
there	O

and	O

the	O

.	O

This	O
button	O
can	O
be	O

to	O
a	O
function	O
that	O
will	O
do	O
anything	O
you	O
need	O
it	O
to	O
form	O
there	O
.	O

In	O
PHP	B-Skill
,	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
make	O
it	O
so	O
that	O
if	O
a	O
user	O
types	O
:	O

[	O
LINK	O
]	O
url	O
[	O
/LINK	O
]	O

It	O
will	O
replace	O
it	O
with	O
the	O
anchor	O
tag	O
:	O

<a	O
href=url>url</a>	O

How	O
would	O
I	O
show	O
this	O
?	O

I	O
'm	O
not	O
sure	O
how	O
to	O
translate	O
this	O
into	O
regex	B-Skill
..	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
tried	O
the	O
following	O
:	O

[	O
LINK	O
]	O
[	O
a-zA-Z0-9_-.	O
]	O
+	O
[	O
/LINK	O
]	O

But	O
obviously	O
that	O
is	O
n't	O
right	O
:(	O

Explanation	O
:	O

Catch	O
links	O
but	O
would	O
always	O
require	O
leading	O
http://	O
or	O
https://	O
else	O
the	O
url	O
would	O
be	O
example.com/google.com	O
also	O
you	O
should	O
use	O
preg_replace_callback()	O
as	O
its	O
possible	O
to	O
xss	B-Skill
unsanitized	O
input	O
.	O

Here	O
are	O
some	O
examples	O
:	O

Or	O
Strip	O
the	O
http://	O
&	O
https://	O
from	O
the	O
link	O
then	O
append	O
it	O
when	O
outputting	O
.	O

Or	O
A	O
different	O
way	O
to	O
have	O
BB	B-Skill
code	I-Skill
links	O
,	O
then	O
you	O
can	O
specify	O
Link	O
name	O
from	O
link	O
address	O
,	O
the	O
call	O
back	O
function	O
can	O
be	O
made	O
to	O
handle	O
multiple	O
types	O
of	O
outputs	O
.	O

I	O
have	O
a	O
tables	B-Skill
:	O

Analyses	O
,	O
columns(id	B-Skill
,	O
name	O
,	O
game_id(FK	O
));	O

Games	O
,	O
columns(id	B-Skill
,	O
name	O
,	O
round_id(FK	O
));	O

Round	O
,	O
columns(id,	B-Skill
round)	O
;	O

I	O
need	O
get	O
all	O
records	O
of	O
Analyses	O
order	O
by	O
(	O
round_id	O
)	O
.	O

I	O
try	O

,	O
but	O
not	O
work	O
;	O

First	O
of	O
all	O
,	O
you	O
dont	O
have	O
that	O
column	B-Skill
in	O
your	O
analyses	O
table	B-Skill

to	O
do	O
the	O

to	O
add	O
this	O
to	O
your	O
relation	O
(	O
assuming	O
they	O
are	O
correctly	O
done	O
)	O

Analyses	O
model	O

Games	O
model	O

Now	O
you	O
can	O
get	O
all	O
the	O
Analyses	O
with	O
the	O
games	O
and	O
round	O
using	O
eagerloading	O
like	O
this	O

you	O
can	O
chain	O
another	O
orderby	O
for	O
Analyses	O
like	O
this	O
for	O
exemple	O

in	O
the	O
above	O
exemple	O
,	O
you	O
will	O
have	O
Analyses	O
ordered	O
by	O
game_id	O
and	O
the	O
games	O
inside	O
each	O
Analyse	O
will	O
be	O
orderedby	O
round_id	O

I	O
hope	O
this	O
is	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
to	O
do	O

Analyses	O
model	O

Round	O
Model	O

Game	O
Model	O

Your	O
Query	O
Should	O
be	O
like	O
This	O

I	O
'm	O
reading	O
the	O
book	O
Programming	O
Entity	O
Framework	O
:	O
DbContext	O
and	O
I	O
just	O
read	O
the	O
chapter	O
on	O
the	O
three	O
data	O
loading	O
types	O
:	O

Lazy	B-Skill
loading	I-Skill
(	O
default	O
)	O

Eager	B-Skill
loading	I-Skill

Explicit	B-Skill
loading	I-Skill

Now	O
I	O
'm	O
asking	O
myself	O
which	O
data	O
loading	O
is	O
better	O
in	O
which	O
situation	O
.	O

A	O
concrete	O
comparison	O
would	O
be	O
nice	O
!	O

I	O
have	O
n't	O
found	O
any	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
I	O
'm	O
using	O
default	O
lazy	B-Skill
loading	I-Skill
on	O
a	O
module	O
for	O
a	O
client	B-Skill
.	O

This	O
module	O
deals	O
with	O
sales	O
reps	O
and	O
imply	O
these	O
related	O
tables	O
:	O

Reps	O

Reps_Zones	O

Reps_Prerequisites	O

Users	O

Reps_Languages	O

etc	O
.	O

On	O
the	O
module	O
,	O
I	O
use	O
all	O
these	O
tables	O
to	O
dispatch	O
appointments	O
(	O
about	O
150	O
appointments	O
to	O
50	O
reps	O
at	O
a	O
time	O
)	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
's	O
slow	O
.	O

Would	O
using	O
a	O
different	O
loading	O
strategy	O
really	O
improve	O
the	O
performances	O
?	O

Lazy-loading	B-Skill
seems	O
most	O
suitable	O
for	O
smaller	O
apps	O
without	O
separate	O
data	O
layers	O
.	O

Once	O
the	O
app	O
grows	O
and	O
you	O
start	O
separating	O
it	O
into	O
separate	O
layers	O
,	O
lazy	B-Skill
loading	I-Skill
becomes	O
less	O
useful	O
.	O

The	O
DBcontext	O
has	O
long	O
since	O
been	O
destroyed	O
by	O
the	O
time	O
the	O
data	O
gets	O
to	O
the	O
UI	O
layer	O
,	O
and	O
while	O
you	O
are	O
within	O
the	O
datalayer	O
it	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
big	O
deal	O
to	O
specify	O
the	O
properites	O
to	O
load	O
.	O

Lazy	B-Skill
loading	I-Skill
is	O
turned	O
off	O
for	O
validation	O
,	O
so	O
if	O
a	O
property	O
is	O
marked	O
as	O
required	O
and	O
you	O
have	O
only	O
loaded	O
the	O
parent	O
an	O
error	O
will	O
always	O
be	O
thrown	O
which	O
is	O
very	O
frustrating	O
.	O

Lazy	B-Skill
loading	I-Skill
also	O
makes	O
debugging	O
rather	O
tricky	O
as	O
the	O
query	O
isnt	O
executed	O
until	O
it	O
is	O
used	O
so	O
you	O
ca	O
n't	O
examine	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
the	O
query	O
as	O
easily	O
.	O

I	O
usually	O
add	O
a	O
ToList()	O
or	O
similar	O
to	O
my	O
EF	O
queries	O
so	O
I	O
can	O
easily	O
examine	O
the	O
results	O
.	O

It	O
seems	O
like	O
there	O
's	O
a	O
bug	O
with	O
the	O
facebook	O
page	O
tabs	O
.	O

Lots	O
of	O
them	O
are	O
rendering	O
content	O
on	O
the	O
bottom	O
of	O
the	O
page	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
a	O
change	O
that	O
developers	O
must	O
be	O
aware	O
of	O
?	O

Problem	O
still	O
persists	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
bug	O
listed	O
on	O
Facebook	O
http://developers.facebook.com/bugs/298512163544012?browse=search_4f3c5c801a70d4639459595	O
.	O

I	O
hope	O
it	O
gets	O
prioritized	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
in	O
fact	O
a	O
bug	O
.	O

I	O
've	O
just	O
spent	O
an	O
hour	O
looking	O
into	O
it	O
.	O

It	O
appears	O
that	O
they	O
have	O
increased	O
the	O
width	O
of	O
the	O
right	O
pane	O
and	O
it	O
has	O
caused	O
the	O
content	O
area	O
to	O
shrink	O
to	O
less	O
than	O
520px	O
.	O

Unfortunately	O
,	O
the	O
iframe	O
that	O
Facebook	O
uses	O
to	O
display	O
app	O
content	O
is	O
hardcoded	O
with	O
a	O
520px	O
width	O
and	O
you	O
are	O
unable	O
to	O
modify	O
it	O
.	O

Need	O
to	O
wait	O
till	O
Facebook	O
pushes	O
out	O
an	O
update	O
.	O

Edit	O
:	O
Bug	O
reported	O
to	O
facebook	O
already	O
.	O

Details	O
here	O

I	O
see	O
it	O
is	O
used	O
in	O
separate	O
window	O
by	O
blue	B-Skill
griffon	I-Skill
,	O
but	O
is	O
it	O
possible	O
to	O
make	O
it	O
edit	O
the	O
svg	O
in	O
place	O
?	O

In	O
theory	O
you	O
could	O
open	O
svg-edit.html	O
and	O
remove	O
any	O
html	O
,	O
head	O
,	O
and	O
body	O
tags	O
and	O
move	O
the	O
content	O
of	O
the	O
page	O
to	O
your	O
page	O
and	O
then	O
load	O
js/css	B-Skill
resources	O
on	O
your	O
page	O
.	O

Is	O
there	O
a	O
specific	O
need	O
to	O
place	O
it	O
inline	O
though	O
?	O

You	O
can	O
still	O
interact	O
with	O
SVG-Edit	B-Skill
even	O
while	O
it	O
's	O
in	O
an	O
iframe	O
if	O
you	O
need	O
to	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
to	O
get	O
the	O
SVG	O
content	O
that	O
the	O
user	O
is	O

,	O
you	O
would	O
use	O

Is	O
there	O
any	O
way	O
how	O
to	O

Is	O

foo.bar	O

a	O

?	O

Operator	O
operator->	O
can	O
only	O

a	O

type	O
(	O

to	O
(	O
*	O
ptr	O
)	O
.bar	O
)	O

a	O
type	O

(	O

that	O
case	O

semantic	O

on	O

itself	O
)	O
.	O

An	O
example	O
with	O
a	O
pointer	O
type	O
might	O
be	O
:	O

An	O
example	O
for	O
an	O
overloaded	O
type	O
could	O
be	O
:	O

foo->bar	O
is	O
used	O
when	O
foo	O
is	O
pointing	O
to	O
a	O
certain	O
data	O
type	O

foo.bar	O
is	O
used	O
when	O
foo	O
is	O
an	O
object	O
of	O
a	O
class	O

I	O
created	O
a	O
Service	O
Object	O
called	O
Transaction	O
which	O
processes	O
an	O
order	O
made	O
,	O
sets	O
up	O
the	O
payments	O
and	O
then	O
sets	O
up	O
a	O
model	O
association	O
.	O

The	O
class	O
is	O
called	O
Transaction	O
with	O
two	O
methods	O
,	O
initialize	O
and	O
pay	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
testing	O
it	O
in	O
spec/services/	O
(	O
it	O
is	O
in	O
app/services	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
initialize	O
method	O
takes	O
in	O
an	O
account	O
and	O
some	O
parameters	O
passed	O
in	O
by	O
the	O
user	O
to	O
process	O
the	O
order	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
trying	O
to	O
test	O
pay	O
with	O
rspec	B-Skill
.	O

How	O
do	O
I	O
actually	O
do	O
such	O
a	O
test	O
?	O

This	O
function	O
has	O
a	O
lot	O
going	O
on	O
.	O

For	O
example	O
,	O
it	O
creates	O
new	O
models	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
sets	O
up	O
some	O
associations	O
between	O
them	O
.	O

So	O
far	O
,	O
I	O
created	O
a	O
double	O
account	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O

@account	O
=	O
double	O
(	O
"	O
account	O
"	O
,	O
:confirmed	O
=>	O
true	O
,	O
:confirmed	O
?	O
=>	O
true	O
)	O

However	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
many	O
functions	O
(	O
and	O
associations	O
)	O
used	O
in	O
the	O
Transaction	O
pay	O
method	O
.	O

So	O
for	O
example	O
when	O
these	O
associations	O
are	O
called	O
(	O
once	O
I	O
call	O
Transaction.pay	O
in	O
the	O
test	O
)	O
,	O
it	O
returns	O
an	O
error	O
:	O

The	O
business	O
model	O
is	O
a	O
double	O
just	O
like	O
account	O
,	O
and	O
added	O
as	O
an	O
attribute	O
to	O
@account	O
.	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
test	O
my	O
Transaction.pay	O
when	O
it	O
creates	O
new	O
models	O
and	O
associations	O
in	O
there	O
?	O

Do	O
I	O
need	O
to	O
mock	O
all	O
of	O
them	O
as	O
shown	O
above	O
?	O

Or	O
is	O
there	O
a	O
better	O
way	O
to	O
do	O
it	O
?	O

I	O
am	O
using	O
FactoryGirl	B-Skill
,	O
but	O
I	O
am	O
unable	O
to	O
use	O
it	O
as	O
my	O
account	O
model	O
uses	O
Devise	B-Skill
.	O

Devise	B-Skill
test	O
helpers	O
cannot	O
be	O
used	O
outside	O
of	O
controllers	O
,	O
and	O
since	O
I	O
'm	O
testing	O
in	O
services	O

wo	O

My	O

is	O
like	O

:	O
sqlfiddle	B-Skill

I	O

to	O

,	O

,	O

4	O
.	O

the	O
largest	O
,	O

and	O
average	O
on	O

.	O

I	O
have	O
tried	O
this	O

but	O
it	O
didnot	O
select	O
the	O
last	O
3	O
digit	O
of	O
the	O
PatientID	O
that	O
are	O
multiplies	O
of	O
4.	O
.	O

Add	O
Where	O
Cast(Substring(PatientId	O
,	O
Len(PatientId	O
)	O
2	O
,	O
3	O
)	O
as	O
Integer	O
)	O
%	O
4	O
=	O
0	O

Assuming	O
that	O
you	O
ca	O

change	O
your	O
schema	O
to	O
give	O
tableHeader	O
a	O
varchar	O

a	O

to	O
account	O
for	O
the	O

on	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
column	B-Skill
.	O

RTRIM	O
will	O
what	O
you	O
want	O
.	O

In	O
my	O
app	O
I	O
want	O
to	O
use	O
$	O
this->forward404	O
(	O
"	O
Data	O
not	O
found	O
"	O
)	O
;	O
to	O
output	O
individual	O
error	O
messages	O
when	O
necessary	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
dev	O
mode	O
it	O
works	O
fine	O
.	O

When	O
I	O
run	O
my	O
app	O
in	O
production	O
mode	O
where	O
debug	O
is	O
set	O
to	O
false	O
in	O
getApplicationConfiguration()	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
get	O
the	O
messages	O
anymore	O
.	O

in	O
settings.yml	O
I	O
set	O
a	O
custom	O
404	O
action	O
.	O

all	O
:	O
.actions	O
:	O
error_404_module	O
:	O
main	O
error_404_action	O
:	O
custom404	O

How	O
can	O
I	O
pass	O
the	O
forward404	O
to	O
my	O
custom404Success.php	O
template	O
??	O
?	O

The	O
404	O
handling	O
is	O
completely	O
different	O
between	O
prod	O
and	O
dev	O
.	O

In	O
prod	O
,	O
the	O
message	O
you	O
pass	O
to	O
the	O
forward404	O
is	O
simply	O
written	O
to	O
the	O
log	O
and	O
not	O
passed	O
to	O
the	O
handler	O
action	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
many	O
ways	O
to	O
get	O
round	O
this	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
quickest	O
(	O
albeit	O
dirtiest	O
)	O
would	O
be	O
to	O
store	O
the	O
message	O
in	O
a	O
static	O
variable	O
somewhere	O
so	O
the	O
404	O
handler	O
can	O
access	O
it	O
once	O
the	O
process	O
gets	O
there	O
,	O
e.g	O
.	O

In	O
your	O
action	O
,	O

And	O
in	O
your	O
404	O
handler	O
(	O
assuming	O
it	O
's	O
in	O
CommonActions	O
)	O
,	O

If	O
you	O
are	O
able	O
to	O
get	O
code	O
of	O
method	O
you	O
can	O
see	O
that	O
method	O
throws	O
an	O
sfError404Exception	O
,	O
that	O
handles	O
respect	O
of	O
enviroment	O
.	O

In	O
dev	O
it	O
simple	O
throws	O
an	O
exception	O
and	O
in	O
prod	O
it	O
might	O
be	O
handle	O
via	O
set_exception_handler("my_handle")	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
override	O
this	O
it	O
's	O
public	O
)	O

Pardon	O
my	O
stupidity	O
,	O
anyone	O
knows	O
difference	O
between	O
them	O
?	O

Will	O
catch	O
and	O
rethrow	O
only	O
exceptions	O
derived	O
from	O
Exception	O
.	O

Will	O
catch	O
and	O
rethrow	O
any	O
exception	O
.	O

(	O
Edit	O
:	O
Since	O
CLRv2	B-Skill
,	O
all	O
exceptions	O
are	O
derived	O
from	O
Exception	O
so	O
this	O
is	O
identical	O
to	O
1	O
.	O

See	O
Eric	O
Lippert	O
's	O
comment	O
below	O
)	O
.	O

Will	O
catch	O
any	O
exception	O
derived	O
from	O
Exception	O
and	O
throw	O
it	O
again	O
,	O
thus	O
resetting	O
the	O
stack	O
trace	O
of	O
the	O
exception	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
difference	O
between	O
example	O
1	O
and	O
2	O
.	O

Both	O
rethrows	O
the	O
original	O
exception	O
,	O
and	O
both	O
catches	O
the	O
general	O
Exception	O
.	O

You	O
would	O
use	O
example	O
1	O
if	O
you	O
wanted	O
to	O
catch	O
a	O
more	O
specific	O
exception	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
DivisionByZeroException	O
.	O

For	O
the	O
last	O
example	O
,	O
you	O
are	O
not	O
re-throwing	O
the	O
exception	O
;	O
but	O
throwing	O
the	O
same	O
exception	O
object	O
that	O
you	O
caught	O
.	O

This	O
causes	O
the	O
exception	O
stacktrace	O
to	O
be	O
re-set	O
to	O
the	O
location	O
where	O
you	O
throw	O
it	O
which	O
might	O
be	O
a	O
problem	O
because	O
the	O
stacktrace	O
then	O
does	O
not	O
point	O
to	O
the	O
location	O
in	O
code	O
,	O
where	O
the	O
error	O
actually	O
occured	O
.	O

I	O
am	O
new	O
to	O
Durable	B-Skill
function	I-Skill
(	O
Orchestration	O
function	O
)	O
and	O
seen	O
sample	O
application	O
as	O
per	O
Microsoft	O
documentation.So	O
I	O
have	O
few	O
doubts	O
.	O

example	O
:	O

to	O
invoke	O
it	O
I	O
made	O
HTTP	O
POST	O
request	O
using	O
postman	B-Skill
so	O
request	O
processed	O
successfully	O
but	O
when	O
I	O
configured	O
different	O
verb	O
like	O

"	O

to	O

from	O
browser	O

with	O
"	O

"	O
error	O
in	O
console	B-Skill
.Why	O
this	O
happened	O
?	O

Can	O

any	O
Orchestration	O
function	O
with	O
in	O
timer	O

azure	B-Skill
function	I-Skill
?	O
